Luckily she has the support of her side business, which is retail. 

In a week, her business brings her about $27.  With this loan she wants to expand her poultry business by buying more chickens that she will eventually resell.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a single woman and has no children. She has been operating her food vendor business for the last five years. She owns a house with electricity, but no piped water. With the 35,000 KES loan she wants to start another business of selling fresh water. She will use the loan to purchase pipe and pay for the business license. Mariam's business is seasonal and it is her major challenge. Mariam hopes someday to open another fresh water stall in future. She decided to work with Yehu to get a loan to increase her business. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase  water pipe and pay for her business license.

loans.name: C5601 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Josephine was born in 1984. She is married with one child and two dependant relatives. No one in Josephine's family has an occupation. That's why Josephine has to work hard so that she develops her business. Josephine owns a business selling various products in her living space. This business is profitable, but she does not have enough money to invest. That is why she needs a loan. Josephine is the leader of a group called TUZAMURANE in the local language.

Josephine and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their investment so that they can satisfy their customers. Once this satisfaction is reached, Josephine and her group will get enough money, which will help them to sort out some family problems and business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman with three children who attend school. She has been selling CD's and Video cassettes for the last one and half years. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Fatuma’s other source of income is from her husband salary. With the Kshs 35,000 loan, she wants to buy a supply of CD and a glass CD shelf. She faces the major challenges of theft and seasonality. Her potential customers are the neighboring community and passersby. She hopes to open a big theater someday. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to get a loan and modify her business. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of CD's and glass a CD shelf.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita S. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs like bags of rice, beans and pulses to cook and sell.  Anita is 42 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 4 children and 3 only of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up another restaurant in a different area.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs like bags of rice, beans  and pulses to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Tacku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité TACKU LIGGEY fait partie du banc Villageois de NGUIDILE. Il est crée le 14 décembre 2008 et composé de 08 femmes toutes issues du même quartier.

Les femmes ont formé leur groupe par proximité et par affinité. Ce qui fait qu'elles développent un bon esprit de solidarité et de partage.

Madame Marème M., à gauche de la photo (en médaillon) est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants et a la charge d'un enfant qui lui est confié par des proches. 

Elle mène des activités diverses à savoir, la vente de mil, l'embouche ovine et l'élevage de poulets locaux. Elle a une expérience de plus d'une dizaine d'années dans ce domaine d'activité. Son crédit lui servira à faire la promotion de son activité en augmentant son niveau d'investissement et acheter plus de petits ruminants, de volailles et de mil. 

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la gestion de la famille, par exemple la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité.
texts.en:
The solidarity group TACKU LIGGEY is part of the Banc Villageois of Nguidile and was created on December 14, 2008. It is composed of eight women who are all from the same district. The women formed their group according to proximity and affinity. This means they are developing a good spirit of team work and sharing. Ms. Marème M. (see portrait inserted at the left in the photo) is the leader of the solidarity group. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She also has a child in her care who is entrusted to her by relatives. Marème operates diverse businesses, namely selling millet, fattening sheep, and raising local chickens. She has over ten years of experience in this business domain. Her loan will be used to advance her businesses by increasing her investments and buying more young ruminants, poultry, and millet. Her goal is to provide financial help to running the family in terms of health care, food, and schooling, as examples.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her investment capital with the aim of developing her businesses

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en: Anjelina Satariano is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and first class clothes at the marketplace. She is requesting a loan to stock shoes and sandles to sell.  Anjelina is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop and purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: Stock shoes and sandles to sell

loans.name: Alexi Abigail

texts.es:
Alexis de 26 años, vive en Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución) su casa es de caña, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propia tienda, comprando arroz y azúcar, para poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares. En ocasiones sus padres le ayudan, trabajando desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer, para poder surtir su tienda necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, enlatados, azúcar. 

En el futuro quiere surtir mas su tienda para tener mas ganancias y asi poder ayudar mas a sus padres en los gastos.
texts.en:
Alexis, 26, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a suburban area with dirt roads and eroding hills). Her house is made of cane and she has a grocery store in front part of her house. Little by little, making an effort, she was able to have her own shop, buying rice and sugar, in order to help her parents with household expenses. Sometimes her parents help her, working from early until sunset. To stock her shop, she needs a loan to buy rice, canned goods, and sugar. In the future she wants to restock her store to get more profits and thereby help help her parents more with expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, canned goods and sugar

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Mary is 42 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with four children, all attending school. She has been operating her boutique for the last five years. She rents a house with electricity and piped water.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to open another boutique branch. She sells her products at wholesale, at retail, at the market, from door to door and from home. Her major customers are tourists visiting the country and the neighboring communities. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. Mary hopes to supply her clothes internationally in future. She joined Yehu to get a loan to modify her boutique. Her greatest monthly expenses are high transport costs and rental bill.

loans.use: To open another boutique branch, purchase a bale of clothes and pay rental bills .

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité de SOPE MAME DIARRA fait partie du Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE. Il est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 04 femmes issues d'une même quartier. 

Elle fréquentent toutes le marché central de leur quartier pour mener des activités commerciales (vente de légumes, de poissons frais et/ou de denrées alimentaires)

Madame Faty D., debout à gauche de la photo, mise en médaillon en haut à gauche, est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants et a la charge d'une fille confiée par des proches. 

Elle est détentrice d'un stand au marché central de son quartier où elle vend des denrées alimentaires. Son nouveau prêt de 200.000 francs CFA lui permettra de renforcer sa marchandise (riz, sucre, huile végétale, tomate en conserve etc..

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "SOPE MAME DIARRA" is a member of the "Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE". It was created on December 14, 2008. He's composed of four women coming from the same neighborhood. They all sells products (vegetables, fresh fish, and / or food staples) at the central market in their neighborhood. Mrs. Faty D., standing on the left in the picture, and visible in the inset in the top left corner, is the one responsible for the solidarity group. She's 46 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She also has to support a girl entrusted to her by her family. She has a stall at the central market in her neighborhood, where she sells food products. Her new loan of XOF 200'000 will enable her to bolster her stock (rice, sugar, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, etc.). Her goal is to help her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Madelina

texts.en: Madelina P. is currently in the business of selling both dried and fresh fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock Irish potatoes, tomatoes and cooking oil to sell.  Madelina is 24 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a house to rent.

loans.use: Stock irish potatoes, tomatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To  restock items  like sugar, soap, tea leaves, salt, posho, cassava flour, etc

loans.name: Siama

texts.en:
Siama J. is 54 years old and is widowed with six children. Her children do not attend school.  

Siama is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal and firewood from home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dezi

texts.en:
Hard-working M. Dezi is a 45-year old married father of five children. He used to own a taxi and run a transport business, but now he operates a livestock business, rearing goats and cows he purchases from Ijumo Bushenyi.

With help from his wife, M. grazes the goats and cows and sells them later at a profit. He and his wife also run a banana-selling business. 

M. has fetched 480,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis, which has helped him meet his family responsibilities such as paying the children’s school fees. His goal is to add more livestock to his farm in order to earn more sales revenue in the near future. He needs this loan in order to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To restock his farm with more livestock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter W. M. is a married man with one pre-school age child. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. Peter joined Yehu in order to obtain a loan to uplift his standards of living. 

For the last two years, Peter has operated a barber shop, both as retail and from home. His main customers are mostly men and school-going children. He faces the major challenges of theft and machine breakdown. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), he wants to purchase a water heater and an electric hair-cutting machine. In the future, Peter hopes to open another barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase a water heater and electric hair-cutting machine.

loans.name: Mabel Antonia

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 60 años, resiD. en el Municipio D. Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, es casada, vive con el esposo una hija y dos sobrinas, tiene venta D. ropa y productos lácteos.
Inicio el negocio gracias a la ayuda D. la madre que le enseño, tiene el negocio en la casa D. avitación, para tener mejores venta ella sale a las calles D. la zona a ofrecer la ropa, Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en compra D. ropa. Blusas  para dama, faldas, pantalones para ambos sexos, vestidos, como también compra D. queso, crema, esto le permitirá contar con producto necesario para incrementar las ventas.
Las aspiraciones D. Mabel son ampliar el negocio, y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. la familia, atreves del trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Mabel is 60 years old and lives in the municipality of Concepción Batres, Usulután department. She is married and lives with her husband, one daughter and 2 nieces, and has a clothing and dairy product sale business. Mabel began this business thanks to the help of her mother, who taught her. Her business is located in her house but to have better sales she travels around the streets in the zone oselling clothes. She is seeking a loan to invest the purchase of more clothes such as women's blouses, skirts, pants for both sexes, dresses, as well as cheese and cream. The loan will allow her to have the necessary products to increase her sales. Mabel's aspirations are to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life, through her job and hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, cheese and cream

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
Digna de 36 años,  vive en Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución) tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte que readecuo de su casa. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propia tienda, comprando arroz, azúcar y  legumbres para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos estudiantiles de sus dos hijas.  Su esposo le ayuda atender la tienda después de trabajar, para poder surtir su tienda necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, enlatados, legumbres. 

En el futuro quiere surtir mas su tienda para tener mas ganancias y así poder ayudar al crecimiento intelectual de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Digna, 36, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a suburban area with dirt roads and eroding hills). She has a grocery shop in an area she fixed up in her home. Little by little, with effort, she has been able to have her own shop by buying rice, sugar and beans. She helps her husband with their daughter's educational expenses and he helps her at the store after work. To stock the store, she needs a loan to buy rice and canned vegetables. In the future she wants to restock her store to have more income to be able to help their children's intellectual growth.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, beans, canned goods

loans.name: C2158 Duhaguruke Group

texts.en:
Ester is 40 years old and married with three children who are 14, 12 and 10 years old. Ester takes care of one dependent who is 15 years old. Ester's husband works as a driver. Both, they work hard so that they keep progressing in their daily activities. Ester owns a business of selling eggs in the town. Her business is well organized because she employs one person so that her business runs smoothly. In this business, Ester has three years of experience. Ester is the leader of group which composed seven members; this group is called DUHAGURUKE in local language.

Ester and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business so that they satisfy their customers. This satisfaction will help them to earn more profits. With the extra money, Ester expects to create a new business of selling charcoal.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Sope Serigne Ababcar Sy Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE ABABACAR SY fait partie du Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE. Il est créé le 14 décembre 2008 et compte quatre femmes qui sont des cousines et issues toutes du même quartier. 

Le groupe a été formé par affinité et par centre d'intérêt, c'est-à-dire des femmes qui partage la même idéologie. 

Madjigène D., assise à gauche de la photo, et mise en médaillon, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 43 ans et mère de 7 enfants et tutrice de 03 autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle est vendeuse de friperies. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité en achetant plus de ballots de friperies. 

Elle contribue à l'épanouissement et au bien-être de la famille de par le soutien financier qu'elle fait à son mari.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE SERIGNE ABABACAR SY is part of the Banc Villageois of Nguidile and was created on December 14, 2008. It is composed of four women who are cousins from the same district. The group was formed according to affinity and by interest center, that is, women who share the same ideology. Ms. Madjigène D. (seated at the left in the photo and appearing in the inserted portrait) is the leader of the solidarity group. She is 43 years old and the mother of seven children. She is also the guardian of three others who are entrusted to her by relatives. Madjigène sells second-hand clothing. Her new loan will enable her to develop her business further by buying more bails of used clothing. She helps her family to thrive with the financial support she provides to her husband.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bails of used clothing

loans.name: Khalfan

texts.en:
Khalfan M. is a married man with no children. He owns a home with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and transport costs. He decided to join Yehu in order to obtain a loan to raise his standard of living in the future. 

Khalfan has operated a barber shop for three years, and he faces the major challenge of theft. His wife is a hairdresser by profession and she contributes to the family's basic needs. His wife's contributions are his other source of income. 

He would like to use this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh) to pay the rent to start another barber shop. His potential customers are men and school-going children. Khalfan hopes to someday own a salon as well as another barber shop.

loans.use: To start another barber shop, purchase hair-cutting machine, and pay for rent.

loans.name: Sope Khalifa Malick Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE KHALIFA MALICK fait partie du Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE. Il est composé de 04 femmes qui sont du même quartier. Elles sont âgées environs de 30 ans exceptée la responsable qui est née en 1952 (58 ans)

Le groupe est créé le 14 décembre 2008 et les femmes qui le composent se sont organisées par affinité et par liens de parenté. 

Madame Fama S., la plus âgée du groupe, en deuxième position à partir de la gauche de la photo, en médaillon, et en écharpe rouge, est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 58 ans, elle est mariée sans enfant mais a la charge d'un enfant qu'elle a plus ou moins adopté. 

Elle fait de la transformation et vente de produits locaux tel le mil. Elle le transforme en farine ou en couscous et le vend dans le quartier. 

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter assez de mil et de faire un stock consistant pour mieux développer son activité.

Son ambition est d'avoir une autonomie financière. Et son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE KHALIFA MALICK is part of the Banc Villageois of Nguidile. It is compose of four women from the same district. They are about 30 years old, except for the leader, who is 58 (born in 1952). The group was established on December 14, 2008. The women composing it have organized themselves according to affinity and kinship. Ms. Fama S., the eldest in the group, is wearing a red scarf in the photo (second from the right and appearing in the inserted portrait). The leader of the solidarity group, she is 58 years old, married, without children. But she has a child in her care who she has more or less adopted. Fama processes and sells local produce, such as millet. She makes flour or couscous and sells them in her area. Her loan will enable her to buy enough millet and to build up a substantial inventory for developing her business further. Her ambition is to have some financial autonomy. Her goal is to provide for her family in terms of food and health care, as examples.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying millet

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia del Carmen tiene 45 años, reside en el Municipio del Tránsito, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, se dedica a la venta de tamales y venta de ropa de forma ambulante (por las calles). 
El negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, a causa de necesidad de trabajo, los hijos le ayudan también con  el negocio, ella necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropa: camisas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, ropa para niños, ella está considerando vender estos productos de forma ambulante para obtener mayores ventas. Este préstamo le permitirá continuar con el negocio, satisfacer demanda de los clientes, ofreciéndole estilos nuevos de ropa, mejorar los ingresos.
El sueños es crecer los negocios apoyar a los dos hijos, brindarle una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Idalia del Carmen is 45 years old and lives in the town of Tránsito, located in the San Miguel department. She is a single mother with two children who depend on her for support. She sells tamales and clothing on foot. She began this business by her own initiative because she needed work and her children help her with the business. She needs a loan in order to invest in clothing: shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, children’s clothing. She is considering selling these items on foot in order to obtain better sales. This loan will allow her to continue her business, satisfy her customer demand, offer new styles of clothing, and increase her income. She hopes to grow her business, support her children, and provide economic stability for them.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is a single woman with two children who both attend school. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent, school fees, and food. She decided to work with Yehu in order to improve her living conditions. 

For three years, Elizabeth has operated a business selling wholesale firewood to companies and schools. She faces the major challenge of transportation. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Elizabeth wants to purchase a power saw. In the future, she hopes to have a larger wholesale firewood business.

loans.use: To purchase a power saw for cutting firewood to sell.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María Antonia tiene 43 años, reside en Concepción Batres, Departamento de Usulután, vive con su hija de 26 años y un nieto de 2 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.
Ella aprendió este negocio, por la madre desde muy joven le enseño  sobre el cuidado y alimentación de Cerdos, no posee horario de trabajo, su experiencia es una de las ventajas del negocio. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar Cerdos y concentrado, para alimentarlos y cuidarlos, hasta que estén listos para la venta, esto contribuirá a mantener el negocio de María, generando estabilidad económica a esta familia.
Los sueños de María son ampliar la granja, que la economía familia sea sostenible para apoyar en las necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is 43 years-old and lives with her 26 year-old daughter and 2 year-old grandson in Concepcion Batres (in the Department of Usulutan) where she raises pigs. At a very young age, she learned about the care and feeding of pigs from her mother. She doesn't have a set work schedule, but she possesses a lot of experience running this business. She's requesting a loan to buy more cattle and feed so she can raise them until they are ready to be sold. This loan will allow her to maintain her business, and to provide for her family's well-being. Maria also hopes to one day expand her farm so she can continue to support her family's basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Vanesa,  ella tiene 26 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un tienda de venta de celulares y de venta de productos de belleza por catálogo; desde hace 1 año, La socia trae celulares y repuestos de estos de la ciudad de Puno (Juliaca), y también viaja a la ciudad de Lima para traer novedades, ella es muy emprendedora y le gustaría estudiar en la universidad, ella sabe que todo es posible con mucha dedicación y está a punto de juntar un capital de trabajo para traer más productos y después desea inscribirse a la universidad y estudiar enfermería, La socia  solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de venta de celulares.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Qori Orcco" communal bank. She lives in the Urcos district of the Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cusco. This member is Ms. Vanesa. She is 26 years old and lives with her partner in the Urcos district. She works in retail sales. She has a store where she sells cell phones, as well as beauty products that she sells through a catalog. For a year now, she has brought cell phones and spare parts for them from the city of Puno (Juliaca), and she also travels to Lima to bring back novelties. She is a very enterprising woman and she would like to study at the university. She knows that anything is possible with a lot of dedication, and she is at the point of just getting together enough working capital to be able to bring in more products. After, she would like to enroll herself in the university to study nursing. Vanesa is requesting this loan to improve her business selling cell phones. This member values and is infinitely grateful for the loan offered to her, as it will make it possible for her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Likewise, she promises to comply with her repayments according to the schedule agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve her business selling cell phones

loans.name: Irma Eloisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito D. Urcos en la provincia D. Quispicanchis y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Irma; ella tiene 55 años D. edad y La socia es casada y vive en el distrito D. Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella se dedica a la D. madera desD. hace 6 años atrás, la socia es natural D. Huaro el pueblo del pan, desD. muy niña trabajo para poder ayudar a sus papas con la crianza y educación D. sus hermanitos menores, ella se dedico a los cultivos D. maíz, papa; también a la venta D. pan con sus mamá y años más tarD. con su hermana, ella vendía panes en el paradero ahora la socia con su negocio propio y junto a su conyugue están D. lleno en el negocio D. la carpintería. La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para la carpintería.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Irma belongs to the communal bank, Qori Orcco. She lives in the Urcos District in the Quispicanchis Province and Cusco department. Ms. Irma is 55 years old, married, and lives in the Urcos district. She has worked in wood retail for 6 years. She is from Huaro, a bread producing village. Since she was a small girl, she has worked to help her parents with the rearing and education of her younger siblings. She grew corn and potatoes. She also sold bread with her mother and, many years later, with her sister. She would sell bread at a bus stop. Now she has her own business that she and her husband devote themselves to. She is requesting a loan to purchase carpentry tools. Irma values and is infinitely grateful for the loan since it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She commits to making the loan payments in the stipulated time period.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three children who all attend school. She rents a house with no electricity but with piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Christine's husband works with the Kenya Port Authorities and he contributes to the upbringing of their children and to the provision of their family's needs. 

For the last six years, Christine has sold charcoal to hotels and to her neighboring communities. She experiences the major challenge of theft and seasonality. She decided to work with Yehu in order to get a loan and expand her business. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Christine wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal and pay for her business license. In the future, Christine hopes to have another branch and supply charcoal to a larger market.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of charcoal and pay for a business license.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 50 años de edad y La socia es viuda y tiene 8 hijos y de los cuales 5 son de ellos son independientes, la socia se dedica al vivir de sus rentas, ella alquila habitaciones y vive de esa renta, ella aún ayuda a tres de sus hijos con los estudios, la socia es una mujer muy cariñosa y adora a sus hijos, motivo por el cual la llevó a tener tantos hijos, ahora ella se encuentra sola en lo que respecta al apoyo económico, la socia cría animales menores y está pensando en venderlos para que le genere un ingreso extra. La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores y apoyara  a sus tres hijos con los estudios.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Qori Orcco". She lives in the Urcos district in Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cuzco. Her name is Maria; she is 50 years old, and widowed with 8 children - 5 of whom are independent. Maria survives off her rental income she receives from renting rooms. She still financially supports three of her childrens' studies. Maria is very sweet and loves her children, which is why she had so many. As she is now solely dependent on her own income, Maria raises small animals and hopes to sell them for a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more animals, and help her children pay for school. Maria is very grateful for the opportunity to receive this loan that will let her grow her business and improve her quality of life. As such, she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small animals and make school payments

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Yony; ella tiene 31 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un puesto ene le mercado central de Urcos, ella vende carne de res desde hace 4 años, la socia compra carne al por mayor del camal y lo lava, corta en trozos y los exhibe en su stand del mercado, ella dice que este negocio le va muy bien y ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más carne del camal e incrementar sus ventas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Qori Orcco". She lives in the Urcos district in Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cuzco. Her name is Mrs. Yony. She is 31 years old, and lives with her partner and 3 children in Urcos. She works in business, and has a small post at the city market where she has sold meat for the past 4 years. She purchase meat wholesale, cleans it, cuts it, and sells it at her stand. Mrs. Yony says that her business is going well and has improved her life. She is asking for a loan to purchase more meat, and increase her sales. Mrs. Yony greatly values the opportunity to receive this loan, and promises to make her payments in full and on-time.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat for sales.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE. 

Le groupe est composé de six femmes qui sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 02 enfants. Elles sont solidairement unies et sont issues du même quartier. 

Madame Coumba M., troisième à partir sur la gauche de la photo, et en médaillon, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché central de Louga. le soir, à son retour du marché, elle vend des beignets dans le quartier. 

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de légumes afin de mieux développer son activité. Elle voudrait également maintenir sa vente de beignets.

Son objectif est de contribuer financièrement à la prise ne charge de la famille. Par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU was established on December 14, 2008.  It is part of the Banc Villageois of Nguidile and is composed of six women who are all married and mothers of at least two children.  All from the same district, the women are united in solidarity.  Ms. Coumba M. is the group's leader (third from the left in the photo and appearing in the inserted portrait).  She is 41 years old, married, and a mother of two children.  Coumba sells vegetables at the Louga central market.  In the evenings, upon returning from the market, she sells beignets.  Her loan will enable her to buy more vegetables in order to develop her business further.  She would also like to keep up her sales of beignets.  Her goal is to provide financial help for covering family expenses, for example, in terms of food and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 45 años de edad, reside en el municipio El Tránsito, departamento de San Miguel, es padre soltero vive son su hijo de dos años, se dedica a la venta de ropa y artículos para el hogar. 
El negocio lo aprendió, muy joven por la necesidad económica y la falta de empleo, el vende ropa y artículos para el hogar de forma ambulante por la calles del Tránsito, no tiene horario fijo, es un padre responsable, trabajador y honesto, actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropa  camisas, pantalones, vestidos, ropa para niños, con nuevos estilos para ofrecer a su clientes. Esto contribuirá a mejorar el negocio de Miguel, aumentar sus ventas para ayudar a su pequeño hijo y suplir las necesidades.
Las aspiraciones son tener su propio negocio, mejorar los ingresos para apoyar a su pequeño hijo y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is 45, and lives in the Transit municipality of San Miguel department. He is a single father and lives with his two-year old son. Migual sells clothes and housewares. Migual learned about business at a young age due to difficulty finding work. He sells his items walking around the streets of Transit, and does not have a fixed schedule. He is a responsible father, hard worker, and honest. He is asking for a loan to invest in buying clothes - shirts, pants, dresses, childrens clothing, and new items to offer his clients. This loan would improve Miguel's business, and increase his sales and income. Miguel hopes to have his own business one day, and earn enough to support his young son, and have a nice quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Trinidad; ella tiene 45 años de edad y La socia es casada y  vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia tienen 4 hijos y ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un stand de venta de carne en la plaza central de Urcos, la socia trabaja desde hace 19 años, con este negocio ella adquirió su casa, los estudios de sus hijos y hoy en día su carro. La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar carne  al por mayor e incrementar sus ventas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Qori Orcco". She lives in the Urcos district in Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cuzco. Her name is Mrs. Trinidad. She is 45 years old, married, and lives in Urcos. She has 4 kids, and works selling meat in the central plaza at Urcos, which she has done for the past 19 years. Using income generated from this activity, Mrs. Trinidad bought her house, paid for her childrens' school and bought a car. She is asking for a loan to purchase more meat to increase her sales. Mrs. Trindad greatly appreciates the opportunity to receive this loan, and promises to make her payments on-time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat for sale.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn O. A. is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. Her husband works in a garage and helps in the upbringing of the children. 

Merlyn rents a house with electricity and piped water. She cites food and rent as her greatest monthly expenses. Her main aim of working with Yehu is to obtain a loan to raise her standard of living. 

For the past two years, Merlyn has sold fresh water, handbags, and donuts. Her customers are mostly women and neighbors. She sells her goods both wholesale and retail, and she works from a shop, door-to-door, and from home. Merlyn faces the major challenge of high transport costs and seasonality. 

With this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Merlyn wants to pay a rental deposit for her shop and to renovate her water sprinkler system. She hopes to have a large wholesale business selling handbags in town someday.

loans.use: To pay a rental deposit for her shop and to renovate the water sprinkler system.

loans.name: Rosmery Susan

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Rosmery; ella es conviviente y tiene un pequeño hijo, ella vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, exactamente a la artesanía, ella compra artesanía y bisutería al por mayor y vende en una tienda pequeña al público en general. La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía y abastecer su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Qori Orcco". She lives in the Urcos district in Quispicanchis province, in the department of Cuzco. Her name is Mrs. Rosmery. She lives with her partner and her small son. She works selling handicrafts and costume jewelry, which she buys in bulk and then sells at a small store. She is asking for a loan to purchase more inventory and stock her store. Mrs. Trindad greatly appreciates the opportunity to receive this loan and improve her quality of life, and promises to make her payments on-time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Maritza; ella tiene 37 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, La socia es conviviente y vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un pequeño stand de venta de pan desde hace 11 años, la socia misma va temprano por las mañanas a la panadería y compra todo tipo de panes al por mayor y calientitos, ella los envuelve muy bien y en una canasta los lleva a vender al paradero del poblado, ella espera pacientemente desde las 6 a.m. que empiezan a pasar todos los carros con destino a las diferentes ciudades y ofrece su pan, la socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar panes al por mayor y venderlos.

La socia agradece y valora el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “QORI ORCCO”. She lives in the Urcos district in the Quispicanchis province, Cuzco department. Her name is Maritza and she is 37 years old and has 4 children. She is in a common law marriage and works in retail. She has a small stand where she has sold bread for 11 years. She goes herself early mornings to the bakers and buys all types of bread warm and wholesale. She wraps them up in a basket and sells them at the town traffic stop. She waits patiently, starting at six a.m., when the cars begin to go by on their way to different cities, and she offers her bread. The member is asking for the loan to buy bread wholesale and sell it. Maritza is grateful for and values the loan, since it allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. She is also committed to making her payments according to the agreed upon schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy bread wholesale and sell it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two bicyles, hotdog buns, ketchup, mayonnaise.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia tiene 3 hijos, se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene una tienda de venta de pasamanería en la plaza principal de este pueblo y ella trabaja vendiendo esto desde hace 11 años, negocio que iniciaron sus padres y que le heredaron a su hija desde muy jovencita, la venta de pasamanería significa (venta de accesorios para uso personal, accesorio para la oficina, venta de shampoo, venta de accesorios de limpieza en general, venta de botones, venta de accesorios de vestir).  La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería parea implementar su pasamanería.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the communal bank “QORI ORCCO.” She lives in the Urcos district of Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco. Ana is 35 years old, and lives with a partner in the Urcos district. She has 3 children, and works in retail trade. She has a store where she sells pasamanería (this term refers to personal accessories, office accessories, shampoo, general cleaning accessories, buttons, and ornamental trimmings for garments) in the main plaza of this town, and she has worked selling these items for 11 years. The business was started by her parents, and she inherited it from them when she was very young. She is requesting a loan to buy this type of merchandise to restock her pasamanería store. Ana values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted, because it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Also, she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (personal, home and office accessories) to restock her pasamanería store

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El  socio vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es el Sr. Feliciano; el tiene 61 años de edad y El socio es viudo y tiene dos hijos es natural de Yucay y radica en Urcos desde hace más de 20 años, él tiene trabajando en venta de medicina natural cerca de 40 años, El socio es una persona responsable y con muchos deseos de superación y apoya a sus hijos e todo lo que puede, él socio suele viajar y traer productos naturales para vender en su tienda ubicada en el centro de la plaza de Urcos. El socio  solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de medicina natural para vender.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Feliciano belongs to the “Qori Orcco” Communal Bank and lives in Urcos district, province of Quispicanchis, Department of Cusco. He is 61 years old, a widower, with 2 children, and was born in Yucay. Feliciano has lived in Urcos for more than 20 years and has been selling natural medicines for over 40 years. He is a responsible person with a great desire to get ahead and help his children in every way he can. He wants to travel and bring natural products to sell in his store, located in the center of the plaza in Urcos. Feliciano requests a loan to buy natural medicine products to sell. He values and is infinitely thankful for the credit offered, because this permits his business to grow and his quality of life to improve. Feliciano commits himself to comply with his payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING NATURAL MEDICINE PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Dzidza

texts.en:
Dzidza T. T. is a divorced woman with six children. She has five girls who are all married and one boy who attends school. She owns a house with no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, Dzidza has operated a vegetable stall business, selling vegetables both retail and from home to her neighbors. Dzidza faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She decided to join Yehu in order to get a loan to improve her business. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), she wants to purchase one sack of green vegetables and onions. In the future, she hopes to open another vegetable stall and sell vegetables wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of onions and green vegetables.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is a married woman with two boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house with no electricity or piped water, and her greatest monthly expense is food. Rose's husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's needs. 

For the past ten years, Rose has operated a tailoring business from home. Her customers are mostly neighbors. She faces the major challenge of seasonality and low turn up of clients. She decided to work with Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business. 

With this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Rose wants to purchase material, lingerie, and thread. In the future, she hopes to open a dress-making college.

loans.use: To purchase material, lingerie, and thread.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 42 años de edad y La socia es casada y vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia tiene 5 hijos todos ellos estudiantes y tres casados, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un pequeño stand de venta de ponches y chicha de quinua, maíz morado, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio ella quiere comprar vasos, jarras y baldes para mejorar su presentación ambulatoria.
 
 La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the communal bank “QORI ORCCO." She lives in the Urcos district of Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco. Juana is 42 years old, married, and lives in the Urcos district. She has 5 children, all of whom are students and 3 of whom are married. She works in retail trade. She has a small stand where she sells punch and chichas (beverages) made of quinoa and purple corn. She requests a loan to invest in her business. She wants to buy drinking glasses, pitchers, and buckets to improve the appearance of her business. Juana values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted, because it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life, and she also promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy drinking glasses, pitchers and buckets to improve the appearance of her business

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla Patricia tiene 27 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es soltera vive con  los padres y dos hermanos, tiene una tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad.
Hace cuatro años que administra la tienda, los productos los traslada de la ciudad a la zona rural  donde actualmente está ubicada el negocio, ella solicita un préstamo para construir un cuarto, para dormitorio, ella comprara materia de Construcción, cemento, hierro, ladrillo, arena, grava. Contribuyendo a mejorar la vivienda, ya que ella necesita un dormitorio y tener su espacio individual.
Las aspiraciones de Karla son crecer el negocio cubrir necesidades básicas de los padres y propias.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia is 27 years old and lives in San Miguel. She is single and lives with her parents and two siblings. She has a store selling products that are basic necessities. She has been running the store for 4 years. She transports the products from the city to the rural area where her business is located. She requests a loan to build a bedroom. She will buy construction materials such as cement, iron, bricks, sand, and gravel. This will improve the home, since she needs to have a bedroom and have her own personal space. Karla aspires to grow her business so that she can cover the basic needs of her parents and herself.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, bricks, sand and gravel

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama T. D. is a divorced woman with five children, one girl and four boys. Three of her children attend school, while the last-born is still too young for school. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Dama has sold fried fish to her neighbors, both door-to-door and also from home. She has no other source of income. Dama faces the major challenge of transportation and seasonality, moving from door-to-door during rainy seasons. She decided to work with Yehu because of its sustainable financial services to socio-economically marginalized rural entrepreneurs. 

With this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Dama wants to purchase fresh water fish and of 50kgs of cooking oil. In the future, she hopes to build a permanent fish shop.

loans.use: To purchase fresh water fish and 50kgs of cooking oil.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Leonarda; ella tiene 45 años de edad y La socia es casada y tienen 3 hijos, ella vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un carrito salchipapero, ella vende pollipapas en la plaza central de Urcos desde las 6 p.m. desde hace 10 años atrás, la socia compra los pollos  (piernas), las papas, y los fríe, a este plato le acompañan, ensaladas y tal vez al gusto del cliente arroz chaufa o tallarines delgados, acompañados de mayonesa, mostaza, aceitunas, chekchup. Lo vende en platos descartables de tecno por con su tenedor, ella también vende gaseosas personales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aceite, papas, pollos y algunos ingredientes más para implementar su negocio y tener mejor salida, ella también comprara sillas de plástico para que sus clientes se sienten mientras esperan su pollipapas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “QORI ORCCO” Banco Comunal and she lives in the Urcos district in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco. Her name is Señora Leonarda. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. She lives in the Urcos district and works in the retail business. She has a "salchipapero" cart and for the last 10 years she has sold "pollipapas" (a Peruvian meal consisting of potatoes and a piece of chicken) in the main square in Urcos from 6pm. She buys chicken legs and potatoes and fries them. This dish is served with salad, or perhaps, if the customer prefers, with Chinese fried rice or thin noodles, garnished with mayonnaise, mustard, olives or catsup. She uses disposable plates and she also sells sodas. Señora Leonarda is asking for a loan to buy oil, potatoes, chicken and other ingredients to keep her business going and improve it. She will also buy some plastic chairs so that her customers can sit down while they wait for their "pollipapas." She appreciates and is very grateful for this loan as it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She is therefore committed to making her repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 61 años de edad y La socia es ciudad y tiene 5 hijos independientes todos ellos,  vive en el distrito de Urcos,  y la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un stand de venta de pollos y pescado en el mercado central de Urcos, la socia tiene este negocio desde hace 23 años, la socia con este negocio pudo comprar su casita y construirla, también ayudo en los estudios de sus hijos y la educación en general, ella muy feliz agradece a Dios por todo lo que le dio y poder seguir haciendo algo para ella es muy confortable, La socia es muy feliz formando parte del grupo de este banco comunal y aquí ella tiene una gran escusa para encontrarse con sus amistades y compartir con ellas.. La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar carne de pollo, y pescado de sus proveedores y de este modo mejorar sus ventas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “QORI ORCCO” communal bank. She lives in the Urcos district of Quispicanchis province, in the Department of Cusco. Her name is Juana and she is 61 years old. She is a widow and has 5 children, all of them grown and independent. She works in the retail trade in the Urcos district where she lives. She has a stand selling chicken and fish in the Urcos central market. Juana has operated this business for 23 years. Thanks to this work, she has been able to buy and build a house of her own. The proceeds from her business have also helped pay for her children's studies and their education in general. She is very happy and grateful to God for everything she has been given, and she is very comfortable with continuing to work. She is very happy to be a member of her communal bank; it also gives her a very good excuse to meet with her friends and share with them. She is requesting this loan to buy chicken and fish from her suppliers and thus increase her sales. Juana infinitely values and appreciates the loan granted to her, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. Accordingly, she is committed to making all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chicken and fish from her suppliers to increase her sales

loans.name: Sope Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE KHADIM est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier.

le Groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE. Les membres qui le composent se sont unis solidairement et développent une même esprit de groupe, un esprit de partage et de fraternité. 

Madame Seynabou D., assise à gauche de la photo emmitouflée d'une écharpe noire et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans; elle est mariée et mère de o5 enfants dont 03 filles. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes au marché central de Louga. Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en légumes. 

Son objectif est d'avoir une autonomie financière. Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE KHADIM was established on December 14, 2008.  It is composed of eight women who are all from the same district.  The group is part of the Banc Villageois of Nguidile.  The members composing it are united in solidarity and are developing a spirit of teamwork,  sharing, and sisterhood.  Ms. Seynabou D., who is seated at the left in the photo and snug in her black scarf (also see inserted portrait), is the group's leader.  She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children, including three daughters. Seynabou has a small business selling vegetables at the Louga central market.  Her loan will allow her to bolster her supplies of vegetables.  Her goal is to have some financial autonomy.  She is helping to support the family, for example, in terms of food and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 50 años de edad y La socia es natural de Sicuani, situado a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, ella es conviviente y tienen 3 hijos, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un puesto de venta de pollos y pescados desde hace 16 años en el mercado central de Urcos, ella junto a sus otras compañeras de gremio piden al proveedor la cantidad que requieran en carne s de pollo y pescados frescos del norte de nuestro país. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.  

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the communal bank “QORI ORCCO”. She lives in the district of Urcos in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco. She is 50 years old and comes from Sicuani, located 3 hours from Cusco City. She lives with her partner and has 3 children. She has sold chicken and fish from a stall in the central market of Urcos for the last 16 years. She and her fellow colleagues in the union order the quantity of chicken and fresh fish they need from the supplier in the northern part of the country. She is seeking the loan to buy merchandise. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan given, since it allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. Moreover, she commits to making all of her loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El socio vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es él Sr. Eleuterio; el tiene 43 años de edad y él socio es casado y tiene 3 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Urcos  él socio trabaja en el comercio minorista desde hace 9 años, el vende plásticos en el mercado central de Urcos, El socio tiene su stand en el mercado, le va muy bien, el viaje con frecuencia a la ciudad de Lima o  Juliaca, para traer mercadería de todo tipo y forma, El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio y viajar a traer plásticos para su venta futura.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Señor Eleuterio is a member of the communal bank "QORI ORCCO". He lives in the Urcos district in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco. He is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. He has been working in retail for the past 9 years. He sells plastics in the Urcos central market where he has a stand. Things are going well for him. He travels frequently to the cities of Lima and Juliaca to bring back different kinds of merchandise. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business and to travel in order to bring back plastics to sell. He values and is infinitely grateful for the loan, as this will allow him to grow his business and to improve his quality of life. His is committed to repaying his loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business and buy plastics to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El  socio vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Juan Carlos ; el tiene 27 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo menor, él socio  vive en el distrito de Urcos, él socio  trabaja desde muy jovencito aprendió a manejar y se dedica a ser taxista, con todo lo que fue ganado e las carreras, el completó para comprarse un auto, El socio trabaja desde los 15 años y ya tienen su casita, es un joven muy emprendedor y muy correcto.  El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su auto.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio de taxi y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “QORI ORCCO” communal bank. He lives in the Urcos district of Quispicanchis province, in the Department of Cusco. His name is Juan Carlos, and he is 27 years old. He has a live-in partner and one small child. He lives in the Urcos district and has worked since he was very young, learning to drive and becoming a taxi driver. Saving what he earned over the years, he was able to buy his own car. He has worked since he was 15, and he already has a small house of his own. He is a very enterprising and very well-mannered young man. He is requseting the loan in order to buy spare parts for his car. Juan Carlos infinitely values and appreciates the loan granted to him, since it will allow him to improve his taxi business and his quality of life. Accordingly, he is committed to making all of his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Yonny; ella tiene 23 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo pequeño aún, ella  vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella en el mercado central de Urcos una tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende todo abarrotes en su pequeño stand, compra la mercadería de los almacenes gigantes para que así le resulte un poco más de ingresos al momento de venderlos, La socia es una mujer muy joven pero muy dada a los negocios La socia  solicita el préstamo para invertir en su pequeño negocio y comprar mercadería como arroz, fideos, azúcar y mucho mas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank. The member lives in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Yonny is the member. She is 23, in a common-law marriage, and has one child who is still little. She lives in the Urcos district. The member has a small business, a grocery store, in the Urcos central market. She sells all types of groceries in her small stand. She buys the merchandise from giant warehouses. That way she gets a little more income when she sells the merchandise. She is a very young woman, but she is given to business. She is requesting a loan to invest in her small business. She will buy merchandise like rice, noodles, sugar, and much more. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. This allows her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life. She pledges to make her payments on time. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (rice, noodles, sugar, and others)

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Jaqueline; ella tiene 26 años de edad y La socia es natural de Urcos es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos pequeños,   la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene una pequeña canasta dónde vende pan de todo tipo en los paraderos de buses, ella espera impacientemente desde las 5 a 6 de la mañana que paren los buses para que los pasajeros puedan bajar y tal vez comprar sus alimentos. La socia compra de la panadería todas las mañanitas muy temprano los panes y los envuelve con telas blancas para que no pierdan la suavidad y el frescor. La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar pan al por mayor y distribuirlos por todas las tiendas y también para ella.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank. The member lives in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Jaqueline is the member. She is 26 years old, and she is from Urcos. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has three small children. She is a small business woman. She has a small basket where she sells all kinds of bread at the bus stops. She impatiently waits from five to six in the morning for the busses to stop. When the passengers are able to get off the bus they might buy her food. The member buys the bread from the bakery very early in the morning. She wraps them in white cloths so they do not lose their softness or their freshness. The member is requesting a loan to buy bread wholesale. She will distribute it to all of the stores, and some of bread is for her. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. This allows her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Esther; ella tiene 30 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo , ella vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un stand de venta de panes ella vende panes en el paradero de Urcos todos los días se le encuentra allá desde las 6 a.m; ella espera a que pasen los buses con destino a diferentes ciudades y cuando hacen su parada aquí en este punto ella les ofrece sus panes calientitos para el viaje.  La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar panes, canasta nueva, silla.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank. The member lives in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Esther is the member. She is 30 years old. She is in a common-law marriage, and she has one child. She lives in the Urcos district, and she is a small businesswoman. She has a stand where she sells bread. She sells at the bus stops in Urcos. She is there everyday starting at 6:00 a.m. She waits for the busses going to different cities. When they make their stop where she is waiting, she offers her warm bread for the trip. The member is requesting a loan to buy bread, a new basket, and a chair. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. This allows her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, a new basket, and a chair

loans.name: Sope Serigne Amdy Fall Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE AMDY FALL est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il fait parti du Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE et composé de 5 femmes issues du même quartier.

Les membres du groupe développent un même esprit, un esprit de solidarité et d'entre-aide. Elles tiennent des rencontres périodiques d'information et de concertation. 

Madame Faniang D., assise au milieu sur la photo (en médaillon) est responsable du groupe de solidarité. elle est âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charge. 

Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché central Louga. Elle pratique cette activité depuis sa jeunesse, elle est alors dotée d'une très bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité.

Avec son prêt elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en légumes afin de mieux développer son activité. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture, la dépense quotidienne, la santé etc.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE SERIGNE AMDY FALL was established on December 14, 2008.  It is part of the Banc Villageois of Nguidile and is composed of five women from the same district.  The group members are developing a spirit of solidarity and mutual aid.  They hold periodic informational meetings and discussions.  Ms. Faniang D. (seated in the middle in the photo and in the inserted portrait) is the leader of the solidarity group.  She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of eight children to support.  Faniang sells vegetables at the Louga central market.  She has been in this business since her youth.  She is thus bestowed with very good experience in this business domain.  With this loan, she is going to increase her inventory of vegetables in order to develop her business further.  Her goal is to support her husband to support the family, for example, in terms of food, day-to-day expenses, health care, etc.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables and other condiments

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene  48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 28 años se dedica en la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, así como algunos artículos para el hogar. Es así que todos los días recorre las calles y realiza visitas a domicilio de sus clientes, en donde ofrece los productos ya sea por catalogo o por muestras que posee, de esa manera se hace más efectiva la venta. Durante todo este tiempo ha visto que la venta de sus productos es rentable, pero tiene sus riesgos al momento de dejar a crédito, por toro lado le es ventajoso por que puede disponer de su tiempo para atender a su familia. Tiene planes mas adelante, como disponer de capital y vender más productos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de cosméticos al por mayor y algunos instrumentos sencillos de cocina como set de cucharones, azucareros, siendo estos artículos de mucha demanda por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 48 and lives with her husband and 3 children in her own home. For more than 28 years she has sold cosmetics via catalogue as well as some household articles. Every day she travels the streets, making visits to her clients' homes where she offers products via catalogue or samples, in this way maximising her sales. During all this time she has seen that selling her products is profitable, but has its risks in the moment when she sells on credit, but overall it is advantageous as she can structure her time so that she can attend to her family. Hermelinda has plans in the future, such as to arrange capital and sell more products. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very happy knowing that she has financial support. She has always been responsible with her payments, and is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people. She thanks these people who will be the committee for the loan she is seeking and it will be very useful for her business's progress. With the loan she is seeking Hermelinda will invest in the purchase of bulk quantities of cosmetics and some kitchen implements such as ladles, sugar bowls, as these articles are in great demand by her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar más productos de belleza y artículos de cocina para la venta.

loans.name: Edwin Ulises

texts.es:
Edwin Ulises tiene 34 años de edad reside en el municipio de Moncagua, departamento de San Miguel, es casado, vive en casa del padre, con su hija Juana de 12 años de edad y la esposa, el tiene un chalet donde vende comida y bebida.
Inicialmente el trabajaba como repartidor de bebida carbonatadas, luego alquilo el local en el parque de Moncagua el negocio se llama Chalet Yany,  el  cual tiene ya hace 6 años de administrarlo,  está solicitando un préstamo para comprar productos para elaborar comida y ofrecer bebidas refrescantes,cafe, pan. asi mismo le gustaría invertir en otros artículos nuevos. Zapatos, pañuelos, bolsones esto contribuirá a fortalecer el negocio que le permita salir adelante con las necesidades básicas.
Las objetivos de Edwin son obtener ingresos para el sustento de la familia, apoyar a la hija con los estudios, que termine una profecion universitaria para que se defianda mejor en la vida.
texts.en:
Edwin Ulises is 34 years old and lives in the municipality of Moncagua in the department of San Miguel. He is married and lives in his father's house with his wife and his 12-year-old daughter Juana. He has a kiosk where he sells food and drink. Initially he worked as a carbonated beverages deliveryman, then he rented a unit in Moncagua park. His business is called Chalet Yany and he has been running it for six years. Edwin Ulises is asking for a loan to buy basic ingredients for making meals and serving cold drinks, coffee and bread. He would also like to invest in other new items, such as shoes, scarves and purses. This would strengthen his business and allow him to get by with life's basic necessities. His aim is to make an income to support his family, and pay for his daughter's studies, including university, so that she can get along better in life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients for making meals and serving cold drinks, coffee and bread

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra.
