Elsa; ella tiene 29 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos y es conviviente, ella  vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella elabora panes y los vende en diferentes puntos del pueblo, la socia trabaja con este negocio desde hace 18 años, ella también tiene una canasta en la que pone los diferentes panes y los lleva todas las mañanas a vender en el paradero. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar levadura de cerveza, harina y otros para la elaboración de panes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “QORI ORCCO” communal bank. She lives in the Urcos district of Quispicanchis province, in the Department of Cusco. Her name is Elsa, and she is 29 years old. She has a live-in partner and 2 children. She lives in the Urcos district, and her work is in the retail trade. She prepares bread and sells it in various places in her village. She has been working in this field for 18 years. Every morning, she also fills a basket with a variety of breads and takes them to sell at the local bus stop. She is requesting the loan in order to buy yeast, flour and other supplies for preparing bread. Elsa infinitely values and appreciates the loan granted to her, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. Accordingly, she is committed to making all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying yeast, flour and other supplies to make bread

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Yanet; ella tiene 27 años de edad y La socia es natural de pampa marca, ella es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,  vive en el distrito de Urcos desde hace 3 años,  la socia se dedica al prestar servicio de alimentación, ella tienen un pequeño restaurante en tupac amaru, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y con todo el ingreso de este negocio ella puede sacar adelante a su familia y está comprando un terreno para construir. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar animales y criarlos, también invertirá en mejorar su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “QORI ORCCO” communal bank. She lives in the Urcos district of Quispicanchis province, in the Department of Cusco. Her name is Yanet, and she is 27 years old. She is originally from Pampamarca, and she has a live-in partner and 1 child. She has lived in the Urcos district for 3 years. Her work is providing food services. She has a small restaurant in Tupac Amaru. She is a very hard-working woman, and she has used all of her income from this business to help her family get ahead. She is currently buying a plot of land to build a house. She is requesting the loan to buy animals to raise, and she will also invest in improving her business. Yanet infinitely values and appreciates the loan granted to her, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. Accordingly, she is committed to making all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her small restaurant and buying animals to raise

loans.name: Patrick

texts.fr:
Monsieur Patrick est un jeune de 27 ans, qui est née dans le district de la Musanze de l’ancienne ville de Ruhengeri  en province du nord du Rwanda. Il est célibataire, il vit avec ses parents et  il a un diplôme de niveau secondaire.
Il est photographe cameraman. Son IMF est Amasezerano Bammunity Banking sa. 
Il prend un prêt aujourd’hui pour acheter un ordinateur pour pouvoir monter les cassettes vidéo des films photographiés et améliorés son travail et maintenir sa clientèle, ce qu’il fait d’habitude, il prend les vidéo et il va faire le Montage ailleurs et paie ces frais.  Il veut améliorer et valoriser son travail ainsi satisfaire les clients.Il contracte son premier prêt, il veut à la longue prendra un prêt pour le minerval car il compte étudier l’université après avoir stabilisé et améliorer sa situation financière, il pourra aussi se marier et avoir des enfants par les épargnes continuelles.
texts.en:
Mr Patrick is 27, a young person who was born in the old town of Ruhengeri, in the district of Musanze province, Rwanda. He is unmarried, he lives with his parents and he has a secondary level diploma. He is a photographer and cameraman. His IMF is Amasezerano Bammunity Banking . He wants a loan today to buy a computer to be able to assemble the video taken and improve his work and to maintain his customers. His normal procedure was to take the videos then take the post production editing elsewhere and pay these expenses. He wants to improve and develop his work in - house thus to satisfy his customers. This is his first loan, his long term plan is to take a loan for higher education because he intends to study at the university after having stabilized and improved his financial position, he will be able to also marry and to have children by continual savings.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase a computer

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Haby B. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de BOYINGUEL depuis 2007. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Elle mène cette activité avec son mari qui l'aide dans l'entretien des animaux.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter une paire de bœufs et des produits vétos. Elle engraissera les bœufs pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone 

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Haby B. is a 46 year old married woman with the responsibility of bringing up 6 children. She has been a member of the Boyinguel Village Bank since 2007. Haby raises cattle. She manages this business along with her husband, who helps her with the animals. With this new loan she will buy two beef cattle and feed products. She will fatten the cattle for 5 months before selling them at the weekly market places in her area. Her goal is to meet her family's financial needs and increase her savings.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two beef cattle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alejandro de 45 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Desde muy pequeña, Rosa aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es una labor que ha estado en su familia desde hace muchos años, esta actividad le dio el capital necesario para poner su tienda, la cual le esta dando muy buenas ganancias, ya que no hay muchas en su pueblo, convirtiéndose poco a poco en su actividad principal. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la comunicación que tiene con sus vecinos cuando entran a su establecimiento a comprarle algo, de esa manera han transcurrido 5 años, en donde considera que para tener lo que ha logrado tiene uno que sacrificarse y permanecer en su tienda todo el día. Con el tiempo espera ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio para brindarle a sus clientes una mejor comodidad. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le será muy beneficioso y así poco a poco podrá mejorar su vida. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, is a hard-working and loving mother. She lives in her own home together with her husband Alejandro, 45, and their 3 adored children, to whom she wants to give a better future. When she was very small Rosa learned to work the land, as agricultural work has been in her family for many year. This activity gave her the necessary capital to establish her shop, which is giving her excellent earnings as there aren't many shops in her village, and little by little it has become her principle activity. What Rosa likes most about her job is the communication she has with her neighbours who come in to her establishment to purchase something. 5 years have passed this way, during which time she has weighed up that to have what she has achieved she has to sacrifice things and remain in her shop all day. With time Rosa hopes to expand her shop's facilities to provide better comfort to her customers. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she feels that it contributes beneficially, as little by little she will be able to improve her life. Within her communal bank Rosa is a very responsible member and has always been attentive to her payments. With the 2000 nuevos soles that she is seeking she will purchase more products to supply her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock shop

loans.name: Brisas Del Guasaule Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Brisas de Guasuale esta ubicado en la Colonia Brisas de Guasuale del Triunfo Choluteca. Este grupo esta integrado por tres personas las cuales tienen tiempo de conocerse. A continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

Doña Francisca Isabel G. es una señora muy trabajadora, madre de 3 hijos que se dedica a la venta de 
ropa en el  Mercado de Guasaule. Como madre soltera, le ha tocado mantener a su familia y financiar la educacion de sus 3 hijos. En su tiempo libre, se dedica a la iglesia de su vecindad. El prestamo lo utilizara para comprar ropa y asi incrementar sus ventas y tener mejores utilidades.

Doña Martha Concepcion O. A. es una señora emprendedora, madre de 2 hijos que con la ayuda de su esposo ha sacado adelante su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en el Mercado de Guasaule.
Es una señora bien trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su familia. El prestamo lo utilizara para comprar materiales para realizar sus comidas. 

Don Pedro Emilio R. O. es un señor de bien que se dedica al cambio de moneda en  la Aduana de  Guasaule. Es padre  de 5 hijos los cuales estudian en un colegio de su comunidad. En su tiempo libre, visita la iglesia local. El prestamo lo utilizara para comprar dolares para cambiarselos a los turistas que pasan por la frontera de Guasaule.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Brisas de Guasuale" is located in the district of Brisas de Guasuale in Triunfo Choluteca. This group is made up of three people who would like to introduce themselves. The details of the activities that they participate in follows: Doña Francisca Isabel G. is a very hardworking woman. She is the mother of three children and works selling clothing in the market in Guasuale. As a single mother, it is up to her to provide for her family and pay for her children's education. In her free time, she volunteers at the church in her neighborhood. She will use this loan to purchase clothing, and increase her sales and have better profits. Doña Martha Concepcion O. A. is an enterprising woman and the mother of two children. With the help of her husband, they have brought the family forward. She works selling food in the market in Guasuale. She is a hardworking woman who has improved her family's life with a lot of effort. She will use this loan to purchase ingredients to make the food she sells. Don Pedro Emilio R. O. is a man who works changing money in the customs house in Guasaule. He is the father of five children who study in a school in his community. In his free time, he visits his local church. He will use this loan to purchase money to exchange for tourists who visit the area around Guasaule.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of money, clothing, sandals, and vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aminata Djiby

texts.fr:
Aminata Djiby D. est âgée de 22 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOYINGUEL depuis le 16 octobre 2007. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à plus de 5 fois.

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine. Avec son crédit elle va acheter une paire de bœufs et l'engraisser pendant au moins 5 mois avant de la revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone. 

Elle participe financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Aminata Djiby D. is 22-years old. She is married and the mother of two children in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BOYINGUEL since October 16, 2007. She has had good experiences with credit loans, having used them on more than five occasions. She fattens cattle, and plans to use her loan to buy a pair of oxen, fatten them for at least five months, and resell them at the local weekly markets. She is contributing to the improvement of her family’s living conditions while increasing her savings.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pair of oxen

loans.name: Aïssatou El Hadji

texts.fr:
Aïssatou El Hadji est une femme de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfants en charge.

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOYINGUEL depuis 2008 et a 03 fois de suite de crédit. Elle a toujours remboursé régulièrement ses prêts. 

Elle fait une petit commerce de sucre, de thé, de lait écrémé etc. Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité plus importante que d'habitude afin de mieux développer son activité.

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Aïssatou El Hadji is 37, married, with one dependent child. She has belonged to the Banc Villageois of Boyinguel since 2008 et has had three loans, all repaid in full and on time. She has a small business selling sugar, tea, skim milk and so on. Her new loan will allow her to buy supplies in greater bulk than usual so as to grow her business. Her plan is to play a part in paying to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tea, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Freddy Rafael

texts.es:
Freddy A. Márquez  es un hombre natural de Ovejas, municipio ubicado en la sub-región Montes de María, departamento de Sucre, en el Caribe de Colombia, caracterizado  por su festival de gaitas y la fertilidad de sus tierras y como el mismo dice de su pueblo natal: "fácil de visitar y difícil de olvidar”. 
Desde hace 23 años y desempleado después de ejercer como jefe de sesión en un fabrica de cepillos ha hecho de todo un poco: servicios de fumigación, pintura,  tapizajes de muebles, porque sabe  tejer en material de paja las famosas sillas momposinas y además ha ejercido como auxiliar contable. En la actualidad  se dedica a vender carnes de res,  pollos, frutas y lácteos, que trae de su municipio hasta Soledad, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos, una de ellas ya diseñadora de interiores.  Este es su tercer préstamo con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando por un monto de $2.000.000 COP,  Freddy dice que sus créditos han sido de mucha ayuda, porque ha logrado aumentar sus ingresos y   apoyar la educación de su hija. A su manera de ver el negocio, plantea que debe tener 2 capitales: uno invertido y otro disponible que lo respalde para aprovechar las inmensas posibilidades del mercado cambiante. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y darle una mayor cobertura porque quiere extenderse a diversos barrios de Barranquilla
texts.en:
Freddy A. Márquez is a native of Ovejas in the Montes de María subregion, in the department of Sucre in the Colombian Caribbean. This area is known for its bagpipe festival and the fertility of its land. As he himself says of his home town, "It's easy to visit and hard to forget." For the last 23 years, before which he worked as shift leader in a brush factory, he has done a little of everything: fumigation services, painting, furniture upholstery (as he can weave grasses to make those famous Mompós chairs) and assistant accountant. He is currently working at selling beef, chicken, fruit and dairy products, which he brings from his municipality to Soledad, where he lives with his spouse and his children, one of whom is an interior designer. This is his third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he is requesting a total of $2.000.000 COP. Freddy A. Márquez says that these loans have been a great help, because he has been able to increase his income and pay for his daughter's education. In his view, a business needs two types of capital: one invested, and the other available to take advantage of the great opportunities presented by a changing market. His aim is to grow his business and cover a larger area, extending into the various neighborhoods of Barranquilla.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy avocados retail, chicken, meat, cheese, whey and other dairy products

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, de 53 años, es una madre de familia muy tierna y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. La actividad cotidiana a la que se dedica Sara, son las manualidades en base a tela y bisuterías, además es experta elaborando adornos navideños y para celebraciones importantes. De esta manera ésta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, y con al ayuda de su maquina de coser ofrece buenos acabados en las prendas que cose. Sus clientes son en mayoría algunas madres y amistades que tiene cerca de su domicilio. Se siente muy complacida con el trabajo que realiza, además le permite estar pendiente de su familia. De esta manera han transcurrido 4 años, y lo más difícil para ella; es no contar con material suficiente, perdiendo oportunidades de hacer más trabajo y de ganar más. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su taller y después terminar de construir su casa. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que le será muy provechoso aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará telas e hilos de diversos colores, así como bisutería para continuar con su trabajo de costura.
texts.en:
Sara, 53, is a kind and hard-working mother. She lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own home. Sara's daily activity is making handicrafts from fabric and costume jewellery, and she is also an expert at making ornaments for Christmas and other important celebrations. This activity has become her principle source of income, and with the help of her sewing machine she offers well-finished garments. Her clients are for the most part mothers and friends that she has close to her home. Sara feels very pleased with the work that she does, and it also lets her provide for her family. 4 years have passed like this and the most difficult thing for Sara is not having sufficient material, thereby losing opportunities to do more work and earn more. Her biggest dream is to expand her workshop and afterwards finish building her house. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she promises to make all the repayments necessary, as the loan will be very useful in increasing her working capital. With the loan she is seeking she will purchase farbric in various colours and costume jewellery to continue her sewing business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads and fabric in various colours.

loans.name: Gabi Mariela

texts.es:
Gabi tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Cerro de Falla,una de las muchas zonas rurales comprendidas dentro del distrito de Olmos, considerado el distrito con la extensión geográfica más grande de la región Lambayeque, está conformado por un pueblo central y por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre si, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en su caserío, ella adquiere sus productos en la ciudad de Chiclayo y los ofrece en venta a los vecinos de su caserío y a los de caseríos aledaños, usualmente trabaja en base a pedidos que le realizan sus clientes, aunque también trae mercadería por su cuenta. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de su hogar, actualmente goza de un grupo de clientes fieles gracias a la calidad de prendas que ofrece y al buen trato que les brinda.

Gabi desea ampliar su negocio comprando prendas de vestir de estación, ya que durante estos meses el frío se hace más fuerte en esta zona del país, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Ella es una mujer responsable y de buen carácter, su meta es ampliar gradualmente su negocio y empezar a vender zapatos, de modo que pueda seguir apoyando a sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en:
Gabi, 34, is single and lives with her parents and siblings in Cerro de Falla, one of Olmos district’s many rural areas. It is considered to be the largest district by area of Lambayeque region. It has a central town and several settlements scattered at great distances from one another. The zone is part of Lambayeque province and it’s located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She is a clothing merchant in her settlement. She buys her merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and sells it to neighbors in her settlement and adjacent settlements. She usually works based on prior orders from customers although she also brings other merchandise to sell. She uses profits from her sales to cover her personal expenses and to help her parents support the household. She has a steady group of regular customers thanks to the high quality items she stocks and the good customer service she provides. Gabi wants to expand her stock with seasonal items because during these months the weather becomes colder in this part of the country. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan to help her reach this goal. She is a responsible, honorable woman. Her goal is to gradually enlarge her business and to start to sell shoes in order to continue to help her parents and siblings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Tomas Andino

texts.es: Don Tomas Andino R. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la Aldea Agua Caliente de Linaca Choluteca, es un señor muy trabajador que se dedica a su trabajo permanente. Es padre de 4 hijos, los cuales mantiene junto con la ayuda de su esposa. Por medio de su trabajo ha sacado adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo. En su tiempo libre trabaja con Caritas de Honduras, una organizacion caritativa de Honduras. El planea utilizar el prestamo para comprar materiales de construccion y asi mejorar su casa para tener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Don Tomas Andino R. is 42 years old and lives in the Aldea Agua Caliente of Linaca Choluteca. He is a very hard-working man. He is the father of 4 children, whom he supports with the help of his wife. With much effort, through his work, he has given his family a decent standard of living. In his free time, he works for Caritas de Honduras, a charitable organization in Honduras. He plans to use this loan to buy construction materials to renovate his house and provide a higher standard of living for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials, cement, sand and payment of workers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gbemissola Lydie

texts.fr: A. Gbemissola Lydie est née le 31 Juillet 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DAOUDA Abossi Soulé, un commerçant, Lydie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Depuis environs quatre ans, Lydie vit à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-POdji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Lydie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et appris ensuite la coiffure. Lydie mène cette activité depuis sept ans. De façon secondaire, Lydie vend dans son atelier, des mêches, des produits pour cheveux, et également des tissus. Lydie s'approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Lydie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'attirer plus la clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Gbemissola Lydie was born July 31, 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to Mr. DAOUDA Abossi Soulé, a merchant, and is the mother of four children who are all in school.  She has been living for about four years in PK10, in the community of Sèmè-POdji, with her husband and children.  The couple jointly provide for their family.   Lydie halted her studies in middle school and then learned how to style hair.  She has been in this business for seven years.  Secondarily, she sells hair extensions, hair products, and also fabrics out of her shop.  She gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  This is the first time that Lydie has requested a loan from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering her business and attracting more customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extentions, hair products, equipment, etc.

loans.name: Martha Narcisa

texts.es:
Martha de 35 años, vive en Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución) tiene una tienda de víveres y vende arroz, azúcar, enlatados. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propia tienda, comprando arroz, azúcar para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos estudiantiles de sus dos hijos ya que el trabaja recogiendo envases plásticos.  Su esposo le ayuda en la tienda después de trabajar, para poder surtir su tienda necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, enlatados, azúcar y una vitrina. 

En el futuro quiere surtir mas su tienda para tener mas ganancias y cambiar el estilo de vida que lleva con su familia.
texts.en:
Martha, age 35, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a periurban area with dirt roads and eroding hills). She has a grocery store, and she sells rice, sugar, and canned goods. With effort and little by little she was buying rice and sugar, and she was able to have her own store. She did this to be able to help her husband with the educational expenses for their two children. He works collecting plastic containers. He helps her in the store after work. In order to stock her store she needs a loan to buy rice, canned goods, sugar, and a display case. In the future she wants to stock her store more in order to have more income and change her family’s life style.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, and canned goods

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 65 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 5 años se dedica en la venta cereal, ya sea D. cebada, trigo, avena, maíz y chuño. Es entonces que cada 15 días viaja a la zona sierra del país, para abastecerse D. éstos productos que tiene mucha acogida en el mercado D. su localidad. Años atrás era muy tímida para las ventas, pero empujado por sus necesidades se inicio en este negocio, al que hoy le tiene mucho aprecio, por las rentas que le proporciona, actualmente sus hijos la apoyan en este trabajo, seleccionando los granos que están en buen estado. Saturnina está feliz  por  el progreso que ha tenido en su negocio, es así que han transcurrido 3 años y espera más adelante ampliar su mercado, para que sus rentas aumenten y pueda cubrir la educación D. sus hijos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Con este crédito que solicita, piensa abastecerse D. variedad D. granos para que pueda continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sixty-five-year-old Saturnina is the mother of a hard-working family. She lives with her husband and two children in their own home. Five years ago she began to sell cereals maD. from barley, wheat, oats, corn, and potato. Five years ago she began to travel every 15 days to the mountainous region of the country to buy these products that are in demand at her local market. Years ago she was reluctant to sell, but necessity forced her to begin this business, and today she appreciates it because of the income it provides. Her children currently help her in this business by sorting and grading the grains. Saturnina is happy with the growth of her business. Things have been going well for the last 3 years, and she hopes to increase sales and profits in the future in order to pay for the education of her children. This is her tenth loan from MFP, and she knows that this loan will be very beneficial and will increase working capital. She is committed to making timely payments. With this loan, she plans on purchasing a variety of grains, which will enable her to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of grains to continue with her sale of cereals.

loans.name: Crecencio

texts.es: Don Crecencio B. tiene 46 años de edad y reside en Barrio El Tolulo del Triunfo Choluteca. Es un padre de 3 hijos los cuales ha mantenido en la escuela junto con la ayuda de su esposa. El es un señor emprendedor que se dedica a la fabricacion de camas para venderlas en Choluteca y ha trabajado en este negocio por varios años. El prestamo lo utilizara para comprar madera y asi poder fabricar mas camas para venta. Las ganacias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y la educacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Crecencio B., 46, lives in Choluteca’s Tolulo del Triunfo neighborhood. He has three children that he has been able to keep in school thanks to help from his wife. He is an enterprising man that manufactures beds to sell in Choluteca. He has been in this line of work for several years. He will use the loan to buy wood in order to make more beds to sell. He needs the profits to cover household expenses and pay for his children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood to manufacture beds.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amparo Dicenia

texts.es: Doña Amparo Dicenia D. C. de 30 años de edad es una madre de 4 hijos. Amparo se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion en la colonia Bello Horizonte en El Triunfo Choluteca. Por medio de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo han logrado mantener a sus hijos en la escuela. Amparo se dedica a la iglesia en su tiempo libre. Con el prestamo, Amparo podra comprar mas productos para tener mas surtida su pulperia. Amparo utilizara las ganacias para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y sacar mas adelante a su familia que es lo mas importante para ella.
texts.en:
Amparo Dicenia Dávila Chavarría, 30, is the mother of four children. She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells general use items. She lives in the Bello Horizonte neighborhood in El Triunfo, Choluteca. With profits from her work and help from her husband she has managed to keep her children in school. In her spare time, Amparo is involved in church-related work. Amparo will use the loan to buy more stock items for her store so that she can have it better stocked. She will use the profits to cover household expenses and to get her family ahead in life which is the most important thing for her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted groceries.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aracelys Maria

texts.es:
Aracelys S. A. de 29 años vive en la Urbanización la Playa y se dedica al negocio de alquilar lavadoras y a ofrecer servicios de Internet, transcripciones, inpresiones y fotocopiado;  está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 9 años de edad.

Hace tres años se interesó por tener una actividad adicional a las comidas rápidas en las que ya venia trabajando, así fue como le agregó la de servicios de lavandería comprando una máquina primero  y luego otras dos,  justamente con el crédito que le hizo a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en el año 2008; organización de la que es cliente hace dos años y hace seis meses decidió comprar un computador con recursos propios,  para abrir un nuevo servicio el de Internet, también compró una impresora y una fotocopiadora. Así es como, Aracely en cada momento le ha ido abriendo espacio a toda su infraestructura de servicios  que ahora tienen una  mayor demanda, por eso ha  decidido comprar más equipos y trasladarse  a un local cercano a su vivienda, para cumplir su sueño de extenderse cada día más. 
Su esposo es un gran trabajador de una empresa privada y juntos han logrado conseguir todo lo que hoy tienen para el bienestar de su familia. Aracely no tiene empleados o colaboradores, ella trabaja sola y administra bien su tiempo para cumplir con todo, como esposa, madre, en fin buen miembro de familia. Como sus transcripciones las hace con una buena calidad tiene varios clientes que aprecian su amabilidad y buen trabajo, por eso es muy popular y todos la buscan para recomendarle sus trabajos.

Aracely es una joven con mucha capacidad de superación y una enorme fuerza de trabajo que la hacen admirable. Ella es muy feliz porque esta trabajando en lo que sabe hacer,  pues estudió secretariado ejecutivo sistematizado, lo que le facilita el manejo efectivo de su negocio y porque también  se actualizó a través de cursos y seminarios que la actualizan constantemente.

Los créditos de la Fundación han sido para Aracely muy funcionales le han servido para comprar su lavadora y de sus utilidades toda la infraestructura con la que hoy cuenta. Con su credikiva de ahora va a comprar un computador, muebles y enseres, para adecuar su negocio; adicionalmente pagará un mes de arriendo por anticipado, en el local que próximamente ocupará negocio y este cambio es justamente un buen desafío.
texts.en:
Aracelys S. A., 29, lives in the La Playa urban zone. She rents washing machines and offers Internet, transcription, printing and photocopying services. She’s married and has two children who are 6 and 9 years of age. Three years ago she became interested in having a business in addition to the fast-food business she’d been involved with to date. This is how she installed the laundry service buying first one machine then two additional ones precisely with the loan she got from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in 2008. She has been a client of this organization for two years and six months ago decided to buy a computer with her own resources to open a new Internet service. In addition, she bought a printer and a photocopier. Thus Aracelys has been constantly opening up new venues in her service infrastructure for which there is growing demand. She has, therefore, decided to buy more equipment and move to a location that is near her home in order to expand even more. Her husband is a valued employee at a private firm and together they have built all they now have for their family’s wellbeing. Aracelys does not have any employees or collaborators; she runs and tends to her business by herself and manages her time in such a way to be a good wife and mother, in other words, a good family member. Because the transcriptions she does are of such high quality, she has several customers that appreciate her kindness and good work. Thus, she is very popular and everyone seeks her out when they need projects done. Aracelys is a young woman with lots of capacity for self-improvement and an enormous willingness to work which make her most worthy of admiration. She is very happy working at what she knows best because she studied to be an executive secretary which makes it easier for her to manage her business and she also stays current through seminars and courses she takes constantly. The loans that Aracelys has gotten from the Fundación have been useful for her to purchase the washing machines and her profits have provided the entire infrastructure she how possesses. She will use her latest Kiva loan to buy a computer, furniture and supplies to set up her business. In addition, she will pay a month’s rent in advance for the locale she plans to install her business in. This change represents quite a challenge for her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer, furniture and supplies to stock the business.  In addition, to pay for a month’s rent in advance for the location where the business will be located.

loans.name: Melania Yolanda

texts.es:
Melania tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiebe dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Bambamarca, una zona que pertenece a la sierra norte del país, a 2 532 m.s.n.m., pertenece a la región Cajamarca y se encuentra ubicado a nueve horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Melania se dedica a trabajar vendiendo comida desde hace mas de veinte años, ella cuenta con un peuqño puesto de venta dentro del mercado de su distrito, allí ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de platos típicos de la zona para el momento de desayuno y almuerzo, el negocio cuanta con un buen grupo de clientes debido a que la zona es muy frecuentada y también porque ella prepara sus alimentos con buena sazón.

Melania desea ampliar sus ventas para poder percibir mayor cantidad de ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente adquirir mas insumos para preparar más platos de comida, siguiendo su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará en la compra de productos no perecibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, menestras, aceite, bebidas gaseosas, etc.

Melania es una mujer bastante concida y estimada en su trabajo y en el barrio donde vive, sus conocidos y amigos la consideran una persona responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Melania is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives with her family in the Bambamarca district, an area belonging to the northern highlands of the country at 2,532 meters above sea level. It is part of the Cajamarca region, and is located approximately 9 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Melania has worked selling food for more than 20 years. She has a small stand inside the market in her district, and there she offers her customers dishes that are typical of the area for breakfast and lunch. Her business has a large group of customers because it is a popular business in the neighborhood and also because she prepares very tasty dishes. Melania wants to expand her sales so that she can increase her earnings. For this reason, she has seen fit to buy more supplies to prepare more dishes to sell. To do this she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy non-perishables such as rice, sugar, noodles, beans, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. Melania is a woman who is well-known and highly regarded in her work in the neighborhood where she lives. Her friends and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and trust-worthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies to make plates of food to sell to expand her business

loans.name: Lucas Evangelisto

texts.es:
el sr. Lucas Evangelisto F. se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de camas de madera, tiene vario tiempo de dedicarase a este tipo de actividad.
Don Lucas es muy trabajador a pesar de que es una persona de la tercera edad, trabaja muy duro para sacar a su familia adelante. Lucas es padre de 6 hijos los cuales ya estan grandes de edad.
Lucas en sus tiempos libres asiste a la iglesia, nos comento sentirse muy feliz ya que el esta bien de salud y espiritualmente.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas madera a precio de mayorista y asi tener mas produccion. las ganancias las necesita para satisfacer sus necesidades y cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Lucas Evangelisto Fernández manufactures wooden beds. He has been in this line of work for a long time. Lucas is very hard working despite being a senior citizen. He works hard to get his family ahead in life. He is the father of 6 children who are all adults. In his spare time Lucas attends church. He tells us that he feels very happy because he is well both physically and spiritually. He will use the loan to buy more wood at wholesale prices in order to increase production. He will use the profits to meet his personal needs and to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, nails, adhesives, plastic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bulk cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of salsa for the tacos and sodas

loans.name: Lidia Vanessa

texts.es:
Lidia C. C. es una joven que vive en Sabanagrande, municipio del departamento del Atlántico, con sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10, 13 y 14 años. Ella tiene un salón de belleza donde ofrece el servicio de  corte, pedicure y manicure y gradualmente le ha agregado el de asesoria y venta de productos de belleza asociada a su actividad.

Lidia está aplicando a un crédikiva por valor de $900.000 COP con él comprará productos de belleza que distribuirá entre sus clientes que siempre le compran y tambien tiene otros nuevos. Desde que inició su negocio lo hizo primero en su familia, luego con sus  vecinos y a domicilio, pero en la medida en que se ha incrementado su clientela  ha  organizado su salón de belleza en la casa donde vive. Ella gradualmente se está extendiendo en ese mismo nicho de mercado con una nueva alternativa y es la de recomendar y vender  productos de belleza de acuerdo a lo que cada cliente  requiere y con ello ha ganado clientela.

Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y desde que ingresó a esta organización se ha entusiasmado mucho con su negocio y por eso   ha logrado especializarse en su tarea cada día más, y sus ingresos han mejorado preemitiéndole también satisfacer las necesidades del hogar. Su meta principal es trabajar fuertemente para generar suficientes ingresos para que sus hijos tengan siempre acceso a una educación de calidad y mas adelante sueña con adquirir una vivienda propia y justamente conseguir este propósito es el mayor desafío de Lidia.
texts.en:
Lidia C. C. is a young woman living in Sabanagrande, a municipality in Atlántico department, with her three children who are 10, 13, and 14 years of age. She has a beauty salon where she offers haircuts, pedicures and manicures. She has gradually added beauty consulting services and the sale of beauty products associated with her business. Lidia is applying for a Kiva loan in the amount of 900,000 COP to buy beauty products for sale to her regular customers as well as to new ones. She started her business first with her family members, then to her neighbors and in-home service. However, as her customer base has grown, she has set up a beauty salon in her home. She has been gradually expanding within this market niche by offering a new alternative: the sale of personalized beauty products that meet each customer’s needs. This has led to the addition of new customers. This is her 2nd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Since becoming a member of our organization she has been very excited about her business and has continued to specialize in her tasks daily. Her income has increased which has allowed her to better meet household expenses. Her main goal is to work hard so that her children have a quality education and that later on she can have her own home. In fact, precisely reaching this goal is Lidia’s major life challenge

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Don Humberto es padre de familia de tres hijos, casado, su esposa trabaja para poder dar a los niños lo necesario. Ya que toda ha incrementado, entre los gastos alimenticios, educación, medicina.
Desde joven inicio a trabajar en Enacal, trabajando como fontanero. Ha logrado hacer su casa de concreto, hoy en día desea cambiar todo el techo ya que por el uso de los años, tiene muchos agujero que cuando llueve se le moja parte de la casa.
Lo que necesita mejorar para que su familia este en condiciones buenas, ya que como puede se esfuerza para hacer las mejoras necesarias.
Mediante el financiamiento ha logrado hacer estas mejoras.
Comprara veinte láminas de zinc, seis perlines, ciento veinte golosos, y pintura para pintar los perlines y que tengan mejor duración.
texts.en:
Humberto is married and the father of three children. His wife also works in order to provide their children with everything they need since everything from food to education to medicines has increased in price. He started working as a plumber for Enacal at a young age. He has managed to build his house out of concrete and needs to replace the entire roof because over the years it has become damaged; it has a lot of holes in it and when it rains part of the interior of his home gets wet. He needs to repair it so that his family will have good living conditions. He always does whatever he can to do the necessary improvements. It has been thanks to the loans that he has been able to afford these home improvements. He will buy 20 sheets of zinc metal, six metal braces, 120 screws and paint to paint the braces so that they will last longer. Happy because the project will be possible because through the loans the man is benefited because the terms are moderate and….

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace his roof.

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es:
Don Walter es padre de familia de tres hijos, que junto con su esposa, trabajan para lograr dar lo necesario a su familia. Don Walter tiene 43 años de edad, y su trabajo es la toma de fotografía, desde hace varios años, el cual inicio ya que le gusta el escenario de fotografía, a si como ser independiente.
A través de los años logro hacer su casa, de concreto aun faltan mejoras como poner piso en la cocina, pero lo que desea es poder  apoyar a  su esposa con la inversión, ya que se dedica  a la venta de ropa y cosmético el cual es de gran ayuda, ya que ambos dividen los gastos de alimentación, educación, medicina, gastos básicos,  con el objetivo de poder ajustarse ya que todo esta a altos costos, es por tal razón que se esfuerzan a dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Con este préstamo comprara cinco docenas de pantalón wangler  de ambos sexo, camisas para lograr mejores ventas.
Sus planes es seguir aumentando su actividad fotográfica, mediante el financiamiento a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Don Walter is the head of a household of three children, and with his wife he works to provide what is necessary for the family. Don Walter is 43 years old, and has worked for several years in photography, a job which he began since he likes framing pictures and being independent. Throughout the years he built his home out of concrete although it still needs some improvements such as flooring in the kitchen, but what he wants is to be able to help his wife with the investment, because she is devoted to selling clothes and cosmetics. This is very helpful, because they divide the expenses for food, education, medicine and basic expenses with the goal of being able to adjust to higher prices for everything. This is the reason that they strive to give their customers better service. With this loan he will purchase five dozen pairs of wrangler jeans and shirts for both men and women to increase sales. His plans include taking more photographs through long-term financing.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: La Señora Maria Emilia B. de 61 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos. Maria vive con su hijo y su madre en Barrio La Ceibita en San Lorenzo, Valle. Su hija emigro a los Estados Unidos en busca de una vida mejor y le manda dinero a Maria para ayudarla economicamente. Su esposo murio hace años lo cual ha hecho mas dificil sacar adelante a su familia. Maria se dedica al Comercio, tiene varios años vendiendo ropa interior de damas y caballeros en su casa de habitacion. El prestamo sera usado para adquirir mas ropa y asi poder utilizar las ganancias para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y algunos gastos medicos recientes de su madre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Emilia B. is a sixty-one year old single mother of two children. Maria lives with her son and her mother in Barrio La Ceibita in San Lorenzo, Valle. Her daughter emigrated to the United States in search of a better life and sends money to Maria to help her financially. Her husband died years ago, which has made it more difficult to take care of her family. Maria is a saleswoman who has sold ladies and men's lingerie from her home for several years. The loan will be used to buy more clothes so she can use her earnings to cover the household expenses and some recent medical expenses for her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new underwear

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
El comité “Asoc.de Mujeres” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de San José Obrero.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, dependiendo de las facilidades con que cuentan, como son las ventas de productos de uso domestico, cría de animal,   fabricación y ventas de productos de limpieza.
Una de la integrantes es la señora Carmen López, quién se dedica a varias actividades como toda mujer que vive en el campo.
Ella entre los trabajos del hogar se dedica a la cría de animales, como en la cría de cerdos, gallinas, patos, vacas, y otros.
Ella los cría para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad, ella comenta que esta actividad tiene mucho trabajo pero que le ayuda a ella y su familia, y solicita el préstamos para la compra de tejidos de alambres para construir corrales para sus animales de manera a mejorar la producción.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Asoc.de Mujeres" was formed by the union of several neighbors of the city of San Jose Obrero. All committee members have their own businesses, depending on the facilities available. They sell products for domestic use, raise animals, and work in the manufacturing and sale of cleaning products. One of the members is Mrs. Carmen L., who has several jobs, like any woman who lives in the country. She works from home raising animals like pigs, chickens, ducks, cows, and others. She raises them to be sold in the city market. She said that this activity is a big job, but helps her and her family. She is seeking loans to buy wire fences to build pens for their animals so they can improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wire fence material to build pens for their animals.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 4 Group

texts.en:
Albaneli is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz 4 (love and peace). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to build her house to a bigger and better structure.

Albaneli is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying shoes and electrical stuff like blenders, fans and small radios to sell by payments to her clients. She will use the profits to buy a refrigerator and school supplies for her children, and by saving she will invest in her business because she wants to improve it. She is dreaming to have enough money, health and love to share what she gets with her family and people around, and she knows with Esperanza and her group she will be able to accomplish her dreams. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her favorite things which are to eat and dance a lot.

Albaneli's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods and shoes.

loans.name: Marta Esperanza

texts.es:
la señora Marta Esperanza G. tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Mario Gomez Duron quien se dedica a la albañileria, tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos, la señora Marta vende ropa usada y se a dedicado a este tipo de actividad desde hace mucho tiempo.
todos los dias sale a vender la ropa a los diferentes barrios y colonias de Nacaome y Jicaro 
galan, sus ventas son diarias. Se transporta en autobus para realizar algunas ventas ya que las distancias son grandes.
antes Marta E. se dedicaba a la venta de camaron y pescado.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar dos fardos de ropa clasificada ya que es la ropa que se vende mas, por ser de buena calidad y de marca.
texts.en:
Marta G. Hope is 38 years old. She is married to Mario Gomez Duron, who works as bricklayer, and they have three children that are dependent on them. Marta sells used clothing and has been in this line of business for a long time. Every day she sells clothes in the different neighbourhoods and districts of Nacaome and Jicaro Galan. She has to take the bus for some of the sales as the distances are considerable. Before this, Marta E. used to sell shrimp and fish. She will use the loan to buy two bundles of classified clothes, which are the kind of clothes that sell the most, being of good quality and branded.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundle of used clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eudelio

texts.es:
El señor Eudelio González P. es de Jejui - Choré, con casa propia,  tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Crispina Acosta de 47 años de edad.
 
           Es propietario de una despensa con mercerías, el negocio tiene 16 años de funcionamiento, también vende repuestos varios para motos.

         Ademas cuenta con 10 hectáreas de tierra en donde tiene 20 cabezas de ganados vacunos y cultivos diversos.

               Es su octava operación de créditos con esta institución, canceló en forma excelente sus créditos anteriores, es un cliente muy trabajador y muy responsable.
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio, como productos de limpieza en general, yerba, azúcar, fideos, aceites, verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
Mr. Eudelio González P. is from Jejui - Choré. He is a home owner, 50 years old, and is married to Mrs. Crispina Acosta who is 47 years of age. He owns a general dry-goods store which has been in business for 16 years and also sells various motorcycle parts. He has 10 hectares of land where he has 20 head of cattle and various crops. This is his eighth loan with this institution and has paid back his previous loans in an excellent way. He is a hard working, responsible, customer. At this time, he is taking out a loan to buy merchandise for his business like general cleaning products, yerba mate, sugar, noodles, oils, vegetables and fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general cleaning products, yerba mate, sugar, noodles, oils, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Delvy Marina

texts.es:
La Señora Delvy Marina E. G. tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos que dependen de
ella. Delvy tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada en su casa de habitacion ubicada en Jicaro
Galan de San Lorenzo, Valle. Delvy es una persona muy trabajadora que con muchos esfuerzos ha sacado adelante a su familia. La hija de Delvy tambien le ayuda a vender ropa despues de sus clases en el colegio. Como microempresaria, Delvy desea lograr su sueño en un futuro no muy lejano de que su negocio crezca para poder brindarle mas oportunidades a sus hijos y dejarles un patrimonio para su futuro.
texts.en:
Delvy Marina E. G. is 45 years old. She is a single mother with two children who are dependent on her. Delvy has a business selling new and used clothing in her home, which is located in Jicaro Galan, San Lorenzo, Valle. Delvy is a very hard-working person who has been able to help her family get ahead through great effort. Delvy's daughter also helps her sell clothing after her classes at school. As a microentrepreneur, Delvy would like to achieve her dream in the near future of expanding her business so she can provide more opportunities to her children and leave them an inheritance for their future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying three bales of sorted clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Linda Rosa

texts.es:
la señora Linda Rosa E. G. tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Santos Pedro Mayorga Licona no tienen hijos que dependen de ellos, el esposo es albañil de construcion y Linda se dedica a la comercializacion de hamacas, utencilios de cocina, carnes, lacteos y gallinas. Linda vive en su casa solo con su esposo, tienen 32 años de vivir juntos. Sus hijos ya estan casados 

el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en dos fardos de ropa, compra de sandalias.
Linda es una persona muy amigable y luchadora que tiene todos los deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Linda Rosa E. G. is 52 years old and married to Sr. Santos Pedro Mayorga Licona. They do not have any children who are still dependent on them. Her husband is a mason and works in construction. Linda sells hammocks, cooking utensils, meat, dairy products, and chickens. Linda and her husband live alone in their house and have been together for 32 years. Their children are already married.

This loan will be invested in two bundles of clothing and sandals. Linda is a friendly, yet determined person who has every desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase used clothing & sandals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El señor Hernan G. González  es de Gral. Resquin, con casa propia, es casado, tiene 2 hijos.  

 Se dedica a la venta de articulos de celulares, accesorios, reparación de celulares, maxi y mini cargas, su señora tiene un comedor, con clientela formada con muy buena ubicación.

   Esta es la quinta operación que realiza  con esta institución, excelente cliente, señor muy trabajador, tambien tiene animales vacunos.

  Solicita el prestamo para la compra de celures para ofrecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Hernan G. G. is from Gral. Resquin and a home-owner. He is married with two children. He sells mobile phones, accessories, chargers and he also carries out mobile phone repairs. His wife has a food stand with a regular client base thanks to its very good localtion. This is his fifth operation through the institution. He is a good client and a hard-working man. He also owns cattle. He is requesting a loan to purchase cell phones to offer through his business.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Danila Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Danila de 31 años de edad, es casada, actualmente  se encuentra embarazada de su primer hijo, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y se encarga de los gastos del hogar. Danila se desempeña como docente de primaria desde hace  6 años en la Escuela Salomon Ibarra Mayorga ubicada en la Colonia Los Angeles de Nueva Guinea.

Esta solictando su 7mo credito para comprar zinc, madera y pagar la mano de obra de la reparacion del techo de su casa, ya que se encuentra  en malas condiciones y como estamos en invierno se esta viendo bastante afectada. 

Danila se siente muy agradecida con Afodenic ya por medio de los crèditos que se le han brindado ha logrado tener su propia casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Doña Danila is 31 years old, married, and currently pregnant with her first child. Her husband works as a farmer and is in charge of the household expenses. Danila has worked as an elementary school teacher for six years at the Salomon Ibarra Mayorga School located in Colonia Los Angeles in Nueva Guinea.

She is requesting her seventh loan to purchase zinc, wood, and pay for labor to repair the roof of her house. It is currently in bad condition, and she is very concerned since the winter season has arrived.

Danila is very grateful to AFODENIC for the loans that have been provided since they have enabled her to build her house a little bit at a time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor needed to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Maria del Carmen G. es soltera, tiene una hija que depende de ella al 100%, vive en el barrio Buenos Aires, Maria es una mujer muy luchadora, su negocio es la venta de comida (desayunos, almuerzos), ademas vende achineria en un nuevo puesto que acaba de inagurar y el cual se lo administra su hija.
a Maria no le gusta sonreir mucho.
el credito lo utilizara para remodelar y comprar comida para su comedor.
tambien comprara cosas para surtir el puesto de achineria.
su mayor deseo en estos momentos es que que su hija pueda continuar estudiando y se gradue de la universidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria del Carmen G. is single and has a daughter who is 100% dependent on her. She lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires. Maria is a determined woman who sells food (breakfasts and lunches). She also sells low-cost merchandise at a new vending stand that her daughter manages. Maria does not like to smile much.

This loan will be used to remodel her diner and buy food for her business. She also plans to buy merchandise to restock her vending stand. Her greatest wish at the moment is for her daughter to continue her studies and graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beef, beans, and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ramon Victor

texts.es: El joven Ramon Victor L. E. tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su esposa la joven Paola Dominguez y su hijo pequeño en la Colonia Jicaro Galan de San Lorenzo, Valle. Ramon se dedica a vender leña, tiene un pickup de su propiedad el cual utiliza para transportar la leña a diferentes colonias de San Lorenzo y Nacaome, una ciudad aledaña, en los dias de la semana. Durante el fin de semana, Ramon viaja hasta la capital de Tegucigalpa para vender pescados y camarones. Siendo un joven emprendedor, su sueño es establecer bien el mercado de sus productos para poder contratar a un asistente que le ayude con el negocio.
texts.en:
This young borrower is Ramon Victor L. E.. He is 21 years old and he lives with his wife, Paola Dominguez, and their young child in Jicaro Galan, a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, a town located in the Valle department. Ramon engages in selling firewood: during the week, with his own pickup truck he transports firewood to the different neighborhoods of San Lorenzo and of the neighboring town of Nacaome. During the week-end, Ramon travels up to the capital city of Tegucigalpa to sell fish and shrimps. Being a young entrepreneur, he dreams of profitably setting his products up in the market in order to hire an assistant to help him with his activity.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Jennyffer Stifer

texts.es:
Jeniffer G.,  es  una joven de 23 años que vive en la Ciudad de Bogotá,   con su cónyuge e   hijo de 9 meses de nacido. Esta Joven se ha vuelto una experta en el negocio de comercializar artesanías en fomy, porcelanicron , productos en lencería que ella misma decora, aplicando la técnica de bordado liquido;  Así mismo vende otras mercancías,  mediante guías especializadas, como perfumes para damas y  caballeros .  Desde hace 3 años conoció la técnica de bordado líquido y empezó a aplicarla en su casa y a personas muy cercanas,  pero gradualmente y mediante referidos, fueron haciéndole pedidos muchos nuevos clientes que solicitaban nuevos productos con diversas técnicas artesanales como pintura en tela, Country que Jeniffer fue agregando hasta llegar a vender diversidad de diseños y hasta   que finalmente accedió a vender productos por catálogos.
Su sueño es tener un local donde exhibir las bellas artesanías  que día a día elabora y poder ofrecer cursos en este arte, como una alternativa paro obtener nuevos ingresos.   Su mayor desafío es el poco capital con el que cuenta para iniciar este gran sueño,  pero mientras tanto Jennifer todo lo elabora en casa y sale a vender sus productos.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando por un crédito de $700.000 COP,  porque requiere comprar una maquina e insumos en mayores cantidades que le ofrecen descuentos importantes y ganaría un dinero mas ajustando sus productos  con nuevos precios.
texts.en:
Jennifer G. is a 23 year old young woman. She lives in the city of Bogotá with her life partner and their nine month old son. This young woman has become an expert in the business of marketing handicrafts made of foam rubber, cold porcelain (click here for an explanation), and linen goods. She decorates the linen goods herself by using a technique with liquid embroidery. She also sells other merchandise like perfume for women and men through specialized catalogs. She learned the technique of using embroidery liquid three years ago. She started to use it in her house and with people very close. Gradually she was getting orders through referrals. Many new customers were giving her orders and requesting new products with diverse handicraft techniques like paint on fabric. Jeniffer kept adding things until she came to sell a diversity of designs. Finally, she agreed to sell products by catalog. Her dream is to have a place where she can display the beautiful handicrafts that she makes day to day. She also dreams of offering courses in this art as an alternative way to get new income. Her biggest challenge is the small amount of money she has to start this great dream. Meanwhile, Jennifer makes everything in her house and leaves to sell her products. This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She is applying for a loan of $700,000 COP because she needs to buy a machine and supplies in greater quantities because they offer important discounts. She will then make more money adjusting her products with new prices.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw material and a machine

loans.name: Jose Eriberto

texts.es:
José Eriberto tiene 58 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Corinto, departamento de Morazán, tiene una relación de unión libre con Doña María Elena,  con 6 hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, otro rubro que se dedica es a la venta de ropa.
Don Eriberto aprendió la actividad agricola de siembra de Maíz y frijoles  por herencia de los padres, que realizaban esta actividad, por la necesidad de generar mejores condiciones se dedica tambin a la venta de  ropa de forma ambulante, El sale muy temprano de la casa y realiza un largos recorridos para vender ropa, hasta llegar a La  Estancia un lugar que pertenece a Honduras y ahí el comercializa sus productos, es una persona trabajadora, responsable.
Esta solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono y fertilizante para la siembra de maíz y frijoles, y otra parte para concentrado para ganado. Esto contribuirá a obtener una buena cosecha para que puedan venderla y generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades, mejora la calidad de vida de esta familia.
Las metas son a futuro comprar más ganado, mejor el cultivo, apoyar a los hijos y la esposa económicamente.
texts.en:
José Eriberto is 58 years old and he lives with his live-in partner, María Elena, and their 6 children in the Corinto municipality in the Morazán department. He engages in agriculture and stockbreeding; on top of that he also sells clothes. Eriberto was taught how to plant maize and beans from his parents, who engaged in this activity, and in order to gain better life conditions he also works as a street vendor selling clothes. He leaves his house very early and makes many long journeys in order to sell clothes, until he reaches La Estancia, a place located in Honduras where he sells his products. He is a very hardworking and responsible person. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to plant maize and beans, as well as concentrated cattle feed. This will help him obtaining a good harvest that he can sell and earn money to provide for the necessities of his family and to improve their quality of life. His future goals are to buy more cattle, to improve the crops and to economically help his children and his partner.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to plant maize and beans.

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
la joven Eva R. M. tiene 21 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años, viven en la casa de la mama quien  tambien se dedica al comercio.
Eva ademas de dedicarse a su negocio tambien se dedica a estudiar en la universidad por la noches.
Eva vivio tres años en los estados donde logro ahorrar dinero para establecer su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de trajes de niño, calzado, fajas, pantalones, carteras, etc.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hijo y de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Eva R. M. is a young woman who is 21 years of age. She is a single mother with a six year old son. They live at the house of her mother, who also works as a merchant.

In addition to managing a business, Eva is a student who attends university classes at night. She lived in the United States for three years and was able to save money for starting her business. This loan will be used to buy children’s outfits, shoes, belts, pants, handbags, and other items. Her earnings are needed to cover expenses for her son and his education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing, accessories, and handbags

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Señor Pablo C. O. tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa Señora Maria del Carmen Berrios y su hijo en su casa localizalida en Barrio La Ceibita en San Lorenzo, Valle. El negocio de Pablo consiste en la comercializacion de ropa, calzado, implementos deportivos y ropa deportiva en su casa de habitacion. Ramon tambien utiliza su microbus como medio de transporte y centro de ventas para llevar mercancia a los trabajadores de empresas privadas y gubernamentales cercanas a la ciudad de San Lorenzo.

Pablo usara el prestamo para surtir su negocio ya que se aproxima la feria del pueblo que brindara la oportunidad de mayores ventas con los que asistan al evento. Pablo considera que la situacion economica esta un poco dificil para los microempresarios pero que hay que perseverar para salir adelante con las metas establecidas. El deseo de Pablo es que su familia siempre este unida y con salud.
texts.en:
Pablo C. O., age 42, lives with his wife, Maria del Carmen Berrios, and their son. Their house is located in the La Ceibita neighborhood in the San Lorenzo valley. Pablo’s business is selling clothes, footwear, sports goods, and sportswear in his house. Pablo also uses his minibus as a means of transportation and sales center. He uses it to take merchandise to workers in private and governmental businesses that are close to the city of San Lorenzo. Pablo will use the loan to stock his business because the town fair is approaching. That will offer greater sales opportunities from the people who attend the event. Pablo views the economic situation for small businessmen to be a bit difficult. But, he knows that you have to persevere in order to get ahead with your established goals. Pablo’s wish is for his family to always be close and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Emma

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 38 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Corinto, departamento D. Morazán, es casada, vive el  esposo y su única hija Kenia que tiene 14 años D. edad, la actividad que realiza es cuidado y alimentación D. ganado y cerdos para venta.
El oficio se lo enseñaron los padres, todos los días recorre 3 kilómetros D. distancia hasta el lugar donD. esta el pasto para el ganado, su jornada inicial D. 6:00 am, orD.ñando las vacas para sacar leche, luego alimenta al ganado; ella está solicitando  un crédito para compra D. cerdos y concentrado; para cuidado y alimentación. Para luego venderlos cuando ya estén listos.
Los sueños D. Rosa son continuar son el negocio D. compra y centa D. ganado, apoyar al esposo con la agricultura, tener estabilidad económica, apoyar a los hijos con los estudios, mejora la calidad D. vida D. la familia
texts.en:
Rosa, age 38, lives in the Corinto municipality in the Morazán department. She is married, and she lives with her husband and their only child, 14 year old Kenia. Rosa takes care of and feeds cattle and pigs to sell. Her parents taught her this traD.. Everyday she travels three kilometers to the pasture for the livestock. Her work day starts at 6:00 a.m. She milks the cows and then feeds the livestock. She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and concentrated feed in order to take care of them and to feed them. Then she will sell them when they are ready. Rosa’s dreams are to continue with her business of buying and selling livestock, to help her husband with the farming, to have financial stability, to support her children’s education, and to improve the family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and concentrated feed

loans.name: Edson Jaime

texts.es: El Sr. Edson se encuentra en su tercera secuencia como credito individual anteriormente el señor trabajaba en el banco de emprendimiento Apostol Santiago, la actividad en la que se desempeña es la de elaborar piñatas y la decoracion de fiestas, inflado de globos.  El cliente vive de forma independiente pero sigue ayudando a su mama en algunos gastos ya que es el hijo mayor, el credito esta destinado para la compra de una compresora de aire lo cual le facilitara el pintado de las piñatas y un tanque de helio el cual sera utilizado en el inflado de globos para un contrato que el cliente adquirio, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, le va muy bien en su negocio y esta agradecido con emprender y Kiva por esta opotinidad que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Edson is in his third cycle of individual loans. He previously worked in the Apostol Santiago Communal Bank. He makes piñatas, party decorations, and inflates helium balloons. He lives in an independent way, but he continues to help his mother with some expenses because he is the oldest child. The loan is to buy an air compressor, which will make painting the piñatas easier for him. He will also buy a helium tank to use to blow up the balloons. This is for a contract that he has. He is a very responsible and hard-working person. His business is going very well for him. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a compressor and a helium tank

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
la sra. Martha E. G. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en union libre y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, este a sido su patrimonio durante mucho tiempo ya que su madre crecio en este negocio y ahora Martha hoy se dedica a la venta de tortillas, las fabrica en su casa de habitacion y tiene la ayuda de su hijo mayor que le entrega las tortillas a los clientes en sus casas.
Martha vive con sus tres hijos renta su casa.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar maiz, leña, cal, agua y fosforos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y la alimentacion de su familia.
su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha E. G. is 40, is in a common-law marriage, and has been making and selling tortillas for some years. She learned the trade in the family since her mother raised her with this business and now Martha works selling the tortillas. She makes them in her house and her oldest son helps her by delivering the tortillas to the customers at their homes. Martha lives with her three children in a rented house. She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, water and matches. She needs the earnings to cover the household expenses and to feed her family. Her biggest desire is that her children become people with good incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, lime, flour, water and matches

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor Pedro José solicito un crédito anteriormente que fue para invertirlo en su negocio, Pedro tiene 52 años, el inicio hace 31 años esta actividad como es la carpintería,  aduce que su negocio ha crecido bastante, debido a que él ha sabido invertir en su negocio, ya que sus arduas horas de trabajo todos los días han dado resultado. Actualmente tiene muchos pedidos, que debido al poco capital que tiene no ha podido cumplir con sus clientes. El motivo del crédito será invertido en la compra de madera caoba, cedro, laurel, entre otros. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande distribuidor de productos de madera que venda al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro José had a loan before and invested it in his business. Pedro is 52 years old, and started working as a carpenter 31 years ago. Since then his business has grown well, owing to his canny investment in the business and the long hours he puts in every day. He has a lot of orders at the moment, but due to a lack of capital he hasn't been able to satisfy all his customers. The loan will be used to buy wood, including mahogany, cedar and laurel. Pedro's dream is to grow his business into wholesale distributor of wooden products.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
