loans.use: Buy 6 “quintales” (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of fertilizer and 8 quintales of urea

loans.name: Cristina Gregoria

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina lleva trabando junto a Emprender desde el año 2004, es cliente antigua de la institucion, anteriormente trabajo en la garantia solidaria Cistalinos, actualmente la Señora se encuentra trabajando de forma individual. La actividad a la que la cliente se dedica es la atencion de tienda de abarrotes paralelamente atiende una tienda libreria-bazar. La Señora vive con su esposo y sus dos sobrinas de las cuales se esta haciendo a cargo.  El destino del credito es de incrementar mercaderia en ambas actividades como ser Fideo, azucar, refrescos, dulces, y para la libreria comprar hojas, libros, cartulinas, lapices, boligrafos, marcadores, etc. para que asi su tienda este bien surtida.La Sra. Cristina es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, esta muy agradecida con Emprender Y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Señora Cristina has been working with Emprender since 2004 and is a standing client. Previously, she worked with the communal bank Cistalinos. Currently, Señora Cristina is self -employed. She runs a grocery store and a bookstore/bazaar. She lives with her husband and her two nephews, for whom she is responsible. She will use the loan to increase the amount of merchandise in both her stores with items such as noodles, sugar, soft drinks and candy, and in the bookstore with items such as paper, books, cards, pencils, pens, markers, etc., so that her store is well-stocked. Señora Cristina is a very hard-working person and is responsible with her payments. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown by granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store and bookstore

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La Señora Leonarda C. tiene 38 años de edad y vive en union libre con el Señor Rodolfo Rivas quien trabaja en la Empresa Nacional Portuaria. El le ayuda economicamente ya que tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella. Leonarda alquila casa ya que no tiene casa propia. Leonarda es muy emprendedora y con deseos de salir adelante tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y productos de consumo popular. 

Leonarda utilizara el prestamo para la compra de pantalones, faldas y ropa interior femenina para incrementar sus ventas ya que han estado bajas este año. Ella invertira las ganancias en la construccion de su propia casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonarda C. is 38 and lives with her common-law husband, Mr. Rodolfo Rivas. He works for the National Port Authority and he helps her financially with her three dependent children. Leonarda rents a house since she doesn’t have one of her own. She is very hardworking and wants to get ahead and thus has a business selling clothing and popular consumer items. Leonarda will use her loan to buy pants, skirts, and ladies underwear to increase her sales since they have been low this year. She will use the earnings to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new clothing

loans.name: Anala Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa tiene 37 años, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Ambos están estudiando en secundaria. La señora se dedica al negocio de elaboración de tortillas, las cuales comercializa de forma ambulante, pese a que también las personas que ya la conocen llegan a su casa a comprar sus productos, Ella además de esto vende ropa usada, esto los distribuye de manera ambulante, sus inicios se dan hace 10 años, esto fue producto de la falta de trabajo y necesitaba una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Este crédito será para la compra de  compra de maíz  pues es importante para la elaboración de tortillas. Su sueño siempre ha sido, que con las utilidades obtenidas del negocio pueda construir su casa, ya que actualmente vive en casa de su mama.
texts.en:
Alma Luisa, age 37, is a single mother with two children under her care. Both of the children are in high school. Alma makes tortillas and sells them in an itinerant manner. The people who already know her come to her house to buy her products. She also sells used clothes, which she distributes in an itinerant manner. She started ten years ago because she did not have work, and she needed a source of income to support her children. With much effort she has been able to support them. She will use this loan to buy corn, which is very important in order to make tortillas. Her dream has always been to be able to build a house with the profits from her business. She currently lives in her mother’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 65 años, es un hombre amante al campo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos. Desde su niñez  se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando lechuga, espinaca y  hierbas aromáticas, siempre y cuando estén en temporada cada producto. Desde entonces esta en constante actividad, aplicando abono y removiendo la tierra, para asegurar que sus cultivos estén bien cuidados. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, tanto en la recolección de los productos como en su comercialización. Para él es importante continuar cultivando  sus tierras y buscar otras estrategias de venta que le generen más ganancias. Su mayor anhelo es tener su granja de patos, gallinas, cuy y conejo; ya que el espacio que tiene en su casa se acondiciona para tal propósito. Este es décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le crédito le será muy provechoso para invertir en sus cultivos,  por lo que compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas. Sus compañeras de le bromean mucho, por lo que es el único varón integrante a su grupo. El dinero, las va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos y comprará madera para fabricar corral apropiado para su añorada granja.
texts.en:
Victor is a 65 year old gentleman who loves living in the country. He has his own home where he lives with his wife and six children. Ever since he was a young man, Victor has been dedicated to agriculture, growing lettuce, spinach, and aromatic herbs according to the season. Since then farming has become a constant activity, continually applying compost and plowing the land to ensure that the crops receive the best care. Occasionally he receives the help of his wife and children, specifically with the harvesting of his products so that they can be sold. It is very important for Victor to continue cultivating his land and looking for sales strategies that will generate more profits. His greatest wish is to have a farm with ducks, chickens, guinea pigs, and rabbits since he already has a space at his house that is set aside for this purpose.

This is his tenth loan with MFP. Victor knows that the loan will be valuable for investing in his crops, so he promises to complete all of his payments. The other group members tease him frequently since he is the only male member of his group. His loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers for his crops and wood to build an appropriately sized corral for his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & wood for building a corral

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 4 young bulls.

loans.name: Kelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Kelly Rodríguez, una joven de 30 años que vive en el Municipio de Puerto Colombia tiene un restaurante llamado “Mi restaurante” que
necesita un credikiva para comprar víveres, algunos utensilios de cocina y adecuar su estufa a gas natural para no seguir cocinando con carbón vegetal. Este negocio empezó cuando ella y su esposo se encontraban desempleados y encontraron esta actividad como alternativa de ingreso, cuando un familiar los ayudó con los primeros  $500.000 COP. Su restaurante  ya tiene más de un año de estar funcionando y la acogida ha sido inmensa, porque sus almuerzos son preparados con la más rica sazón y una calidad inigualable.

Kelly ha recibido dos créditos a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su inversión ha sido muy positiva, porque le ha permitido fortalecer sus ingresos y remodelar poco a poco su vivienda.
Ahora sueña con poder remodelar su pequeño restaurante y volverlo un lugar cómodo y acogedor para que cada días más habitantes de Puerto Colombia sean sus clientes.
Su desafío principal es la competencia pues constantemente debe estarse preparando para afrontarla, porque son usuales los negocios de comidas en este sector que es un importante puerto turístico.
texts.en:
Kelly Rodríguez, a young 30-year-old lady who lives in the Municipio de Puerto Colombia, has a restaurant called "Mi restaurante", and she needs a loan from Kiva to buy supplies, kitchen utensils, and adapt her stove for natural gas so not to continue cooking with charcoal. This business began when she and her husband were out of work and found this activity as an alternative to obtain income as a relative helped them with the first $500.000 COP. Their restaurant has been working for a year and is very popular as the brunches are prepared with rich flavor and incomparable quality.

Kelly has received two loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and the investment has been very positive as they have allowed her to increase her income and remodel her dwelling little by little. Now she dreams of remodelling her small restaurant and make it comfortable and cozy in order to receive more clients from Puerto Colombia. Her main challenge is the competition, she must always be prepared to face it as food businesses are popular as this area is an important tourist harbour.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies, kitchen utensils and adapt stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase agricultural insumables.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana del Carmen, tiene 32 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Alegría departamento de Usulután, es casada vive con su esposo y su hijo de tres años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina.
El negocio lo inicio hace tres años de manera ambulante y actualmente tiene un puesto ubicado en el parque de Alegría, ella ofrece ropa para da señoritas y niños, actualmente ella necesita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de prendas como son  blusas, faldas, trajes para niños, pantalones para dama y sabanas para dormir. Con esta inversión ella fortalecerá el negocio, ofrecerá nuevos productos para atraer clientes y obtener más ventas.
Las aspiraciones de Ana son que la época de lluvia no le afecte para sus ventas, contribuir para seguir trabando en su negocio y si darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana del Carmen is 32 years old, she lives in the Municipio de Alegría, department of Usulután, she is married and lives with her husband and her three-year-old son. She sells ladies´ clothing for a living.

She started as a street vendor three years ago and presently she has a stall located in the park of Alegría. She sells clothes for ladies and children and at the moment she needs a loan to invest in buying garments such as blouses, skirts, suits for children, trousers for ladies, and sheets. With this investment she will strengthen the business offering new products to aattract customers and obtain more sales.

Ana´s aspiration is that the rainy season may not affect her sales, to be able to continue with her business and give her family a better life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, skirts, suits for children, trousers for ladies, and sheets.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Antonia es cliente nueva, vive en casa familiar con su esposo y sus pequeño hijito, la actividad a la que ella se dedica es la D. venta D. comida el plaza German Busch, paralelamente a esta tambien se dedica a la elaboracion D. mantillas D. polar, se ha podido apreciar que es una mujer decidida y con ganas D. superacion. La inversion del prestamo es para la compra D. insumos como ser Papa. fideo, arroz. aceite, carne, etc. para la elaboracion D. sus comidas, tambien comprara tela polar por mayor para la confeccion D. mantillas, D. esta forma la ganancia D. esta actividad sera mayor. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Antonia is a new client, she lives in the family home with her husband and her young son. She sells food at the Plaza German Busch for a living and she also makes polar mantillas. It is obvious that she is a dedicated lady who wants to improve herself. The loan will be invested in buying supplies such as potato, fideo, cooking oil, meat, etc. to prepare her meals as well as polar cloth to make the mantillas so profits will improve. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence when granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 40 de años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo e hijo. La actividad cotidiana a la que se dedica Mónica, es la venta de zapatos, provenientes de Trujillo, ciudad considerada como uno de los buenos fabricantes de zapatos. En invierno vende botas y en verano sandalias, hecho de cuero, material que es muy solicitado por sus clientes, quienes no dudan en pagar el costo del producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que un negocio rentable, de esa manera ha transcurrido 15 años, y aún tiene que viajar a Trujillo  para proveerse de productos. Mas adelante anhela comprase su departamento, y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, y sabe que le crédito le será muy útil para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará mas calzados al por mayor; ya que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Mónica is 40 years old and a hard-working mother who lives in her own house with her husband and child. The activity that Mónica dedicates herself to on a daily basis is the sale of shoes manufactured in the city of Trujillo, an area known for the excellent quality of its footwear. In the winter, she sells boots, and in summer, sandals. These are made of leather, a material that is in great demand by customers, who willingly pay the asking prices for this type of product. What she enjoys most about her work is the fact that it is profitable. She has been in business for 15 years, even though she has to travel to Trujillo to buy her merchandise. In the future, she hopes to buy a store and provide a better standard of living for her family. This is her eleventh loan with MFP, and she knows that the funds will be very useful toward augmenting her working capital. She commits to make her loan payments on time. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more shoes at wholesale, given she has several orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: La Caridad 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Felicita is the coordinator of her group La Caridad 1 & 2 (The Charity). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children. 

Felicita is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to expand her fried food stand where she sells hot dogs, chicken, plantain and meats, and extend her products to shoes and cosmetics. She will use the profits to invest in other products like jewelry, to buy her children school supplies and to change her family's  lifestyle. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying making business. She is always doing a work activity and after she got her first loan and started with her fried food stand, with every loan she is thinking to expand her business.

Felicita's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries, the main economic activity is a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: To expand her business where she sells fried food, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming supplies & pay for labor

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Señora Julia es cliente antigua anteriormente trabajo en la garantia cruzada UVITAS pero ahora esta trabajando de forma individual, ella lleva siendo cliente de Emprender desde el año 2004, durante todo este tiempo la cliente a demostrado ser una persona responsable y puntual con vision de superacion. La cliente vive en anticretico, comparte vivienda con su hija quien esta estudiando en la Universidad Mayor de San Andres en la carrera de Economia.  El credito estara destinado a la compra de vajilla por mayor para luego ser empaquetada como regalo y poder ser comercializado en las puertas de los salones de fiestas, a la Sra.le va muy bien con esta actividad y esta muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is a long time client who previous worked with the UVITAS solidarity group, but is now working as an individual. She has been a client of Emprender since 2004. During that time, Julia has proven herself to be a responsible and punctual person with the vision to excel. She lives in an “anticrético” property. (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.) Her daughter lives with her and is studying for a degree in Economics at the Greater University of San Andres.

This loan will be used to buy dishware in bulk that she will package as gifts and then sell at the entrances of banquet halls. Sra. Julia has done very well in this business and is very grateful to Emprender for providing this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dishware to sell as gifts

loans.name: Luisa Lavina

texts.es:
La señora Luisa Lavina P. S., tiene 56 años de edad vive en el barrio Medardo Andino, ahí habita con su familia, su esposo labora en el Magfor y apoya con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, sus hijos son  mayores de edad que trabajan y también aportan su ayuda económica a sus padres, ella es secretaria de la Universidad Americana UAM.

Ellos son una familia que sus limitados ingresos no le han permitido han permitido llevar a cabo todas las remodelaciones que su hogar necesita, sobretodo que necesita cambiar las laminas de zinc, y embaldosar el piso de la sala, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para la compra de todos los materiales de construcción que le permitan llevar a cabo estas remodelaciones que favorecerán a habitar en un espacio más digno, seguro y cómodo para todos los miembros de su familia, sobretodo la satisfacción como padres de ofrecerles a sus hijos estas buenas condiciones para su buen desarrollo socio-económico.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa Lavina P. S. is 56 years old and lives with her family in the neighborhood of Medardo Andino. Her husband is an employee of MAGFOR (Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry) and contributes toward the household income. Her grown children are working and also help with the expenses. Luisa works as a secretary at Universidad Americana (UAM).

Since her family has limited resources, Luisa is not able to finish all the necessary renovations to her house which include replacing the sheets of zinc roofing and tiling the living room floor. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy the construction materials needed to complete these improvements so that her family can live in a space that is more dignified, safer, and more comfortable. As parents, Luisa and her husband want to provide good conditions in which her children can develop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete home improvements

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene  37 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene dos hijos, uno de dos años y el otro de ocho meses de edad a su cargo. El se dedica a un taller de elaboración de ventanas de aluminio y vidrio. Generalmente la gente le llama o va a su casa a solicitar el producto y cuando el llega  las instala le pagan. El dio inicio a su negocio desde hace 6 años, comenzó vendiendo ventanas de madera y después fue creciendo las ofertas de sus productos, fue allí cuando él decidió incorporar vidrio a sus productos y poco a poco ha ido cambiando hasta llegar a trabajar con aluminio. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de materias materiales que son necesarios en su negocio para realizar la elaboración de sus productos. Su sueño siempre ha sido hacer más grande el negocio y si es posible llegar a competir con las distribuidoras de vidrios más grandes.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson is 37 years old, married, and has two dependent children, a two year old and an eight month old. He has a workshop where he manufactures windows made of aluminum and glass. His customers usually call or come by his house to place their orders. He gets paid when the windows are installed. Nelson started this business six years ago. He started selling window frames made of wood and afterwards began offering more products as his business grew. When he began incorporating glass into his products, he gradually switched over to making aluminum frames.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of materials that are needed in his business so that he can continue making his products. His dream has always been to expand his business so that he could complete with the larger glass distributors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy materials

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos tiene 20 años de edad y el otro tiene 17 años de edad a su cargo. Tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de discos y otros productos, tales como frutas y verduras, también vende adornos y artículos escolares. Cuando la señora inicio este negocio con capital prestado de su papa, ya que ella para ese tiempo no tenía trabajo, su esposo estaba sin trabajo ya que trabaja en construcción por lo que su situación era muy difícil y solamente ella trabajaba. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercaderías, ya que desea aprovechar las fiestas de Santiago que se acercan y que son fechas buenas de ventas. Su deseo es llegar a comprarse un modulo en el mercado para brindar mayor seguridad a su producto.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 37 years old, married, and has two children. The oldest child is 20 years old and the other one is 17 and still under her care. For the past six years Maria has been in the business of selling DVDs and other products such as fruits, vegetables, decorations, and school supplies. She started her business using seed money that she borrowed from her father since she did not have a job at the time. Her husband also did not have a job since he worked in construction, so their situation was very difficult and she was the only one working.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. She wants to take advantage of the festivals of Santiago (Saint James) since she generates good sales on these occasions. Her wish is to acquire a storefront where her merchandise will be more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: La Caridad 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the coordinator of her group La Caridad 3, 4 & 2 (The Charity). She makes her home here in a simple structure, being a single mom with one child. She says that her most difficult challenges are to have a successful business in her local village and expand it to other villages in her city, where demands are higher.

Felicia is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells silver jewelry, other accessories and womens shoes. She will use the profits to buy some school supplies, to eat better and expand her business to other communities in other products. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking for her family and doing her housework. She is excited to have this loan because she wants to invest more, get low interest and save money for the future.

Felicia's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries, the main economic activity is a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry, accessories and shoes.

loans.name: Luchadoras Por Un Sueño Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Luchadoras por un Sueño” consists of 22 entrepreneurs from the community of Angol, which is located 128 kilometres northwest of Temuco in the south of Chile, lying 608 kilometres south of Santiago. Their businesses consist primarily of a telephone center, a hair salon, sewing, and a general store, as well as the sale of chocolates, desserts, sweets, vegetables, linens, snacks, plants, clothes, fruit, flour, and bread.

Mónica, the president of this group, is shown in the picture seated second from the left wearing a purple scarf. For just over two years she has sold various perfumes which she orders via telephone from Santiago and has sent to her home. With this loan Mónica will purchase perfumes and another sample kit to demonstrate both her current and new products. She will also start making rosary necklaces of thread and wood since she already knows how to make pretty ropes for necklaces and plant hangers.

Mónica’s dream is to maintain her business and her clientele. For her, the business is very productive, and she greatly enjoys the activity and the money she earns from it. And what Mónica likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the unity she feels between herself and the other members of the group.

loans.use: Perfumes

loans.name: Patricia Fatima

texts.es:
Doña Patricia tiene la edad de 47 años, madre de tres hijos, el cual crió sola,  ya que es madre soltera, su trabajo ha sido la venta de ropa, peluches, zapatos en poca cantidad por que no cuenta con mucho capital, pero ha sobresalido adelante.
Su mama la apoyado siempre, a ella y sus hijos. Ahora cuenta con el apoyo de Su hijo mayor el cual da para que pague los gastos básicos.
En estos años ah adquirido clientela, en donde le hacen encargos. Pero necesita aumentar su inventario para incrementar las ventas, es por eso recurre al financiamiento para comprar una variedad de productos como: una docena de pantalón de mujer, bikinis, bóxer, sandalias, y gel de cabello, crema de cuerpo, pinturas de uñas entre otros producto para atraer al cliente.
Con el objetivo que si no vende de un producto, vende otros.
Contenta por que a trabes de esta inversión mejorara su economía.
texts.en:
Doña Patricia is a 47 year old single mother with three children who she raised by herself. Her business involves selling clothing, plush toys, and shoes in small quantities since she has very little capital. This has enabled her to get ahead.

Patricia’s mother has always supported her and her children. Now she has the support of her oldest child who contributes toward basic expenses. In recent years she has acquired more customers and received more orders, so she needs to increase her inventory in order to keep up with sales. For this reason, Patricia is requesting another loan to buy a variety of products such as a dozen women’s trousers, bikinis, boxer shorts, sandals, hair gels, body crèmes, nail polishes, and other goods to offer to her customers. Her goal is to sell different types of products, not just one. She is happy that this investment will improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene 19 años, es soltera y comparte su vida con sus padres, vive en casa de ellos. Hace más de 6 meses se dedica en la venta de prendas de vestir, para ello cuenta con un puesto en la feria comercial de su ciudad. Desde entonces su trabajo lo realiza los domingos, siendo su madre quien la ayuda en la atención. Durante los días de semana solo logra vender su mercadería a sus vecinos y amistades a crédito, por lo que procura que sean clientes responsables con el pago.  Lo que más le agrada de su negocio es que le permite poder estudiar y superarse, a la vez que puede sostenerse económicamente. Por tanto continuara trabajando con la meta que se ha propuesto, que es el tener un puesto estable donde pueda vender más ropa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, puesto que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en prendas de vestir para esta temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Janeth is 19 years old, single, and living with her parents. For more than 6 months, she has been selling clothing from a stand at the market in her city. She works on Sundays, and her mother helps her tend to the business. During the week, she only manages to sell to her friends and neighbors on credit, and she tries to find customers who will be responsible about paying. What she enjoys most about her work is that it allows her to study and get ahead, given that she can support herself financially. Therefore, she plans to continue working on the goal she has set for herself, which is to secure a stable location where she can sell more clothing. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know she has financial support. She enjoys being a member of her cooperative because the members are very responsible and there is solidarity among the group. She thanks those who may be granters of this loan, as it will be very helpful to her in growing her business. She plans to use the funds to buy more winter clothing for this season.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Claudia Asunción

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Asunción H. L., tiene 47 años de edad vive en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, es casada y su esposo labora como comerciante, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, que se dedican  a estudiar la Universidad, ha sido con el esfuerzo de sus padres que se dedican a la venta de ropa, zapatos y bisutería desde hace tiempo atrás apoyando de esta manera a sus hijos a la culminación de sus carreras profesionales.

Es para el negocio que solicita un préstamo, para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería y de esta manera  aumentar sus volúmenes de venta y sus ingresos le permitirán mejores condiciones que favorezcan a toda la familia en proyectos de nuevas fuentes de inversión para la mejora continua de su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudia Asunción H. L. is 47 years old, married, and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla subdivision. Her husband works as a merchant and they have three adult children who are university students. To fulfill their duties as parents, Claudia and her husband have been selling clothing, shoes, and accessories for quite some time. This enables them to support their children until they are able to complete their professional degrees.

Claudia is requesting a business loan so that she can buy more merchandise to add to her inventory. This will allow her to increase her sales volume and earn more income to provide better conditions for the entire family. In addition, this new source of investment will help improve the family’s financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more inventory

loans.name: Genoviva

texts.en:
Genoviva A. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Narcery, Brgy. East, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store.

Genoviva’s husband Lorito is a driver and they have five children who are between 9 and 23 years old.  Two of their children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Genoviva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000 from her business activities.

Genoviva is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her eighth loan in the amount of PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her general store. She is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Keyla

texts.es:
Keyla es una joven de 25 años de edad, casada, madre de un hijo, vive en una comarca Sabana Grande, su negocio es la venta de ropa y venta de cosméticos, iniciando, con poco dinero que su  esposo dio.
El tiene su trabajo fijo en zona franca como empacador.
Juntos se han esforzado para tener su propia casa, el cual han avanzado. Pero quisieran pasarse pronto pero no cuentan con el dinero en efectivo, para comprar el zinc, perlines, golosos y puertas para cerrar su casa.
El cual mediante este financiamiento se le esta haciendo posible, el poder pasarse pronto a su casa.
Sus planes es comprar vitrinas para exhibir su mercadería de ropa ahora que se pase a su casa.
texts.en:
Keyla is a young woman who is 25 years of age, married, and the mother of one child. She lives in the district of Sabana Grande. Keyla has a business selling clothing and cosmetics that she started with a small amount of money that her husband gave to her. She also has a permanent job working as a packer in the free trade zone.

Keyla and her husband have worked hard to acquire their own house, which is in the advanced stages of construction. They want to finish the process as soon as possible but they do not have the money to buy zinc, crossbeams, doors, and other items needed to complete the house. The loan will make this possible so that they can begin spending time in their house.

Keyla has plans to buy display cabinets for exhibiting her merchandise once her house is completed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies needed to finish her house

loans.name: Danilo Candelario

texts.es:
El señor Danilo Candelario P. G., tiene la edad de 37 años es casado y habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, su esposa se dedica a  la costura y tienen dos hijos pequeños que estudian la primaria, es gracias a su trabajo y los ingresos de su familia, que logran solventar los gastos del hogar.

Ellos no habitan en casa propia, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan edificar su hogar, este no es el primer préstamo con Afodenic, pues dicen sentirse agradecidos con los fondos Kiva por apoyarles a desarrollar en buenas condiciones su hogar y a sus hijos ahora poder ofrecerles mejores comodidades para su desarrollo socio económico.
texts.en:
Sr. Danilo Candelario P. G. is 37 years old, married, and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla subdivision. His wife works as a seamstress and they have two young children attending elementary school. Thanks to their work and the family income, they are able to cover the household expenses.

They do not own a home. For this reason, Danilo is requesting a loan to buy construction materials so that he can start building a house. This is his first loan with AFODENIC and he says he is grateful for the Kiva funds in helping him develop good living conditions for his children. Now he wants to make them more comfortable by developing a better financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to begin the construction of his house

loans.name: Lucinda Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Lucinda inicia ciclo 14 con 12 socias que realizan diferentes negocio.
L. Señora Nora es L. presidenta del Banco Comunal, Nora es casada y tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales 3 todavía viven con elL. y estudian en el colegio. Durante el tiempo que esta en Finca aprendió a ahorrar y los prestamos son D. mucha ayuda para su negocio.
Nora junto a su esposo tiene un taller D. mecánica y cerrajería en L. selva ayacuchana D. Palmapampa, Nora se encarga D. enviar los insumos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, viaja cada 15 días a L. selva, los demás días se encarga D. L. atención D. sus hijos. En algunas oportunidades Nora viaja a las ferias en donD. compra productos para comercializar. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. pintura.
Nora vive en una casa D. material rustico y ahora sueña con construir su casa D. material noble, tener una tienda granD. en su casa y que sus últimos hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Lucinda Communal Bank is in its 14th loan cycle with 12 members who engage in different businesses.

Sra. Nora is the Communal Bank President. She is married and has seven children, three of whom still live with her and attend high school. Throughout the time she has been a member of FINCA, Nora has learned how to save. The loans have been a great help to her business.

Nora and her husband manage an auto repair and locksmith shop in the Ayacucho jungle community of Palmapampa. She is in charge of acquiring supplies from the city of Ayacucho. Nora has to travel into the jungle every 15 days and spends the rest of her time taking care of her children. On a few occasions, she goes to the fairs to buy products that she will sell. Her loan will be used to buy paint.

Nora lives in a house maD. of basic materials. Now she dreams of building a larger house maD. of solid materials and seeing her youngest children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paint

loans.name: Los Olivos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Olivos inicia su séptimo ciclo con 18 socias que son del Barrio D. Los Olivos.
L. Señora Lis es L. presidenta por tercera vez D. su Banco Comunal, Lis es conviviente y tiene un hijo D. 3 años, durante el tiempo que es socia aprendió a ser puntual y responsable.
Lis vive en L. casa e sus suegros en donD. tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, también venD. carnes, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días. Lis también venD. cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además Lis junto a su pareja tienen un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico a L. Selva Ayacuchana. Lis solicita un préstamo que será invertido en L. compra D. arroz, aceite y atún.
Los sueños D. Lis son ampliar su negocio, tener una tienda D. calzados y ropa.
texts.en:
The Los Olivos (The Olives) Communal Bank has initiated its 7th loan cycle with 18 members, all from the Barrio D. Los Olivos. For the 3rd time, Lis is the president of the Communal Bank. She lives with a partner and has a 3 year old son. While Lis has been president, she has learned to be punctual and responsible. Lis lives in her in-laws' house where she has a grocery store and sells meat and vegetables, an activity she does every day. Lis also sells cosmetics by catalog, which she offers to friends and family. In addition, Lis and her partner have a car that provides them with transport to the jungle of Ayacucho. Lis is requesting a loan to buy rice, cooking oil, and tuna. Lis's dreams are to expand her store, and to open a shoe and clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RICE, COOKING OIL, AND TUNA TO SELL

loans.name: Silvia Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Silvia es una mujer emprendedora, madre de tres hijos, desde joven ha trabajado, aprendió costura el cual eran parte de sus ingresos, pero luego se dedica  ala venta de cosméticos  y ropa nueva el cual el cincuenta por ciento vende por encargo,  lleva varios años, afiliada con la Avon, ya que son productos, accesibles de precios, bonitos, y reconocidos por los clientes.
Lo que desea hacer para mejorar su higiene es la terminación de un sumidero y comprar el inodoro para instalarlo y poder estar en mejores condiciones.
Ya que no cuenta con las aguas negras. Lo que se le ha hecho difícil poder hacer esta obra, ya que no cuenta con todo el efectivo, es por eso requiere del financiamiento y poder pagar a plazos que es de beneficios para hacer las mejoras de infraestructura que son de altos costos.
texts.en:
Silvia is an enterprising woman and the mother of three children. She has worked since she was very young; she learned how to make clothing, which provided part of her income, but later she started selling cosmetics and new clothing. She sells 50% of her products in response to customer orders. She has been affiliated with Avon for several years, since the company offers products which are affordable, attractive and recognized by her customers. What Silvia would like to do is improve the sanitary conditions in her home by completing the construction of a drain and purchasing and installing a toilet. This will greatly improve the situation in her home, since she currently does not have a wastewater connection. It has been difficult for her to undertake this project before now, since she has not had sufficient cash on hand to complete it. For this reason, she needs a loan, so that she can pay the amount over time and reap the benefits of this infrastructural improvement project, which is quite costly.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a drain and installing a toilet to improve her home's sanitary conditions

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 40 años,  Vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de12 años vende cosméticos, ya sea por medio de un catálogo o muestras que posee, siéndole de mucha ventaja para que el cliente tenga la seguridad de elegir alguna mercadería. Desde entonces realiza constantemente visita a los domicilios de sus clientes. Asimismo tiene la ayuda de otras personas a vender sus productos en zonas aledañas a su localidad. Siempre esta en búsqueda de nuevos clientes, de esa manera aumentan sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en este rubro, porque tiene mucha demanda además que recibe incentivos por parte de la empresa que es su proveedora de cosméticos. Durante estos años de trabajo ha visto crecer su negocio y en la actualidad posee buena cantidad de mercadería y aunque ofrece al crédito sus productos, tiene disponible suficiente cantidad de cosméticos para seguir ofertándolos. Su deseo es tener una tienda de cosméticos en una zona comercial y repartir al por mayor estos productos. Es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en cosméticos de temporada.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in a house they own. She has been selling cosmetics for more than 12 years, either by catalog or through actual samples that she has. This is tremendously helpful to her, as customers can be assured that they are selecting the right product for their needs. She constantly visits the homes of her customers in order to sell. In addition, she has several other people that help her sell in neighboring areas. She is always seeking out new clients so she can increase sales and, therefore, her income. She tells us she enjoys her work because there is a lot of demand, and she also has incentives from the maker of the line of cosmetics that she markets. Over the years, she has seen her business grow and she currently has a good supply of merchandise. Even though some of her sales are on credit, she still has enough products to continue selling. Her wish is to have her own store in a commercial zone, and to sell cosmetics at wholesale. This is her sixth loan through MFP. She is very happy to know she has financial support, and has historically demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments. In addition, she is thankful to be part of her cooperative group because the members are very responsible people with a lot of support for each other. She thanks those people out there who might help fill this loan, as it will be very helpful to her in growing her business. She will use the loan funds to buy more seasonal cosmetic products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business with more beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Paying credit card debt with Citibank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy women's and men's pants, blouses, men's shirts, shoes and sandals

loans.name: Julito

texts.en: Julito P. is from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. He is 37 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Julito owns and operates a pedicab transport business. Julito has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Julito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en: Eneria T. is from Litapan, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Eneria owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Eneria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Eneria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eneria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eneria is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Eneria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida F. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita S. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Angelita is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business operating motor transport services. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna F. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old. Digna is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Digna owns & operates a business providing motor transport services. Digna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Digna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Digna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Digna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie L. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old. Rosalie is married and has six school-aged children. loans.name: María Jacqueline

texts.es:
María Yacqueline es una joven de 19 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turístico – religiosas y por sus adornos hechos artesanalmente en madera, arcilla y junco, se encuentra ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega – tienda instalada en la casa donde vive, sus principales clientes son sus propios vecinos, los cuales encuentran en su tienda productos de uso diario por los que tendrían que ir hasta el mercado de la localidad. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, su esposo es mototaxista y juntos se esfuerzan al máximo para salir adelante. Precisamente, para poder mantenerse en el negocio María siempre trata de brindarle a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y un trato amable.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de manera que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer que ha sabido salir adelante gracias a su propio esfuerzo, su calidad de vida ha mejorado relativamente y ello le da ganas de esforzarse aún mas en su negocio, en la zona donde vive ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada.
texts.en:
Maria Yacqueline is a young woman of 19 who lives with her husband in the Monsefú district, an area known for its touristic and religious festivities and for its handmade decorations made of wood, clay, and rushes. It is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She sells basic products and groceries in a store located in the house where she lives. Her principal customers are her own neighbors, who find in her store the daily necessities for which they would otherwise have to go to the local market. This business is of great help to her family's finances. Her husband drives a motorcycle taxi, and together they exert themselves to the maximum to advance themselves. Indeed, to be able to support herself in this business, Maria always tries to offer her customers products of good quality and pleasant service. Maria wants to increase her business with the purchase of more products, so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers. For this reason, she has applied for the first time to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 800 PEN to help her achieve her objective. Maria is a woman who has known how to advance herself through her own effort. Her quality of life has improved relatively, and this gives her the will to exert herself in her business even more. In the district where she lives, she is a well known and admired woman.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products and groceries to increase her business

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Caminantes se ha organizado para solicitar un crédito, este es su primer ciclo, tiene como presidenta a la señora Vanessa Q., la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Santiago II, son ocho integrantes.  La señora Vanessa tiene como negocio la venta de comida por las mañanas y las noches en la Autopista que une las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto, cuando sale a vender en las noches le acompaña el padre de su único hijo.  

Al medio día vende comida en la Zona de Villa Dolores.  Ella solicitó un crédito por Bs.2000.- que le permitirán comprar víveres y otros muebles que necesita.
Cuando se le pregunto si conocía el consultorio de salud comentó que si y que le atendieron bien.

Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen negocios de elaboración de comida, venta de perfumes, venta de abarrotes, edredones, venta de pipocas y  venta de helados.
texts.en:
The communal bank Caminantes has organized to ask for a loan. This is its first cycle and its president is Mrs. Vanessa Q.. This communal bank belongs to the Santiago II center and has eight members. Vanessa has a business selling food mornings and evenings on the highway that links the cities of La Paz and El Alto. When she sells at night the father of her only child accompanies her. At midday she sells food in the area of Villa Dolores. She asked for a loan of Bs.2000, which will allow her to buy groceries and other goods that she needs. When she was asked if she has been to the health center she answered that yes and they attended to her very well. The members of the communal bank have businesses such as preparing food, and selling perfume, groceries, comforters, popcorn and ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and shelves.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a sus dos hijos en el sector Callanca del distrito de Monsefú, un distrito conocido por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas y también por la elaboración de artesanías en madera, arcilla y junco, se encuentra ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de verduras al por mayor y menor en un puesto de venta dentro del Mercado Los Pathos, un mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ella adquiere su mercadería muy temprano a los distribuidores que llegan a su centro de abastos para luego ofrecer su mercadería a sus clientes, en su mayoría vendedores de mercados minoristas. Ella se ha hecho conocida en el rubro gracias a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes.

Esperanza desea mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello ha creído pertinente realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, específicamente en la instalación de servicios higiénicos, los cuales le permitiran contar con servicios básicos. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Esperanza es una mujer honrada y muy trabajadora, ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a 44 year old mother who lives with her two children in the Callanca section of the Monsefú district, a district known for its tourist and religious festivities and also for its crafts of wood, clay and reed. It is located a half hour from the city of Chiclayo. She makes a living selling vegetables wholesale and retail at a stand at the Los Pathos market, a major market in the city of Chiclayo. She obtains her merchandise from the distributors very early at their supply center and later offers the products to her customers, mainly sales people from small markets. She has become known in her trade thanks to the good service that she provides her customers. Esperanza wants to improve her quality of life and therefore finds it necessary to make some improvements to her house, such as the installation of restroom facilities, which will allow her to have basic services. To achieve her goal she is requesting a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Esperanza is an honest and very hard working woman. She has previously worked with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility from the moment she takes over the installments.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for the installation of restroom services at her home.

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members. Mrs. Nam A. is the group leader selected by the other members. She is 58 years old and lives in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. All the group members will use their loan portion for different purposes in which they can improve their standard of living.
Mrs. Nam A. is a widow with three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other attends a local public school. Mrs. Nam A. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows crops to sell to support her family. Currently, she has a problem because her field is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Nam A. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield this current year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

She is a seamstress in garment factory where she earns a low salary to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sam Art Bon, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare (2.5-acre) plot of land that he uses to grow potatoes to sell to support his family.

Now it is time to grow potatoes but Mr. Vuthy H. does not have the money to support it. So, to improve production, he is asking for a loan to grow potatoes. This couple does not have a child and they live with a member household.

loans.use: To grow potatoes

loans.name: Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
LUZ D. SAN ANTONIO

Este grupo se caracteriza por el compañerismo que existe entre ellas las once mujeres, salir adelante no ha sido fácil para cada una D. ellas; sin embargo es admirable ver el trabajo que hacen para no dejar D. faltar la economía en sus hogares tal es el caso D.: 
Giovana es una mujer D. 34 años, viste D. chaleco azul en la fotografía y es la tesorera del grupo.
Como toda madre quiere darle lo mejor a sus hijos, por ello decidió vender zapatos para adultos y niños a la edad D. 30 años, los ofrecía a sus conocidos D. su zona que vive, le fue bien al comienzo pero la competencia surgió en la que tuvo que cambiar D. negocio e iniciar en la venta D. gaseosas, tuvo un pequeño capital D. S/. 60.00 nuevos soles. Este último negocio resultó más rentable; es así que compró la refrigeradora que necesitaba para su negocio. Aprovecha D. esta artefacto para hacer además chupetes D. fruta que ella misma prepara en casa y son muy deliciosos D. varios sabores: lúcuma, mango, fresa.

Ha conseguido hasta el momento con los créditos recibidos invertir más en su negocio con el propósito D. apoyar a su pareja en la educación D. sus hijos con las ganancias que obtiene. Tiene dos hijos uno va a la escuela (16 años) y su hijo mayor es especial D. 17 años, lo ayuda en su tratamiento.
Las ganancias superan a lo que vendía en un inicio.
El crédito será para destinarlo en bebidas y agua mineral.
Tener una pequeña tiendita está en los planes D. Giovana que espera alcanzar no muy lejano.
texts.en:
"LUZ D. SAN ANTONIO" (Saint Antonio's Light) GROUP This group is characterized by the camaraderie that exists amongst the eleven ladies that make up its membership. Getting ahead has not been easy for any of them. Never the less it’s admirable to see the work that they each do in order that their homes are not in need. Such is the case with: Giovana, seen wearing a blue vest in the photograph, is 34 years old and is the group’s treasurer. Like every other mother, she wants to proviD. the best for her children, so at age 30 she decided to sell adults’ and children’s shoes to her acquaintances within the zone where she lives. Things were going well for her at first, but then the competition surged and she had to change her business and begin selling soft drinks instead. She had a little working capital, 60 PEN, to start with, but this new business has been more profitable than the previous one, so she was able to buy the refrigerator that she needed. She also uses [the refrigerator] to her advantage and makes and sells frozen, homemaD., fruit flavored popsicles. They are delicious and come in various flavors, including: Lucama (a type of tropical fruit), mango, and strawberry. Until now she has used the money from previous loans to invest in her business, with the intent of using the money from her income to help her husband pay for their children’s education. She has two children, one of whom is 16 years old and attends school, and the other, 17 years old, is a special needs child whom she helps with his treatments. Her income is greater than it was during her initial sales. She will use the money from this loan to invest in drinks and mineral water. Giovana plans to open a small store in the near future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Ramazana

texts.en:
Ramazana lives in a city called Riwind, which is a small city near Lahore Pakistan. 
She is a widow who lost her husband a few years ago as a result of a sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her and her family but she never gave up. 


Her husband was the only breadwinner in the family, so, after his death, his son had to stop his education. He started a photo studio business with the help of a loan from Asasah. 


She spends her time with her cattle. She feels good having them and taking care of them.  
Ramzana’s son's business is now working well and he is making a handsome income every month. 


Ramzana has applied for a loan to financially assist her brother who will buy a photocopy machine to expand his photocopy business. 
She is hopeful that, as before, her decision to take a loan from Aasash will also be a productive one for her brother’s business.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier for her brother's photocopy business

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is the mother of seven children; four of them do different kinds of work while the other three are getting an education. 
She is a widow whose husband died a few years ago leaving her alone in this world to fight for her and her children’s survival. 
She never gave up and started sewing clothes for her local clients. 


Now her sons are grown up and they have taken the financial responsibility on their shoulders. 
Shamim has applied for a loan for her son who drives a rickshaw which he rents. Now he wants to buy his own rickshaw to minimize his expenses and increase his income. 


Shamim is a regular client of Asasah and her credit behavior is very good. This is her fifth year with Asasah.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Srey Mom's Group

texts.en: The four group members have selected Mrs. Srey Mom H., 40 years old, as the group leader. The group is located in Preaek Anhchanh village in Kandal province. All the members will use their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Srey Mom H. is a fruit seller in her local market where she earns some money to raise her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Srey Mom H. is applying for a loan to buy more fruit to sell. Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeurn Nou, is a teacher. This couple supports six children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others attend the local public school and help with their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Asasah to expand her milk selling business. 


She lives with her family in a city called Riwind in Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Only one of them is able to attend school. 


Her husband does two jobs. In the morning he works in a school as a watchman while, in the evening, he sells milk. In the absence of her husband in the morning, Shahnaz takes care of her buffaloes by giving them food. 


She is unable to supply enough milk to meet customer demand due to low milk productivity. So, she has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy another buffalo. This is her fifth loan from Asasah. She hopes that getting this loan will be a profitable step and will do a lot of good for her business, as before.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
In order to generate additional income and to help her husband support the family, Karen M. ventured into making and selling food. She prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals.She has been in this business for 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. Karen and her family live happily in the village of Lalog 2, Luna, Isabela. At the age of 40, Karen and her husband are now blessed with 2 school-aged children.

In 2010, Karen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Karen is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to provide working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Karen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

Now they have an obstacle because they don't have enough money to grow their crops. So to improve production, Mrs. Yoeun S. is seeking a loan to do farming this current year to increase the yield. She is a mother of five children. Four of the children attend the local public school, and the other one is just five years old.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita joined ASHI in 2007. She is very happy because she is able to help her husband in meet the needs of the family. The couple love what they do in making their business achievements. For her, it is a joy to see fulfillment in her business and family and, with her children growing up, she will want to see them having a decent life someday.

Anita sells food supplement products. She plans to use this loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to expand her business and get involved in other businesses for supplementary profits. She will use this loan to buy assorted food supplement products. During her two years as a member of ASHI, Anita has performed very well and ASHI trusts her to repay her loans.

This loan fund will enable her to finally achieve her dreams in life: to have a winning business, the best in life, and a happy family as well. She is very thankful to ASHI for their continuous support of her dreams. She also hoping that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can provide a sustainable life for her family that enables them to have a comfortable house to live in and to fund a college education of her two children.

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely S. and her husband cultivate land to farm rice. When a harvest is good, the product is sold to market through a middleman, while some is stored for their family consumption, especially for the lean months or rainy days. During these months (from May to August), everything in the market is priced expensively, while small and poor entrepreneurs like Lovely cannot price her rice high because she has to earn in any way possible and does not have a storage room or facilities to preserve the good quality of their rice. Without any other options, the woman has to sell her rice during the peak of harvest, when supply is high and demand goes low.

The loans Lovely has accessed through her membership in ASHI since 2008 have been a great help to her family and business. When she received a small amount of capital from ASHI,she managed to put it all into her business. For her, business is an important factor, and she does not want to  be a problem for her weekly payments. The profit she gains from her business has enabled her to support  the educational needs of her five children,whose ages are from 3 to  13 years old and save some of the money to support agricultural needs for the next cropping(planting season).                                                

As parents, Lovely and her husband Vicente don’t want their children to inherit their very poor kind of life someday. As much as possible, they really want all of their children to graduate from college and find a better and stable kind of job someday. In the light of this, Lovely is requesting another loan through ASHI to increase her capital investment to the business, hoping that it will grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as rise seedling and fertilizers. Some of the amount will be used for farming facilities and farm laborers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
50-year-old Norma C. and her husband Clemente’s 11 children have their own family now. However, being a mother who sees the poor situation of her children and grandchildren, she is motivated to be as productive as she can to augment the lives of her loved ones. Clemente is a farmer who plants rice and vegetables on a small parcel of land they own. Norma is a support that strengthens her husband’s livelihood, being the one who sells their products, and a help with their financial needs. Norma also has her own business venture with the support of her husband. Through the loans she received since she joined ASHI in 2007, she has been able to purchase coconut fruit from the landowners of a coconut land. She pays in advance and they are the ones to harvest the fruit when it is mature. With it, Norma and her husband have able to make “copra” which they sell in large volume to a middleman who transports and does wholesaling to a manufacturer of coconut oil in the neighboring province. As the amount of loans she requests and receives through ASHI increases, the coconut land she has able to invest on also expands, thus making the volume of her sales grow bigger and bigger.

Norma really enjoyed the business she does and her family enjoys the profit it makes. Because of this, the woman really wishes that her business would become sustainable and profitable in the future so she can employ her family members and improve their lives. With this vision, she and her husband agreed to request a much larger loan through ASHI. Since both are working so hard to grow their business and maintain a very good performance in ASHI in terms of payments and attendance at weekly center meetings, they believe that they are qualified to be trusted with the amount they are requesting.

loans.use: To purchase a larger volume of coconut

loans.name: Mr. Narong Yin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
