loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: G. Charlotte est née le 01 Novembre 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Charlotte vit depuis sa naissance à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à SOHOU Dieudonné, un menuisier, Charlotte est mère d'un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. Charlotte vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Charlotte n'est jamais allée à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure. Parallèlement, Charlotte vend dans son salon de coiffure, des mèches, des papiers d'emballage et divers autres produits cosmétiques. Charlotte exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Charlotte achète ses produits. En vue d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle, Charlotte sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. G. Charlotte was born on November 1, 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Since birth, she has lived in Agblangandan, in the community of Sèmè-Podji.  Married to Mr. SOHOU Dieudonné, a carpenter, she is the mother of one child who is not yet in school.  Charlotte lives together with her husband and child.  The couple jointly provide for their family. Charlotte never went to school but has learned how to style hair.  Concurrently, she sells hair extensions, wrapping paper, and a variety of cosmetics in her hair salon.  She has been in this business for five years.  She purchases her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  To expand her business and increase her customer base, Charlotte is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Bendiya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Bendiya 1 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46  ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil et le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ROKIA LAMINE D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Bendiya 1 are married women who average 36 years of age and three children each.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of winter.  The crops include peanuts, pearl millet, and corn.   The group members are on their fifth farm loan, and all the previous loans have been repaid. With this new loan, Ms. ROKIA LAMINE D. intends to buy supplies (ahead of price increases) and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of labor for maintaining about a hectare of peanuts.  After harvesting, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of retailers.  The group members plan on making an average profit of about 45,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing, seeds, manure, herbicide, weeding, and equipment

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol Z. is from the village of Dadda, Tuguegarao City. She is 36 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Mirasol owns and operates a business raising and fattening pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Mirasol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Bendiya 2 Group

texts.fr:
Bendiya 2 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45  ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide,   le petit mil et le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBOU C. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,3 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 52000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
"Bendiya 2" is composed of ten married women who average 45 years of age and two children living in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of winter.  The crops include peanuts, pearl millet, and corn.   The group members are on their fifth farm loan, and all the previous loans have been repaid.  With this new loan, Ms. Djenebou C. intends to buy supplies (ahead of price increases) and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of labor for maintaining about 1.3 hectares of peanuts.  After harvesting, the produce is sold in Dioïla City to a customer base composed of women and men. Djenebou plans on making a profit of about 52,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicide, weeding, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Bendiya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bendiya 3 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 44  ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide,   le petit mil, le haricot et le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, RAMATOU D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,4 hectare d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne..
texts.en:
The Bendiya group is composed of 10 married women who, on average, are 44 years old and have 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kegne, one of the villages of the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their activities for the beginning of the rainy season. Crops cultivated are peanuts, pearl millet, beans and corn. This is their fifth planting loan and all previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, RAMATOU D. intends to pay for small tools and planting supplies before the price increases and for ploughing to maintain approximately 1.4 hectare of peanuts and beans. The crops are sold in the towns of Dioïla and Fana after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA at the end of the crop year.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ploughing, seeds, manure, herbicide, hoeing and small tools

loans.name: Agrifina

texts.en:
Agrifina T. is from the village of Dadda, Tuguegarao City. She is 51 years old. Agrifina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Agrifina raises crops, primarily planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables, for sale. Agrifina has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Agrifina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Agrifina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Agrifina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Bendiya  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Bendiya 4 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39  ans, 4 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le sésame et le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMINE S. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare  d’arachide et petit mil.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 35000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Bendiya 4" are married women averaging 39 years of age and four children.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of winter.  They are now on their fifth farm loan, and all the previous loans have been repaid.  The crops they grow include peanuts, pearl millet, sesame, and corn. With this new loan, Ms. Mamine S. intends to buy supplies (ahead of price increases) and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of labor for maintaining about a hectare of peanuts and pearl millet.  After harvesting, the produce is sold in Dioïla City and Fana City to a customer base composed of women and men.  Mamine plans on making a profit of about 35,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, manure, herbicide, weeding, equipment

loans.name: Bazargul's Group

texts.en:
Bazargul K. is the leader of the group. She is 33 and divorced. She has a daughter and a son. The son is a student and the daughter is still too young for school. Six years ago, with the initial investment of 11000 soms, Bazargul opened a cafeteria, where she sells various kinds of national foods. In this way she makes 20800 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Bazargul wants to purchase food for preparing these national dishes. In the future she plans to expand her business and to purchase a flat in Bishkek.

Sagynbek I., 37, is married. He has a son who is eight years old. Ten years ago, Sagynbek and his wife, with the initial investment of 8000 soms, opened a bakery.  Selling the bread, they make 11000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Sagynbek wants to purchase eight bags of flour.

Burulkan R. is the treasurer of the group, she is 26. Two years ago, with the initial investment of 15000 soms, Burulkan opened a store where she sells convenience goods and toiletries. In this way she makes 20000 soms per month. With money received from the loans, she wants to purchase various goods to increase the turnover in her shop. In the future she plans to purchase a flat.

Bargigul H., 29, is married. She has two sons and a daughter. Twelve years ago, with the initial investment of 40000 soms, Bargigul and her husband opened a sewing workshop. They make 25000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Bargigul wants to purchase a sewing machine to expand her business. In the future, she wants to build a big house with a swimming pool.

Begmamat I., 46, is married. She has three sons and two daughters. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 6000 soms, Begmamat rented a store where he sells convenience goods. In this way, he makes 11700 soms per month. With money received from the loan, he wants to purchase various fruits and vegetables in order to sell them in that store. In the future, Begmamat wants to save some money and to contribute to his son’s wedding. 

100 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS) = 2.13 USD

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Abégnonhou Cathérine

texts.fr: H. Abégnonhou Cathérine est née le 18 Mai 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cathérine est mariée à YETONDJI Maxime, un professeur. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre représentent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Cathérine vit depuis quatorze ans environs au quartier Davatin à Cotonou, avec sa famille. Cathérine aide son mari à assurer les différentes charges familiales, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Cathérine n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Cathérine exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a son atelier situé à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Cathérine s'approvisionne en fournitures de couture à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Cathérine sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. H. Abégnonhou Cathérine was born on May 18, 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to Mr. YETONDJI Maxime, a teacher.  The couple have five children to support.  All of the children are in school.  Cathérine has been living with her family for about fourteen years in the Davatin district in Cotonou.  She helps out her husband to ensure that the different family expenses are covered.  Cathérine did not attend school, but she learned how to sew.  She has been doing this work for five years and has a shop located in Lokokoukoumè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. She gets her sewing supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  This is the first time Cathérine has requesting financial support from ALIDé, so as to bolster her business and to respond better to the requirements of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for sewing

loans.name: Bendiya 5 Group

texts.fr:

With this new loan, Ms. Fatoumata S. intends to buy supplies (ahead of price increases) and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of labor for maintaining about a hectare of peanuts.  After harvesting, the produce is sold in Dioïla City and Fana City to a customer base composed of women and men.  The group members plan on making an average profit of about 32,500 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: Labor, seeds, manure, herbicide, weeding, and equipment

loans.name: Bendiya  6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bendiya 6 est constitué de six femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et qui  vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, le gombo, le dah,  le petit mil et le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, FATOUMA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide et de dah.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 32500FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The Bendiya 6 group is made up of six married women with an average age of 40 years and an average of three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region, which is the second adminstrative region of Mali. They are participating with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their business activities for the beginning of the rainy season. Their crops include peanuts, okra, hibiscus, millet, and corn. They are on their fifth farming loan, and all previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Fatouma D. plans to buy fertilizer before prices go up, small equipment, and to pay the plowing costs for maintaining about 1 hectare of peanuts and hibiscus. The crops are sold in the city of Dioïla and in Fana after harvest, to a customer base of both men and women. The group expects to make an average profit of 32500FCFA per planting season.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing, sowing, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small tools and equipment

loans.name: Umut

texts.en:
Umut K. was born in Petropavlovka village. She has been widowed since 1993 and has 3 children: two daughters and one son. Her son is married and lives not far from his mother’s house. Her elder daughter lives and works in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. The youngest daughter, Aidai, lives with her mother and helps in farming. Also, she works as a hairdresser in the small town of Kara-Balta.

Umut was born into a large, low-income family. She spent most of her time helping her mother in the household, watching after the babies and farming. Umut got married early and kept on living in her parents' house. And, yet, she was still obliged to do a lot of housework and help her mother to look after the juniors. After giving birth to her own son, Umut and her husband moved out. Her parents helped by providing them with sheep, and then Umut‘s family began to cultivate clover and barley on the plot of land which was granted by the state. As time passed by, the Kochokovas developed their farm with the revenues from selling their products at the local markets. At the beginning of 1990's, they had already 20 sheep and 3 milking cows.

In 1993, however, a tragedy broke all the plans and dreams of the K.'s family; Umut’s husband died suddenly and she had to sell most of the cattle to cover funeral expenses. But, Umut, being a courageous woman concerned for her children’s future, didn’t give in. She continued to work hard. When her son got married, Umut had to sell more cattle to buy a small house for his family.

Today, Umut has only 2 milk cows and 10 sheep left at her farm. She plans to use the loan to broaden her business by purchasing more cattle. With the revenues from this investment, Umut plans to provide good dowries for her daughters when they marry.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et 3 enfants qui  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à N’djinina, un des villages de la sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, le pois de terre,   le petit mil, le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MINATA M. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,3 hectare d’arachide et de pois de terre.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs. 
Elle comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 42500FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 4 group are ten married women with an average age of 48 and an average of three children. They mostly live in polygamous families in N'djinina, a village in the subprefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, earth pease, millet and corn. This will be their fifth seasonal loan. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Minata M. will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to work about 1.3 hectares of peanuts and earth peas. The harvest will be sold in Fana to customers who will mostly resell it. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 42,500 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and pay hired help

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAH F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,2 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 1 se disent satisfaites de la collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour le bon déroulement de la campagne hivernale avec l’aide de Soro.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 42 and an average of two children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Zambougou, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet, corn and beans. This will be their first seasonal loan. With this loan Mah Fofanah will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to work about 1.2 hectares of peanuts. The harvest will be sold in Fana, basically to people who will resell it in large towns. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 25,000 at the end of the season. The women of the Benkadi 1 group say they are happy to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are very confident of having a good rainy season with Soro's help.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and pay hired help

Their crops include peanuts, Bambara peas, millet, and corn. They are on their fifth farming loan, and all previous loans have been repaid in full. loans.use: Plowing, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small tools and equipment

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a divorced woman with three children: two adults and one still attending school. She has been selling onions, for the last five years, at the market to retail shops and also to wholesale shops. With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase ten bags of onions. She faces the major challenge of transportation and seasonality. Christine aims to buy twenty bags of onions in future to generate more profit. She decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans and expand her business. She lives at a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To purchase ten bags of onions.

loans.name: Noëlie

texts.fr: Née le 22 Décembre 1966 à Cotonou, H. Noëlie est mariée à MITO Basile et est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. La famille réside depuis cinq ans, au quartier Agbalilamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Noëlie vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Noëlie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Depuis sept ans, Noëlie mène cette activité. De façon secondaire, Noëlie vend des mèches, des produits de coiffure et aussi des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son salon de coiffure. Noëlie  achète ses produits à Cotonou. C'est la première fois que Noëlie sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on December 22, 1966 in Cotonou, Noëlie H. is married to Basile Mito and has four children, some of whom are in school. The couple has one other child in their care. For the last five years the family has lived in the Agbalilamè neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Noëlie helps her husband to pay the family expenses, thanks to income from her business. She left secondary school and learned hairdressing, and she has now been in the business for seven years. In addition, she sells hair extensions, hairstyling products, and telephone cards in her beauty salon. Noëlie buys her products in Cotonou. This is the first time that she is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to increase her stock of products and better satisfy her clients.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and hairstyling products.

Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage.

The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women with an average age of 42 and an average of two children.. They work with Soro Yiriwaso so as to get their farming activity on a sounder footing before the rainy season begins.. This will be their first seasonal loan.They grow peanuts, millet, corn, beans and other crops. Fatoumata B. S. plans to use her loan to buy fertilizer before its price goes up, and also to buy small tools and pay hired help to work on about one hectare of peanuts and beans. The harvested crops will be sold in Fana and Dioila, to both men and women. Each member of the group is counting on making a profit of about CFA 45,000 at the end of the season

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and pay hired help

loans.name: F. O. Blanche

texts.fr: H. F. O. Blanche est née le 06 Février  1960 et est mariée à MOKOMBIO Simplice, un comptable.  Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Il y a trois ans que Blanche s’est installée avec son mari et son enfant à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Blanche assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Ayant arrêté très tôt l’école, Blanche a appris la coiffure. Blanche exerce cette activité depuis trois ans à Agbalilamè. Parallèlement, Blanche vend des mèches et des produits de coiffure ; de façon secondaire, Blanche vend également des boissons en canettes. Blanche s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin.  La clientèle de Blanche s’accroît de plus en plus, et Blanche n’arrive plus à tous les satisfaire. C’est donc pour renforcer son activité et mieux répondre aux exigences des clients que Blanche sollicite un premier prêt.
texts.en:
F.O. Blanche H. was born February 6, 1960, She is married to Simplice Mokombio, an accountant. They have one child, who has been to school. Three years ago Blanche and her husband and child moved to Djeffa in the commune of Sèmè-Podji. Blanche and her husband pay for the family's expenses. She dropped out of school and learned hairdressing. For three years, she has been in this business at Agbalilamè. She also sells hair extensions and hair products; on the side she sells canned drinks. She buys her products in Nigeria, Benin's neighbor. With more and more customers, Blanche has not been able to meet all of their needs, and so to build her business and better respond to customer demand she is asking for her first loan.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair extensions and other hair products

loans.name: Rokia's Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 3 est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement  dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ROKIA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide et de maïs.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35000FCFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Benkadi 3 is a group of 10 married women with an average age of 45 years and three children, who mostly live in polygamous families in Kegne, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better organize their activities in early winter. Among other products, they cultivate peanuts, millet, maize. They are requesting their fifth loan and all previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Rokia D. intends to buy seeds and other planting material before the prices increase, as well as some small equipment and pay the cost of labor to maintain about one hectare of peanuts and maize. After the harvest, they sell their products in the town of Fana and Dioïla, to men and women. They hope to make an average profit of 35000FCFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, small equipment and labor costs.

loans.name: Bibihurayra

texts.ru: Аралова Бибихурайра проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 58 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и бобовые культуры. В этом ей помогает муж. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеет повторный урожай.
texts.en:
Bibihurayra A. lives in Yavan. She is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She has a high school education. She has been farming for more than five years. The plot of land where she grows vegetables and legumes is at her home. Her husband helps her. She is taking out a loan to buy seed and mineral fertilizer in order to sow a second crop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Benkadi  4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 4 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ROKIA OUMAR D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,3 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25000FCFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi 4 are 10 married women who have an average age of 44 years and have two children on average. They mostly live in polygamous families in Kegne, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro, Mali's second administrative region. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities in early winter. Among other products, they grow peanuts, millet, and maize. They are requesting their fifth loan and all previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Oumar D. ROKI plans to buy planting material before the prices increase, as well as some small equipment and pay the cost of labor to maintain around 1.3 hectars of peanuts. After harvest, they sell their products in the the town of Fana and Dioïla, to men and women. They plan to make an average profit of 25000FCFA by the end of the season.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase planting material, small equipment and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a married woman with a boy (four and a half years old) who attends school. Her husband works as an Assurance coordinator and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She has been selling tea leaves from home for the past three years to her neighbors. She also supplies to small scale entrepreneurs.With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase twenty packets of tea leaves. Hilda faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy days, in the months of June and July. She hopes to open another branch in future and to expand her business further. Hilda decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan and expand her business. She lives at a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase twenty packets of tea leaves.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, le pois de terre,  le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, TATA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide et haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000F CFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women with an average age of 42 and an average of two children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Zambougou, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, field peas, corn and beans. This will be their first seasonal loan. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Tata D. will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to work about one hectare of peanuts and beans. The harvest will be sold in Fana and Dioila to both men and women. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 2o,000 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small tools

loans.name: Benkadi  5 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 5 est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et  qui vivent dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la sous- préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, HAÏRRA T., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,9hectare d’arachide et de maïs.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35000FCFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
"Bendiya 5" is a group of ten married women averaging 40 years of age and three children each.  They live in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region, (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of winter.  They are now on their fifth farm loan, and all the previous loans have been repaid.  The crops they grow include peanuts, pearl millet, and corn. With this new loan, Ms. Haïrra T., the president of the group, intends to buy supplies (ahead of price increases) and sundry equipment and also to cover the cost of labor for maintaining about 1.9 hectare of peanuts and corn.  After the harvests, the produce is sold in Dioïla City and Fana City to a customer base composed of women and men.  The group members plan on making an average profit of about 35,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for supplies, farm equipment, and manual labor

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 5 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOUMATA C. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 22500FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 5 group are married women with an average age of 42 and an average of two children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Zambougou, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet, corn and beans. This will be their first seasonal loan. With this new loan, Fatoumata C. will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to plow about one hectare of peanuts and beans. The harvest will be sold in Fana and Dioila to both men and women. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 25,000 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and hire help

loans.name: Benkadi  6 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 6 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans et  en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, FATOUMATA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice de 30500FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women with an average age of 42 and an average of four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in the subprefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet and corn. This will be their fifth seasonal loan. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Fatoumata D. will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to plow about one hectare of peanuts. The harvest will be sold in Fana to resellers. She hopes to make a profit of about CFA 35,000 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing help, seed, fertilizer, weeding help, small tools

loans.name: Nesipkul

texts.en:
Nesipkul D. is 52 years old and was born in the village of Stepnoe, where she still lives today. She was born in a low-income family with many children. She graduated from secondary school, but could not continue her studies because she had to help in the house: she pastured the cattle and milked cows. When she was 19, she was given into marriage and moved to her husband’s home, where she still lives with the husband and his elderly parents. At the husband’s place, she continued to work around the house. At that time, the family had one milk cow and a plot of land where they cultivated clover and barley. Later, their livestock grew and they got sheep and a horse.

In 1980, Nesipkul gave birth to their only son. During all these years, their efforts were aimed on supporting and expanding their household and Nesipkul never dealt with any other business. Five years ago, the D.’s son married and moved out. In 2009, Nesipkul got a loan from another bank to buy a car. The loan was used as intended and was repaid without any delays.

Now Nesipkul requests a loan to buy five calves and to harvest clover and barley. It will allow her to further develop the business. In the future, Nesipkul plans to help her son to buy a home in the Stepnoe village so that he lives closer to them.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 6 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans, 2 enfants et  vivant majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, CHATA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 Ha d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 17000FCFA environs  en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women, who are on the average 42 years old, have two children, and live mainly in polygamous families in Zambougou, a village in the Diola Prefecture, Kolikoro Region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their activities at the beginning of the winter season. They cultivate peanuts, millet, corn and beans, among others. They are now on their first agricultural loan. With this loan, Chata D. plans to purchase agricultural inputs before the prices go up as well as buy small tools and pay for the labor to work a peanut field approximately 1 hectare (about 2.5 acres) in size. The produce is sold in the town of Fana and elsewhere in Diola after the harvest, to a customer base composed of both men and women. At the end of the harvesting, they plan to earn an average income of 17,000 West African Francs each.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding and small tools

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkadi 7 sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, BALAFO S. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women who, on average, are 42 years old with 6 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Zambougou, one of the villages of the prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. Among others, the crops cultivated are peanuts, pearl millet, corn and beans. This is their first planting loan with the institution. With this loan, BALAFO S. plans to pay for planting supplies before the price increases, small tools and ploughing to maintain approximately 1 hectare of peanuts. The crops are sold in the towns of Dioïla and Fana after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of 30,000 CFA at the end of the crop year.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ploughing, seeds, manure, herbicide, hoeing and small tools

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with a son and a daughter, both attending school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family’s needs. Alice owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Alice has been operating her poultry business for the last ten years as retail and from home. She sells to the neighboring community and also to retailers and hotel (restaurant) operators. She has no other source of income. The major challenge in the business is seasonality which causes fluctuation of prices in the market.

Alice decided to work with Yehu so as to obtain a loan to expand her business. With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to buy chicks and chicken feed. She hopes to buy a plot and add more chicks in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Homidjon

texts.ru: Рахмонов Хомидчон проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хомидчон имеет средне - специальное образование, бухгалтер. Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается растениеводством. Ему приходится много работать, чтобы прокормить свою семью. В основном он арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Homidjon R. lives in Shahrituz. He is 41 years old, married, and has seven children. His wife is a housewife. Homidjon has a vocational degree in bookkeeping. He works in his profession. Additionally, he farms. He has to work very hard to support his family. He rents the plot where he grows vegetables to sell. He has been doing this for fifteen years. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Koguilan 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Koguilan 1 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AWA T. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,2 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Koguilan 1 are married women having an average age of 49, with 4 children and the majority living in polygamous families in Kegne, one of the villages of the prefecture of Dioïla, area of Koulikoro, 2nd administrative area of Mali. They collaborate with the institution of microfinance Soro Yiriwaso with an aim of better being able to organize their activities at the beginning of wintering. The speculations cultivated are among others, groundnut, small millet, corn and beans. They are on their fifth countryside loan and all the previous were well repaid. This new loan, AWA T. takes into account buying the inputs before the prices increase, buying small equipment and to pay the expenses of ploughing to maintain 1,2 hectares of groundnut. The products are sold with at the city of Faded and Dioïla after harvest, to customers made up of men and women. They count on an average benefit of 45000FCFA approximately by the end of the campaign.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of crop inputs, small agricultural equipment, and labor

loans.name: Koguilan 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Koguilan 2 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et ont en moyenne   3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, CHITAN ABOU D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Koguilan 2 are married women with an average age of 46 years and have on average 3 children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Kegne, one of the villages of the prefecture of Dioïla, area of Koulikoro, 2nd administrative area of Mali. They collaborate with the institution of microfinance Soro Yiriwaso with an aim of better being able to organize their activities at the beginning of wintering. The speculations cultivated are among others, groundnut, small millet, corn and beans. They are on their fifth countryside loan and all the previous were well repaid. This new loan, CHITAN ABOU D. takes into account to buy the crop inputs before prices rise, small equipment and to pay the expenses of ploughing to maintain about 1 hectare of groundnut. The produce is sold in the cities of Faded and Dioïla after harvests, to customers made up of men and women. They hope to realize an average benefit of 25000FCFA approximately by the end of the campaign.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane U., 37, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns well so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own ready-to-wear clothing store for the past few years.

Mary Jane has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her clothing business.

To ensure the success of her business, Mary Jane would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying new designs of products to be incorporated into her current inventory.

Mary Jane dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy new designs of products to be incorporated into her current inventory

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Давронов Зариф проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование средне - специальное, бухгалтер. Проработал 10 лет по профессии. Сейчас он занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Имеет богатый опыт в этой области.  Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Zarif D. lives in Shahrituz. He is 38 years old, married, and has five children. He has a vocational degree in bookkeeping. He worked in his profession for ten years. Now, he farms. He rents the plot where he grows vegetables. He has vast experience in this. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers in order to get a good harvest to sell.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ozodjon

texts.en:
A. Ozodjon is 19 years old and is a young and very energetic guy. For more than three years, together with the help of his family, he has been running a small business selling different kinds of detergents like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream, washing powder and many other items in his store. In the picture you can see Ozodjon (a guy standing the left) and his friend.  

Today, Ozodjon is requesting a loan of 10,000 Somoni to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

Ozodjon’s main goal is to build his own house and have a happy family. At IMON, we believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more detergents to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Koguilan  5 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Koguilan 5 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, RAMATA T. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1  hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 15 500FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group Koguilan 5 are married women with an average age of 43 years and have on average 3 children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Kegne, one of the villages of the prefecture of Dioïla, area of Koulikoro, 2nd administrative area of Mali. They collaborate with the institution of microfinance Soro Yiriwaso with an aim of better being able to organize their activities at the beginning of wintering. The speculations cultivated are among others, groundnut, small millet, corn and beans. They are on their fifth countryside loan and all the previous loans were properly repaid. This new loan, RAMATA T. is to buy crop inputs before the prices rise, buy small equipment and to pay the expenses of ploughing to maintain about 1 hectare of groundnut. The produce is sold in the cities of Faded and Dioïla after harvest to customers made up of men and women. They hope for an average benefit of 15.500FCFA approximately at the end of the campaign.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en: A. Jamshed is 20 years old and is not married. Due to his family’s financial situation, he did not have many opportunities to study at the university. That’s why, after finishing school, he tried to become independent and to find a way of earning in order to help his parents with the family’s expenses. Since 2006, Jamshed has supported his family through his efforts. Through the years, he tried various types of activities and finally, four years ago, he started his business selling cellphones. He believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. Currently, his business is doing well, but Jamshed needs to increase his stock of goods in order to serve the demands of his clientele. With this purpose in mind, Jamshed requests 10,000 Somoni. He is grateful to all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more cellphones to sell

loans.name: Perpetuo

texts.en:
This is Perpetuo D. M., who is single and a college undergraduate. He is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines.

Perpetuo operates a bakery which is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine, and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan D. Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. It is also packed hot into a Styrofoam box and sold in the streets, mostly recognized by the honking of the bicycle boy who carries and sells it.

To help Perpetuo continue operation of his business, he is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar and butter that are needed to continue production of his breads to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 
 
Perpetuo dreams of having his own house and lot someday.

loans.use: To buy raw supplies needed to continue production of his breads

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
Sanobar R., a 33-year-old married mother of two children, has been selling oriental-style plates and dishes for 15 years. In high demand, this kind of china is widely used for girls' dowries and for family celebrations. Now Sanobar is planning to enlarge her range of goods and purchase china in the neighboring countries of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan and is therefore requesting a loan of 7000 Somoni. An active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2006, her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans. The well-being of Sanobar’s family and her business are in your hands. She and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase oriental style plates and dishes to increase her range of goods for sale

loans.name: Koguilan 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Koguilan 6 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MATOU F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana et à Dioîla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 27500FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Koguilan 6 group are married women with an average age of 39 and an average of four children. They live, mostly in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet, corn and beans. This will be their fifth seasonal loan. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Matou F. will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to plow about one hectare of peanuts. The harvest will be sold in Fana and Dioila to both men and women. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 27,500 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and pay hired help

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Salomat T., who is married with three children, has been selling jewelry in the local market for the last 15 years. The national earrings, rings and bracelets are very beautiful and popular in Tajikistan, with most women in possession of at least one set of jewelry, usually inherited from their grandmothers.

With many clients, Salomat's business is rather successful, generating a stable income for the family. She is now requesting a loan of 9000 Somoni with which to purchase new items of jewelry to increase her range of goods for sale. As a client of IMON for four years already, Salomat has proven herself to be a reliable client. She thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new items of jewelry for sale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, a married woman with one girl and one boy, both attending school, lives in her own house that is serviced with electricity but no piped water. Her husband works as a clearing and forwarding agent, and he contributes to his family's needs.

Catherine has been operating her hairdressing salon in a shop located in her neighboring community. With the Kshs 40,000 she is requesting to borrow, she wants to renovate her hairdressing salon and purchase cosmetics. Having decided to work with Yehu in order to get access to loans to expand her business, Catherine hopes to open a hairdressing college in future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and renovate her hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
La solicitante es de la ciudad de Santani, es casada, tiene casa propia se dedica al alquiler de mesas y sillas para acontecimiento por toda la zona de Santani.
Según ella comenzó con 20 sillas y mesitas ahora ye cuenta con mas 60, cada unos gracias a la  buena administración de los ingresos que ella obtiene con los alquileres.
Pero desea crecer en el negocio y para ello quiere contar con mayor numero de silla y mesitas, y solicita el préstamo para concretar dicha compra.
Es una persona responsable, trabajadora posee buenas referencias comerciales  y personales, la señora empezó a trabajar  hace aproximadamente 4 años a este trabajo siempre se esmera por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Victorina is from the city of Santani. She is married and has her own house. She rents tables and chairs for events throughout the Santani area. According to Victorina, she started with 20 chairs and small tables and now she has more than 60, thanks to the good management of the income that she gets from her rentals. But she wants to grow her business, and to do that she needs to have a greater number of chairs and tables. She requests a loan in order to buy these additional chairs and tables. She is a hardworking, responsible person who has good business and personal references. She started to work about 4 years ago, and she always puts a lot of care into this work because she wants to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Tlayecac Group

texts.es:
ESTA UNIDAD DE DESARROLLO (UDE) SE LLAMA TLAYECAC, ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE TLAYECAC, ESTADO DE MORELOS, MEXICO EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 8 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN. ESTE ES SU PRESTAMO No. 11 CON FUNDACION REALIDAD.
LA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO LA SEÑORA ALICIA  V. C. TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 3er. AÑO DE SECUNDARIA TIENE SU CERTIFICADO DE SECUNDARIA, TIENE 2 HIJAS, VIRIDIANA DE 18 AÑOS DE EDAD ESTA ESTUDIANDO EL BACHILLERATO, CRISTINA DE 20 AÑOS DE EDAD ESTA ESTUDIANDO EL 2º. SEMESTRE DE INGENIERO EN INFORMATICA, LAS DOS VIVEN EN CASA DE SUS PADRES.
