LA SEÑORA ALICIA TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE COMIDA VENDE ANTOJITOS MEXICANOS SU LOCAL ESTA EN EL CENTRO DE TLAYECAC  A UN LADO DEL DEPOSITO DE AGUA,  SU CASA ESTA A TRES CUADRAS DEL LOCAL Y LLEGA CAMINANDO,  OFRECE A SUS CLIENTES SOPES, QUESADILLAS, TLACOYOS Y GORDITAS. VA A UTILIZAR SU CREDITO PARA COMPRAR UN COMAL NUEVO Y UNAS SILLAS PARA TENER UN NEGOCIO DE MAYOR CALIDAD Y MAS BONITO, INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 9 AÑOS SE LO HEREDO SU MAMA, ANTERIORMENTE VENDIA EN LA ESCUELA TACOS DE ARROZ, TORTAS, SOPES, QUESADILLAS. LA PARTE FAVORITA DE TRABAJAR EN SU NEGOCIO ES QUE PUEDE ATENDEN A SUS NIÑOS DEL KINDER LES LLEVA SUS PRODUCTOS A LA ESCUELA, LE GUSTAN MUCHO LOS NIÑOS, ATIENDE PERSONALMENTE DE 30 A 50 CLIENTES QUE LLEGAN A DISFRUTAR DE SU COMIDA, SU NEGOCIO ENFRENTA LA COMPETECIA DE UN LOCAL QUE OFRECE LOS MISMOS PRODUCTOS  ATRÁS DE SU ESTABLECIMIENTO, DE LAS GANANCIAS  A PODIDO AYUDAR A SUS HIJAS EN SUS ESTUDIOS  A SEGUIR INVIRTIENDO Y TAMBIEN A PODIDO PAGAR EL PRESTAMO. SUS SUEÑOS ES CONSTRUIR UNA CASA EN UN TERRENO QUE TIENE EN C. LOS POTREROS PARA CUANTO TENGA A SUS NIETOS TENGAN ESPACIO PARA JUGAR Y PUEDA DISFRUTAR DE SUS NIETOS.
EN EL PUEBLO DE TLAYECAC HAY UN CERRO QUE SE LLAMA CRUZ ES MUY BONITO ES ECOLOGICO Y SIEMPRE ESTA VERDE  HAY UNA CRUZ HASTA ARRIBA DEL CERRO Y EL DIA DE LA CRUZ EL 3 DE MAYO SUBEN LAS PERSONAS DEL PUEBLO POR LA CRUZ PARA LLEVARLA A LA IGLECIA, LA SEÑORA ALICIA DA A LAS PERSONAS TAMALES Y OTRA SEÑORA DA ATOLE. LA CRUZ PEMANECE EN LA IGLECIA DURANTE 1 MES Y EL 1er. DOMINGO DE JUNIO SUBEN LAS PERSONA  AL CERRO PARA PONER LA CRUZ EN SU LUGAR.  
LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON MARCELA C. V. Y VA A COMPRAR CON SU PRESTAMO SERVILLETAS, ESTAMBRE PARA TEJERLAS Y VENDERLAS. BEDA V. C. VA A COMPRAR ALIMENTO PARA SUS ANIMALES. AMBROSIA M. Z. VA A COMPRAR JABON, HUEVO, LECHE, AZUCAR PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES, YOLANDA M. R. VA A COMPRA TODO TIPO DE DULCES PARA VENDER. ALICIA V. C. VA A COMPRAR UN COMAL NUEVO Y UNAS SILLAS PARA MEJORAR SU NEGOCIO. YADIRA C. M. VA A COMPRAR TINTES ETC. PARA UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES. MARIA LUISA C. R. VA A COMPRAR ARROZ, LECHE, VERDURA, TORTILLAS ETC. PARA PREPARAR LA COMIDA EN SE COCINA ECONOMICA. MALENY S. G. VA A COMPRAR MASA, TORTILLAS, POLLO, CARNE, ETC. PARA PREPARAR LA COMIDA QUE VENDE.
LA SEÑORA ALICIA QUIERE DECIR A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD:”LE DAMOS LAS GRACIAS POR QUE CON ESTE APOYO HEMOS SALIDO ADELANTE MIS COMPAÑERAS Y YO”
texts.en:
This development unit is called Tlayecac, It is located in the community of Tlayecac, state of Morelos, Mexico. The group is made up of 8 members who know each other. This is its 11th loan with the Realidad foundation. The member of the group named Alicia V. C. is 40 years old and completed her third year of secondary education and has her secondary school certificate. She has 2 daughters, Viridiana, who is 18 years old and in high school, and Cristina, who is 20 years old and in her second semester of computer programming. Both of them live in their parents' house. Alicia has a business selling Mexican snacks at her locale in downtown Tlayecac next to the water reservoir. Her house is three blocks from the locale and she walks there. She offers her customers sopes, quesadillas, tlacoyos and gorditas. She is going to use the loan to buy a new dining table and some chairs to have a better quality and more attractive business. She started her business 9 years ago when she inherited it from her mother. Previously she sold rice tacos, sandwiches, sopes and quesadillas in the school. Her favorite part about working in her business is that she can attend to the children at the school. She takes the products to the school and the children really like them. She personally sells to 30 to 50 customers who arrive to enjoy her food. Her business faces the competition from a locale that offers the same products behind her establishment. With her income she has been able to help her daughters in their studies and continue investing, and also to pay for the loan. Her dream is to build a house on a plot of land that she has in Los Potreros so that when she has grandchildren they will have space to play and she will be able to enjoy them. In the town of Tlayecac there is a mountain called Cruz. It is very beautiful and ecological and always green. There is a cross high up on the mountain and the Day of the Cross is May 3rd. People from the town carry the cross to the church. Alicia gives the people tamales and another woman gives them atole. The cross stays at the church for a month and on the first Sunday of June the people go up the mountain to put the cross back in its place. The members of the group are: Marcela Cataneda V. and with her loan she will buy worsted yarn to knit and sell napkins. Beda V. C. is going to buy feed for her animals. Ambrosia M. Z. is going to buy soap, eggs, milk and sugar to diversify her grocery store. Yolanda M. R. buys all kinds of candies to sell. Alicia V. C. is going to buy a new table and chairs to improve her business. Yadira C. M. is going to buy coloring, etc., for a better service for her clients. Maria Luisa C. R. is going to buy rice, milk, vegetables, tortillas, etc., to prepare food in her economic kitchen. Maleny S. G. is going to buy cornmeal, tortillas, chicken, beef., etc to make the food she sells. Alicia wants to tell Kiva and the Realidad foundation that "we thank you, because with this this support the other members and I have gotten ahead."

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new table and chairs

loans.name: 2000 Poty Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina 2 000 Poty, están en el Primer Ciclo con 10  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable.
Tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, y lo demuestran realizando actividades para recaudar fondos y asi estar al día con las cuotas. 
Son muy activas y trabajadoras, y solicitan el crédito cada una para destinarlos a sus actividades y para otros gastos de la familia.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Hilda quien se dedica al negocio de compra de varios productos de uso de hogar.
Ella compra la producción de sus compañeras y los ofrece en su negocio de esta manera ayuda también a las demás integrantes para que puedan contar con un ingreso para sus familias.
Ella solicito el préstamo para la compra de leche, huevos, quesos, frutas y verduras, carne.
texts.en:
This group is called "2000 Poty." They are in their first loan cycle, and the group has 10 members. As a group in their neighborhood, they stand out as being very united, cooperative and responsible. They have a great entrepreneurial spirit, and they demonstrate it carrying out activities to make money so as to keep up with their payments. They are very active and hardworking, and they are each requesting a loan to use in their business activities, and in some cases to cover family expenses. One of the members is Hilda, who has a business selling a variety of household products. She buys products made by her fellow group members and offers them for sale in her store. In this way she also helps the other members so that they can count on an income for their families. She requests a loan to buy milk, eggs, cheese, fruit, vegetables and meat.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy eggs, milk, meat and other products

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to be cooked and sold in the restaurant.

Lucia is 28 years old and is married to an electrician. She has two children and her children do not go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Lucia hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to be cooked and sold in her restaurant

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en:
Suzy A. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and beans to sell.

Suzy is 47 years old and is married to a teacher. She has three children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Suzy hopes to be able to open a shop.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
La señora María del Refugio R. Márquez tiene 39 años, es madre soltera con dos hijos: Palmira Anahí de trece años y el más pequeño Roberto de cinco años. Vive en la Ribera Emiliano zapata municipio de Tecpatan, Chiapas México. 

  Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas desde hace diez años, comenzó en una casita,  ahora con sus a horros y la ayuda de su papá ha logrado construir una palapa pequeña donde atiende a sus clientes, comenta que la va muy bien a un así hay días que no se vende mucho pero cuando menos hay para comer y comprar más mercancía.

  El motivo de su solicitud del préstamo es para agrandar mas su negocio  tener unos ahorros para que sus hijos sigan adelante y puedan ser alguien en la vida teniendo una buena educación y un mejor futuro, así como también apoyar a su papá en algunos gastos.

  Doña Refugio es integrante del grupo buena vista la razón del nombre es porque su palapa está en una vista bonita a orilla de carretera, paso a formar parte de dicho grupo por una de sus compañeras la cual es representante.
  Las personas que integran este grupo llamado buena vista son las siguientes:

Marlevert  Hernández  Juárez: se dedica a la venta de ropas  en las  comunidades cercanas.
Sofía García Gutiérrez: compra y vende trates de peltre.
María del refugio R. Márquez: ella es la que se le tomo la entrevista y esta de cabello corto con un niño. Vende comidas.
Sergio Domínguez García: solicito el préstamo para comprar y vender verduras  de la temporada.
Marbet Domínguez S.: representante del grupo,  compra y vende ropas para salir a vender en las comunidades
texts.en:
Ms. María del Refugio R. Márquez, 39, is a single mother with two children: Palmira Anahí (13 years old) and Roberto (5 years old). She lives in the riverside community of Emiliano Zapata, in the municipality of Tecpatan, Chiapas, México. She has sold food for the last ten years. She started her business in a small house. With her savings and the help of her father, she was able to construct a small palapa hut where she now tends to her clients. She comments that it's going very well. Although there are some days when she does not sell much, it's enough to eat and to buy more merchandise. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business, so she can save money and help her children to get ahead. She wants her children to be able to be somebody in life, to have a good education and a better future. She also wants to help her father with some expenses. Ms. Refugio is a member of the "Buena Vista" ("Good View") Group. The reason for their name is because their palapa hut has a good view along the edge of the highway. She became a member of this group through one of her friends, who is a representative of the group. The members of the Buena Vista Group are as follows: • Marlevert Hernández Juárez: sells clothing in nearby communities. • Sofía García Gutiérrez: buys and sells pewter cooking utensils. • María del Refugio R. Márquez: she is the member who was interviewed and she is pictured with short hair and her son. She sells food. • Sergio Domínguez García: he is requesting this loan to buy and sell seasonal vegetables. • Marbet Domínguez Aaraos: she is the group representative. She buys and sells clothes in local communities.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food, such as meat, vegetables and shellfish

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce J. is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and cooking oil at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell.

Joyce is 30 years old and is married to a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Joyce hopes to be able to open a shop.

loans.use: To stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

Mary is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida K. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children who are attending school. She does not take care of any additional family members. She lives in a home that she owns which has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees. Aida has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years. She works seven days out of every week. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. The main business challenges for Aida include transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to earn a profit to help her family. About MCDT SACCO: This loan is administered by MCDT SACCO, a savings and credit institution that uses the Grameen Bank model of solidarity lending. MCDT's cooperative structure also affords clients the opportunity to own shares of the organization and benefit from its financial performance. The mission of MCDT SACCO is to provide sustainable financial services to the lower strata of Uganda's poor, especially women, for their economic and social development. For more on MCDT SACCO, please see our partner page, and join our lending team, Friends of MCDT SACCO.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Siama

texts.en: Siama M. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, who are in school. She does not take care of additional family members. Siama lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees. Siama has a business selling charcoal and local clothes (kitenge). She has been in this business for five years. She works six days out of every week. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more stock of kitenge to sell. Siama also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Siama include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business and support her children. About MCDT SACCO: This loan is administered by MCDT SACCO, a savings and credit institution that uses the Grameen Bank model of solidarity lending. MCDT's cooperative structure also affords clients the opportunity to own shares of the organization and benefit from its financial performance. The mission of MCDT SACCO is to provide sustainable financial services to the lower strata of Uganda's poor, especially women, for their economic and social development. For more on MCDT SACCO, please see our partner page at http://www.kiva.org/partners/112, and join our lending team, Friends of MCDT SACCO, at http://www.kiva.org/team/friends_of_mcdt_sacco.

loans.use: To buy more stock of "kitenge" to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single woman with one child who attends school. She has been operating as a food vendor, selling dry fish from home and door-to-door for the last twelve years. Her main customers are her neighbors and passersby. She has no other source of income. She owns a house with no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to start a motorcycle business and purchase a motorcycle. Mariam hopes to own a van in the future. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Apayi

texts.en:
Apayi R. is currently in the business of selling dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish and tomatoes to sell.

Apayi is 35 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Apayi hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To stock more dried fish and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet  lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children who are in school. She does not take care of any additional family members. She lives in a home that she rents which does not have access to electricity nor piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

Juliet has a business selling retail goods at the market, she sells good like sugar, match box,bars of soap and packets of salt and has been in this business for six years. She works five days out of every week. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to increase her  stock buy buying cartons of salt, boxes of soap and  big packets of match box. 

The main business challenges for Juliet include transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to invest more capital in her business and gain more profit for her family. 


About MCDT SACCO:
This loan is administered by MCDT SACCO, a savings and credit institution that uses the Grameen Bank model of solidarity lending. MCDT's cooperative structure also affords clients the opportunity to own shares of the organization and benefit from its financial performance.

The mission of MCDT SACCO is to provide sustainable financial services to the lower strata of Uganda's poor, especially women, for their economic and social development. For more on MCDT SACCO, please see our partner page, and join our lending team, Friends of MCDT SACCO.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of salt, boxes of soap,half abag of sugar and packets of match box

loans.name: Ninfa Aurora

texts.es:
Ninfa de 44 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda desde hace años atrás, vendiendo arroz, azúcar y legumbres a podido ayudar a sus padres económicamente. 

Por lo que nunca tuvo hijos ni esposo ella se dedica a la tienda, para comenzar con su tienda ella presto dinero poco a poco con las ganancias invirtió en mas productos, ahora ella tiene su tienda mas surtida, trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 22:00pm todos los dias. 

Para poder agrandar su tienda y surtirla mas quiere comprar con el préstamo atún, aceites y confites. En el futuro quiere incrementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Ninfa is 44 years old and lives in the Guasmo of Guayaquil ( a place inhabited by informal merchants.) She has a store from many years back. She sells rice, sugar, and vegetables. She has been able to help her parents financially.

Since she never married or had children she dedicates her time to working in the store. To start her business she would lend money and save the profits to buy more products. Now she has more selection to offer. She works from 9:00 am to 10:00 pm every day.

In order for her store to grow and offer more of a variety she plans to buy tuna, oils, and sweets with the loan. In the future she wishes to develop her store.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of tuna, oils, and sweets.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 28 years old and is married with two children: her first one is 5 years old and her last one is 2 years old. Allen’s husband does not have a job, so Allen has to work hard in order to help her family’s various situations in life.

Allen is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her general store business through purchasing more products. This will allow her to earn more profits. With the extra money, she will be able to save money for the future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine was born in 1979 and is married with three children: her first one is 12 years old, the next is 10 years old, and her last one is 7 years old; all of them are in school. Francine’s husband works as a driver and they both work hard so that they can afford all the basic needs of their family, mainly school fees.

Francine owns a small business selling various products such as cosmetics products, cooking oil, juice, and so on.

Francine is requesting a loan From Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more attractive products. This attraction will be a valuable thing for her because she will earn more profits.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Hilda Mabel Lopez

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 30 años, reside en el Municipio de San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, es acompaña y tiene dos hijos Kevin y Maribel de la edades de 5 y 1 año respectiva, ella vende tamales de maíz  y confección de ropa.
Ella aprendió hacer tamales gracias a la madre, y realizo estudios de corte y confección de ropa, actualmente  vende tamales de maíz una vez por semana, y el resto de la semana se dedica a confeccionar ropa. Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de tela de diferentes colores, hilo de seda, botones y otros artículos para fabricación de vestidos, manteles, pantalones para niños, con esta inversión planea luego vender la ropa, de esta forma dcontribuir a generar trabajo y recurso para solventar necesidades básicas de la familia.
Los sueños es sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos, mejor la casa donde viven que actualmente está hecha con lamina,con el trabajo y estos fondos se desea mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia.
texts.en:
Hilda is 30 years old and lives in the municipality of San Carlos in the Morazán department. She has a partner and 2 children: Kevin (5) and Maribel (1). She sells corn tamales and also makes clothing. She learned to make tamales thanks to her mother, and she also completed classes in dressmaking. Now she sells corn tamales once a week and the rest of the week she devotes to making clothes. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fabric of different colors, silk thread, buttons and other items for making dresses, tablecloths and pants for children. With this investment she plans to later sell the clothing and in this way generate resources that she can use to cover the basic household expenses. Hilda dreams of providing for her children and improving the house where they currently live, as it is made of laminated tin. With this work and these funds, she wants to improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric of different colors, silk thread, buttons and other items to make dresses and tablecloths

loans.name: Maria Basilia

texts.es:
María Basilia tiene 36 años, reside en el municipio de San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, es casada vive con sus hijos Geovany, Ángel, de 17 y 9 años y la pequeña Ibeth de 10 meses, ella elabora y vende tortillas de maíz.
Aprendió  el negocio gracias a la madre quien le enseño a elaborar tortillas, este negocio permite solventar las necesidades de la familia y actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para compra de materia prima Maíz, cal, leña. El crédito le ayudara el cliente a mejorar la situación económica ya que está generando empleo.
El sueño de la cliente es que lo hijos terminen los estudios de bachiller, ya que ella y el esposo no les dieron la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
María Basilia is 36 years old. She lives in the town of San Carlos, Morazán Department. She is married and lives with her children: Geovany and Ángel, ages 17 and 9, and little Ibeth, who is 10 months old. María Basilia prepares and sells corn tortillas. She learned the business thanks to her mother, who taught her to make tortillas. This business allows her to meet her family's needs, and she is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of the raw materials corn, lime and wood. The loan will help this customer to improve her economic situation since it is creating work. The customer's dream is for her children to finish their college studies, since she and her husband were not given the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, lime, wood

loans.name: Maria Narcisa

texts.es:
María de 36 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda pequeña que la ha podido surtir con la ayuda de su esposo. 

María comenzó vendiendo “chifles” (plátanos en rodajas fritas), poco a poco tuvo ingresos para comprar alimentos y venderlos en un puesto. Por esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene una tienda un poco surtida y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 222h00pm todos los días sus dos hijas le ayudan. 

Ella quiere que su tienda sea una de las mejores del sector por donde vive y para eso necesita comprar con el préstamo azúcar, café. En el futuro ella se proyecta con una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old, and lives in El Guasmo, Guayaquil (a place where the residents are informal merchants). She has a small store that she has been able to stock with help from her husband. María started out selling “chifles” (fried sliced bananas), and little by little earned enough income to purchase food items and sell them at a stand. Because of this good decision she now has a store with a small selection. She works every day from 7:00 AM until 10:00 PM with help from her two daughters. María wants her store to be one of the best stores in the area where she lives. That is why she needs this loan to purchase sugar and coffee. In the future she plans to have a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sugar and coffee for her store

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
Jean Pierre K. est un homme  de 35 ans, marié, née à Rubavu  un des districts de la province de l’Ouest du Rwanda, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il a trois enfants, le plus âgée a 7 ans et son cadet a 2.5 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école.
Il est entrepreneur, commençant des produits alimentaires qui sont haricots, mais, sorgho en détail et a un moulin de pour le sorgho et mais. Il a ouvert un compte dans Amasezerano Community Banking   depuis avril 2010, il contracte un prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de sorgho, 5 sacs de haricots et 10 sacs de maïs. Son ambition et son souhait et que dans l’avenir et d’avoir une maison à louer et qui sera l’héritage de son fils ainé. La maison va  verser pour l’épargne éducation des enfants. Il compte aussi augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre K. is a 35-year-old man who is married.  He was born in Rubavu, a district of West Province, Rwanda, and has a primary school education.  He has three children, of whom the eldest is 7 and the youngest is 2.5 years old.  Two of his children go to school.  Jean Pierre is an entrepreneur, a merchant of foodstuffs, which include beans, corn, and sorghum at the retail level.  He opened an account at Amasezerano Community Banking in April 2010, and has signed a loan for buying 5 sacks of sorghum, 5 sacks of beans, and 10 sacks of corn.  Jean Pierre's ambition and wish is to have a house to rent out that will be inherited by the oldest son.  The house will pay into his savings for educating the children.  He also plans to increase his sales and to become a wholesale merchant.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sorghum, beans, and corn

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings & Credit C Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Operating a retail shop that deals in general merchandise is a formidable business venture that has seen S. D., aged 32 years, manage his life to this day from Bugongi trading centre, Kihihi.

It is always difficult for many youth here in Uganda to settle and create their own earnings, rather than spending time drinking alcohol and gambling. D. is different in economic terms and in having his responsibilities cut out for him of catering for his two children and his family and this has made him settle for business.

D. obtained a little capital from his previous produce business to start up his general store business that now fetches him 350,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. He is seeking a loan to purchase enough stock since there is a ready market from customers and this will help him expand his business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: purchase of more stock into the business

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette was born in 1981. She is married with three children and one dependent who is not a relative. Odette’s husband does not have any occupation which can make money for their family. That's the reason why Odette has to work hard so that she meets all the needs of her family. Odette owns a business selling various styles of clothes.

Odette is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing her business by purchasing various styles of clothes to attract more customers. The increased business will help her to earn more profits which will allow her to buy a house.

loans.use: To expand a clothing business

loans.name: Basooka Kwavula Group

texts.en: N. Jesica is 45 years old, happily married and the mother of 10 children, 7 of whom attend school. For the last 10 years she and her family have subsisted on profits from her pharmacy in Wakitaila-Jinja. She took over the shop from her parents. Prior to that she was operating a retail enterprise. The reason behind her longevity, she says, boils down to her resilience and a focused line of thought. She makes a profit from her other business -- animal husbandry. In a week her profits add up to 200,000 shillings and with this loan, she wants to buy more consignments of drugs for her pharmacy and also use part of the proceeds to pay her workers.

loans.use: to purchase new consignments of drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: C2327 Abarikumwe Group

texts.en: Viollette is 48 years old and married with three children: the first one is 23, the next one is 19 and the last one is 16. Viollette’s husband does not have an occupation which can make money. For that reason, Viollette needs to work hard so that she meets all the needs of her family. Viollette owns a business selling various products. She is her group representative. Her group is called Abarikumwe in the local language. Viollette and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company so that they can increase their capital for more investments. This loan will be valuable for them because they will be able to purchase more products for their various businesses. With extra money, Viollette in particular expects to save money for the future.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Reimundo Antonio

texts.es: Reimundo tiene 37 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, todos menores de edad. Su esposa labora como comerciante ambulante de ropa y calzado, además de esto también vende cosméticos en su casa de habitación. El señor Reimundo se dedica a la comercialización de granos básicos, los cuales distribuyen en su casa de habitación. Reimundo ya tiene 5 años que dio inicio a este negocio ante la falta de trabajo que aqueja a nuestro país, además que él era trabajador del campo y los trabajos de ese rubro cada día se vuelven más escasos. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de granos básicos, ya que además de vender en su casa también quiere salir a vender a las zonas aledañas que visita su esposa vendiendo sus productos. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una pulpería grande en su casa de habitación, y algún día dejarle algo bueno a sus hijos con lo cual puedan mantenerse.
texts.en:
Reimundo is 37 years old, married, and has two underage children. His wife works as a street vendor selling clothes and footwear. Aside from this, she also sells cosmetics from home. Mr. Reimundo sells basic grains which he sells from home. Reimundo initiated his business 5 years ago after being unemployed; an ailment plaguing our country. He used to be a worker in the fields and those kind of jobs are becoming more uncommon everyday. He would like to invest his loan towards the purchase of grain since aside from selling out of his homefront, he also goes out to sell in the surrounding areas that his wife visits while selling her products. His dream has always been to operate a large grocery store out of his home and someday be able to leave behind something good for his kid's sustainability.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr: K. Judith est née le 02 Janvier 1971 à Savalou, dans le département des Collines au Bénin.  Judith est mariée à GANLODJO Mathieu, un commerçant. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont seulement un est leur propre enfant.  Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Judith vit à Djeffa dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille.  Judith n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Judith  mène cette activité depuis huit ans. De façon secondaire, Judith vend des mèches, des produits pour cheveux et également des tissus dans son atelier situé à son domicile. Judith achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. En vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de rehausser son activité, Judith sollicite pour une première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Judith K. was January 2, 1971, at Savalou, in the Collines department of Benin. She is married to Mathieu Ganlodjo, a businnessman. They care for four children only one of whom is their own. All the children are in school. For about ten years., Judith has lived at Dieffa in the commune of Sèmè-Podji with her husband and the children. Together the couple pays family expenses. Judith did not go to school, but learned to be a hairdresser. She has worked at this trade for eight years. Additionally, she sells hair extensions and other hair products, and also cloth, from her home studio. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, Benin's interrnational trade center. To build working capital and to grow her business, Judith is asking for her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair extensions and other hair products

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Hard working R. Jackson, aged 67, has managed to invest in the timber sector for close to 10 years, after exploring the potential of the trees he had planted himself. He went into this because of the high demand in Nyakabirizi, Bushenyi where he does his business. He has the support of his spouse, and their sale of milk, charcoal and firewood, earns them good profits in Ugandan shillings. With a lot of work requiring timber as raw material — furniture workshops, building and construction — Jackson hopes to expand his business with this loan and open stores in other locations. This will enable him to earn more revenue, maintain a self-sustaining life, and meet his long-time dream of educating his children.

loans.use: Business expansion of restocking more timber

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 45 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo y sus tres pequeños hijos, en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza desde hace 12 años, es la venta de vegetales, en uno de los mercados más populosos de su localidad. Este negocio es de gran ayuda para poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia, además con tres hijos pequeños requieren de mucho cuidado, por tal razón se muestra a gusto con su trabajo por que le permite cuidar de sus hijos. Desde entonces labora solamente por las mañanas, tiempo que tiene mucha demanda de estos productos. Gracias a su gran carisma, los clientes siempre prefieren comprar en su establecimiento, además ofrece frescos vegetales y de calidad. En un futuro,  quiere tener un gran puesto donde pueda ofrecer su mercadería y así llevar mejores ingresos a su hogar. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de vegetales para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Olga is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and three small children in her own home. She has been selling vegetables for 12 years in one of the most popular markets in her town. This business has been a big help in covering her family's basic necessities. In addition, her three small children need a lot of attention, so she is happy with her job because it allows her to care for them. She works only in the mornings, when there is a lot of demand for the products. Thanks to her great charisma, the customers always prefer to buy in her establishment. She also offers fresh, quality vegetables. In the future, she wants to have a big locale where she can offer her merchandise and thus have better income for her home. This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy a greater quantity of vegetables to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: K. Cécile est née le 19 Mai 1969 à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à DJOHOU Théophile,  Cécile est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge, en plus des quatre enfants. Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à Kraké, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Cécile habite ce quartier depuis cinq ans environs. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Cécile a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Cécile mène cette activité depuis hui ans dans son atelier à son domicile. Parallèlement, Cécile vend des mèches, des produits pour cheveux, et aussi des boissons de façon secondaire. Cécile s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Cécile sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un concours financier, en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Cécile K. was born on May 19, 1969, in Djeffa, in Sèmè-Podji. She's married to Théophile DJOHOU and the mother of four children, who all attend school. The couple has another child to support, in addition to their four children. Cécile, her husband and children live together in Kraké, in Sèmè-Podji. She's been living in this neighborhood for approximately five years. The couple provides for the family together. Cécile dropped out of middle school, and was then trained as a hairdresser. She's been running this business for eight years, in her workshop at her home. In parallel, she sells hair extensions, haircare products, and also beverages, as a secondary business. Cécile gets her supplies in Nigeria, a country that borders Benin. For the first time, Céline is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster her stock and better meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and haircare products

loans.name: Saha

texts.en: Saha is married to a truck driver. They have seven children — two completed tertiary level and five still go to school. Saha, who previously operated a restaurant, sells water from home to her neighbors and passersby. With the Kshs 70,000 she wants to purchase a 6000-litre water tank to supply fresh water to her neighbors and water vendors. Her other source of income is selling firewood and charcoal. Her major challenge is seasonal water rationing. She hopes to expand, and invest in, her business. Saha decided to work with Yehu because its policies and procedures are simple to follow. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her biggest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To purchase a 6000-litre water tank.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Progresista” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas que decidieron agruparse para trabajar dentro del proyecto Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Cada integrantes  se dedica a una actividad diferente,  entre ellas se encuentra la señora Nilda quien se dedica a la cría de animales.
Ella tiene la facilidad para la cría de animales menores como aves y cerdos, ya que cuenta con terreno y al mismo tiempo por el marido le ayuda para la alimentación con la producción de yuca y maíz que el cultiva.
Ella comenta que con la venta de los animales obtiene buena ganancia para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de balanceados que ayudaran  para un crecimiento más rápido de sus animales.
texts.en:
The committee "Mujeres Progresista" (Progressive Women), was formed by various neighbors who united and decided to work together for a project titled: Entrepreneurial Women's Comittee. Each member specializes in different professions and amongst them you will find Mrs. Nilda who raises animals. She can easily raise small animals such as birds and pigs since she has the land and a husband who helps her with feed from the cassava and corn he cultivates. She states that she has a good enough return from the sale of her animals to help her family. The loan she requests will be used towards the purchase of nutritionally balanced feed which help her animlas grow faster.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nutrionally balanced feed

loans.name: René

texts.fr: N. René est né le 10 Mars 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. René est marié à HOUNSINOU Clotilde, une coiffeuse. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  René s’est installé depuis huit ans evirons, au quartier Dandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il habite avec sa femme et ses enfants. René subvient principalement aux besoins de sa famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. René a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et appris ensuite la coiffure. René exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Dans le but d’équiper son salon de coiffure de matériels nécessaire au bon fonctionnement de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, René sollicite pour une première fois, de crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
René N. was born on March 10, 1980, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He's married to Clotilde HOUNSINOU, a hairdresser. The couple has two children, who both attend school. Approximately eight years ago, René moved in to the Dandji neighborhood in Sèmè-Podji, where he lives with his wife and children. René is the family's main bread earner, thanks to the income drawn from his business. He dropped out of middle school, and was then trained as a hairdresser. He's been running this business for three years. With the goal of outfitting his salon with the equipment he needs to do his job properly, as well as to better meet customer demand, René is for the first time seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clippers and haircare products

loans.name: G.s. Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: La señora Yasmina tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 niña, de un año de edad. Ella es integrante del G.S. Nueva Esperanza, se dedica a la venta de frutas, tales como bananos, piñas, y también otros productos como aguacates, surgió desde hace mas de tres años, que fue para el tiempo que nació su hija, y era con esa intención, brindar manutención a su hija, ya que su esposo gana muy poco ya que labora en una zona franca. Otro integrante de este grupo es Luis Manuel, de 51 años el vive con su familia que es de cinco personas, es decir el, su esposa y 3 hijos. El señor obtiene ingresos de la venta de leña, las cuales distribuye en su casa de habitación. Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio, este negocio dio inicio con el propósito de mantener a la familia.  Juntos han decido salir adelante y solicitan este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Ellos tienen diferentes sueños, pero siempre están enfocados en mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yasmine is 23 years old, married, and has one child who is a year old. She is a member of "G.S. Nueva Esperanza" and sells fruits like bananas, pineapples, and other products like avocados for a living. She started doing this about three years ago because her daughter was about to be born and she wanted to help support her since her husband earns very little and working in a free zone. Another member of this group is Luis Manuel, who is 51 and lives with his family of five (his wife and three children). El señor earns his income by selling firewood from his home. He has 10 years experience with this business which he began in order to support his family. Together, they decided to go ahead and apply for this funding to purchase raw materials. They have different dreams, but are always focused on improving their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Benita Lastenia

texts.es:
Benita de 57 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella tiene un puesto de venta de pollos y gallinas afuera de su casa. 

Comenzó la venta de pollos por la falta de oportunidades y porque necesitaban mas ingresos para mantener a sus tres hijos, poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposo ella ha podido mantener su negocio. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder tener mas ventas ella quiere incrementar el numero de pollos para vender por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar pollos y gallinas. En el futuro quiere un local porque ahora solo es un puesto de madera con sombrilla.
texts.en:
Benita is 57 years old and lives in the urban zone, El Guasmo, Guayaquil ( a place inhabited by informal retailers). She has a stand where she sells chickens and hens outside of her house. She began selling chickens due to a lack of opportunities and a need for a larger income in order to care for their three children. Little by little and with help from her husband she has been able to maintain her business. Now, she works from 7:00AM to 1:00PM everyday. In order to have more sales, she wants to increase the number of chickens to sale that is why with this loan she would like to buy chickens and hens. In the future she would like to have a permanent establishment because right now all she has is a wooden stand with an umbrella.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr: L. Estelle est née le 29 Mai 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Estelle vit depuis vingt ans à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à DOSSOU KOKO Germain, Estelle est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Estelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Ayant abandonné très tôt l’école, Estelle a appris la coiffure et l’exerce depuis huit ans. Parallèlement, Estelle vend des mèches, des produits pour cheveux et de façon secondaire, des bijoux dans son atelier de coiffure, situé à son domicile. Estelle achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Estelle sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Estelle L. was born on May 29, 1974, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For 20 years, she's been living in Lokokoukoumè, in Sèmè-Podji. She's married to Germain DOSSOU KOKO, and the mother of three school-attending children. She lives with her husband and children. The couple provides for the family together. After dropping out of school quite early on, Estelle was trained as a hairdresser, a business she's been running for eight years in her salon located at her home. In parallel, she sells hair extensions and haircare products, as well as jewelry, as a secondary business. Estelle gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. For the first time, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster her working capital and better outfit her salon.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and haircare products

loans.name: Ana Sofia

texts.es: La vida de Ana Sofía G. en el  municipio de Malambo transcurre con mucha actividad para poder llevar bienestar a su hogar conformado por  sus 3 hijos en las edades de 8, 10 y 12 años;  ella tiene varios negocios: así como se dedica a la prestación de servicios de alquiler de lavadoras, también vende mercancía como cubrelechos, electrodomésticos menores, pescado y hasta frutas. Su primer negocio lo inició hace ya 6 años, con la venta de bebidas en la casa de su mamá, con el fin de obtener ingresos para ayudar en su hogar al sostenimiento de su familia. Recibió inicialmente un crédito por valor de $1.000.000 COP  compró una maquina de coser y empezó a fabricar cubrelechos y a proponer en este mismo nicho de mercado otros productos para el hogar como electrodomésticos menores, así llegó a tener mas de 30 clientes, e incrementó sus ventas y cuando ahorró, compró una motocicleta  y montó su negocio de servicios de alquiler de lavadoras, hasta que le robaron la moto y ella persistentemente ha seguido sin dejarse debilitar por esas circunstancias difíciles. Ana Sofía siempre está  buscando nuevas oportunidades de negocio por lo que comenzó a vender frutas y pescados desde hace 8 meses y allí ha encontrado también un ingreso estable. Este es su sexto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que ha estado presente apoyándola y de su mano, ha logrado hacer arreglos a su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando por un crédito por valor de $ $1.800.000 COP, para comprar 10 cubrelechos, 4 abanicos, 6 DVD, artículos de cocina, pescado y frutas. Ana Sofía cuenta que aunque en su vida personal ha tenido muchos desafíos, ha logrado  superarlos, por ejemplo el  de quedar sola sin su esposo, dirigiendo la educación de sus hijos, desde que este se marcho del hogar.
texts.en:
There is alot of bustle in Ana Sofia G.'s life in the Malambo district in order to maintain the well being of her household, made up of her three sons who are 8, 10, and 12 years old. She has various businesses such as: renting out washing machines, selling bed covers, small electric appliances, fish, and even fruit. She started her first business 6 years ago selling beverages out of her mother's house with the intent of generating funds to help around the house. She initially received a loan of $1,000,000 COP (approx. $530 USD) that she used to purchase a sewing machine and began making bed covers. From this niche market she established she started to offer minor electrical appliances and this way she was able to accumulate more than 30 clients and increase her sales enough to save up for a motorcycle and start a business of renting out washing machines, that is until her motorcycle was stolen. She has been persistantly continuing on and not letting her difficult circumstances debilitate her. Ana Sofia is always looking for new business opportunities and 8 months ago began selling fruit and fish where she has found a stable source of income. This will be her 6th loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Organization who's been supportive and with them she's been able to make improvements to her home. She is currently requesting a loan for 1.800.000 COP ($975 USD) in order to purchase 10 bed covers, 4 fans, 6 DVDs, kitchen supplies, fish, and fruit. Ana Sofia states that despite the many challenges in her personal life she has been able to overcome them; for example, being left alone overlooking her children's education after her husband left the household.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10 bed covers, 4 fans, 6 DVDs, kitchen supplies, fish, and fruits

loans.name: Agossou Daniel

texts.fr: V. Agossou Daniel est né le 17 Septembre 1985 à Avrankou, dans le département du Plateau. Daniel est marié à OGOU Rébecca, une ménagère. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Daniel s’est installé depuis huit ans au quartier Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il vit avec sa femme et son enfant. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Daniel a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, et s’est consacré ensuite à la couture. Daniel a son atelier de couture à son domicile et y mène cette activité depuis six ans. De façon secondaire, Daniel vend des tissus bazins dans son atelier. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Daniel s’approvisionne. En vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’équiper son atelier de couture, de produits et matériels adaptés aux besoins de la clientèle, Daniel sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Agossou Daniel V. was born on September 17, 1985, in Avrankou, Plateau Department. He's married to Rébecca OGOU, a housewife. The couple has one child, who attends school. Eight years ago, Daniel moved in to the Lokokoukoumè neighborhood in Sèmè-Podji, where he lives with his wife and child. The couple provides for the family together. Daniel dropped out of middle school, and then learned sewing. For more than six years, he's been running a sewing business in his workshop at his home. As a secondary business, Daniel sells "bazin" fabrics. He gets his supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. In order to bolster his working capital and to outfit his sewing workshop with products and materials he needs to satisfy customers, he's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "bazin" fabrics and a sewing machine

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Mabinty K. (pictured second from the right) is the leader of this group. This 45-year-old is a widow with three children. Mabinty has been a businesswoman for a year now. She makes and sells laundry soap. With her share of this loan, she will buy soap-making materials like palm oil, caustic soda, rubber bowls and hand gloves in order to produce a larger quantity of soap for sale.

These are members of the “God Bless Group" from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 800,000 leones each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soap-making materials like palm oil, caustic soda, rubber bowls and hand gloves

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, V. Marthe vit dans ce quartier depuis sa naissance. Marthe est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé, mais Marthe ne vit plus avec son mari. Grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité, Marthe assure les charges de son enfant. Marthe n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Ayant abandonné l’école, Marthe a appris ensuite la coiffure et l’exerce depuis treize ans environs. De façon secondaire, Marthe vend dans son atelier de coiffure, des mèches, des produits pour cheveux et aussi des tissus. Marthe achète ses produits au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Marthe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et d’accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Marthe V. has lived in the Ekpè neighborhood of the commune of Sèmè-Podji since her birth there in 1974. She has one child who has been to school, but no longer lives with her husband. With the income from her business, Marthe can take care of her child's needs. Marthe went to primary school, then dropped out. She learned how to be a hairdresser, and has worked at her trade about 13 years. Additionally, she sells hairpieces and other hair products, and cloth. She buys her stock at Ouando market in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She is asking for her first loan from ALIDé so as to build her inventory and attract more customers.,

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hair products

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 53 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos. El oficio que tiene es de albañil, siendo especialista en hacer pisos, columnas, techos, alzar ladrillos y revestir las paredes de cemento. Cuando aún era joven trabajó de ayudante, ganando así la experiencia de este oficio, siendo actualmente su principal fuente de ingresos, permitiéndole sustentar a su familia. Su eficacia y empeño en el trabajo le ha permitido ganar a sus clientes, quienes muy satisfechos, han recomendado el oficio de Carlos con sus amistades. Disfruta de su trabajo; de esa manera han transcurrido 35  años en esta labor y su mayor impotencia es dejar pasar oportunidades de trabajo, por la falta de material de trabajo. En adelante piensa adquirir maquinarias especiales para instalar mayólicas y de ese modo sus rentas aumenten. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar como hasta hoy lo hace, sus  cuotas. Con sus compañeras de grupo, no tiene dificultades, por lo que son personas muy responsables. Con éste crédito que recibirá, piensa comprar materiales y de ese modo pueda trabajar con tranquilidad y rapidez.
texts.en:
Carlos is 53 years old. He is a responsible and hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his wife and 6 children. His profession is that of a bricklayer, and he is a specialist in making floors, columns, roofs, taking up bricks and coating walls in cement. When he was still young, he worked as an assistant, gaining experience in the profession and presently it is his main source of income, allowing him to support his family. His efficiency and effort at work has allowed him to gain customers who are very satisfied, and they have recommended Carlos to their friends. He enjoys his work; he has spent 35 years doing it and his biggest problem is letting jobs go due to a lack of materials. In the future, he plans on adquiring machinery to install mayolica tiles and in this way increase his profits. This is his tenth loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments as he has done thus far. He has no problems with the other members of the group, because they are very responsible people. With this loan that he will receive, he plans on buying materials and in this way be able to work calmly and quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools to facilitate his work as a bricklayer.

loans.name: Adidja Virginie

texts.fr: Z. Adidja Virginie est née le 19 Août 1979 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Mariée à AGBOHOUNCON Elias, Virginie a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Virginie vit avec sa famille à Podji, dans le département de Sèmè-Podji. Virginie vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui, les différents besoins de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Ayant arrêté très tôt l’école, Virginie a appris ensuite la coiffure, activité qu’elle mène depuis huit ans et qui lui génère des revenus l’aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Parallèlement, Virginie vend des mèches, des produits pour cheveux dans son atelier de coiffure. Virginie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son atelier, par l’achat de divers produits de coiffure adaptés aux multiples demandes de sa clientèle, Virginie sollicite pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Adidja Virginie Z. was born on 19th August 1979 in Adjohoun in the "département" (administrative district) of Ouéme. Married to Elias Agbohouncon, Virginie has two children who are both at school. She lives with her family in Podji, in the "département" of Sèmè-Podji. She helps her husband to provide for the various needs of their family, thanks to the income she gets from her business. Having left school at a very early age, Virginie went on to learn hairdressing and has been doing this for eight years now; this generates income which helps her to cover her needs. At the same time, Virginie sells hair extensions and hair products in her hairdressing workshop. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. With a view to expanding her workshop, by buying various hair products to satisfy the multiple demands of her customers, Virginie is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and hairdressing products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees and buy school supplies

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
El comité San Valentín se encuentra integrada por mujeres activas y trabajadoras quienes se agruparon para trabajar y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
La mayoría de las mujeres de  la zona de Santani se dedican a la cría de animales ya sea para vender o para consumo de la familia.
Ellas se dedican al cuidado de sus familias y al mismo tiempo  trabajan para ayudar a sus maridos ya que todas pertenecen a familias muy humildes y no cuentan con ingresos fijos mensuales, sino que dependen del esfuerzo de cada uno.
Asi la señora Maria se dedica a la cría de aves y cerdos para la venta y también para el consumo familiar. 
Ella vende sus animales ferias que realizan en la ciudad con sus compañeras. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus animales como en la compra de balanceados, vitaminas, minerales y otros para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
The San Valentín committee is made up of active and hard-working women who joined up to work and in this way to help their families. The majority of the women in the Santani area raise animals either for sale or home consumption. They take care of their families, and at the same time work to help their husbands, since they all from very humble families and cannot count on a fixed monthly income, but rather it depends on the effort of each one. So, Maria raises poultry and pigs for sale and for home consumption. She sells her animals in markets in the city with her colleagues. She is seeking the loan to purchase nutritious feed, vitamins, minerals etc to invest in her animals and improve her production.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed, vitamins, minerals etc.

loans.name: Dulce Maria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama DULCE MARIA, porque les gusto el nombre y por que quieren que se endulce su vida. Está ubicado en el Estado de México; en México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.

Magdalena M. García es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 40 años, estudió hasta el 2° año de primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 4 hijos, 1 mujer  y 3 varones.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y bordados de manteles y mandiles que inició hace 1 año la venta de ropa y 13 años los bordados. Solicita el préstamo para surtir en ropa y en hilos para sus bordados. Sus clientes se expresan bien de la señora ya que les vente la ropa en pagos y los bordados que realiza son muy creativos y bonitos.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta e ilusionada ya que podrá crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.   Quiere este crédito para poder darse a conocer en otras comunidades pero necesita tener gran cantidad de surtido para poder realizar las ventas fuera de su comunidad.   También espera poder seguirle dando estudio a sus hijos ya que son los que la motivan a seguir adelante.

Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la Sra. María Luz Se ve los manteles  de Magdalena además de la mandiles y ropa que vende de la cual cuenta con un amplio surtido en la foto.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
De J. Del R. Juana  Venta de Dulces
F. M. Marcela           Venta de Tortillas
H. H. Anatolia          Venta de Tortillas
H. M. Ibeth 	        Venta de Tortillas
M. G. María Luz         Venta de Ropa
R. G. Angela            Venta de Dulces
T. M. Juliana           Venta de Papelería
V. H. Cecilia           Venta de Pollos
texts.en:
This group is called DULCE MARIA (Sweet Maria), because they like the name and because they want life to become sweeter. It’s located in the state of Mexico, in Mexico. The group has 10 members. Magdalena M. García is the president of the group. She is 40 years old, studied until second grade in elementary school, is a merchant and has 4 children in total, 1 girl and 3 boys. She sells clothes and embroidered tablecloths and aprons. She started selling the clothes a year ago and the embroidery 13 years ago. She is soliciting the loan to stock up on clothes and thread for her embroidery. Her customers say good things about her, since she lets them pay for the clothes in instalments and the embroidery she does is very creative and beautiful. She feels very happy and excited requesting the loan, since she will be able to grow her business and increase her sales. She wants this loan so that she can become known in other communities; she needs a large amount of stock in order to sell outside of her community. She also hopes to keep her children in school, since they are the ones that motivate her to get ahead. This photo was taken in the house of Maria Luz. Magdalena’s table clothes are visible, as well as the aprons and clothes that she sells, of which there is an amply supply in the photo. The other members of the group are: De J. Del R. Juana Venta de Dulces F. M. Marcela Venta de Tortillas H. H. Anatolia Venta de Tortillas H. M. Ibeth Venta de Tortillas M. G. María Luz Venta de Ropa R. G. Angela Venta de Dulces T. M. Juliana Venta de Papelería V. H. Cecilia Venta de Pollos

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on clothes and thread for embroidery

loans.name: Marlene Claudett

texts.es:
Marlene de 54 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella vende en un puesto afuera de su casa carnes, pollos para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es viuda. 

Para poder mantener a su familia y por la falta de oportunidades ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en carnes y pollos para venderlos a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener un puesto. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 12h30 todos los días, la libra de carne la vende a $ 2.50, la libra de pollos a $ 1.40. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 12h30 todos los días. 

Para tener mas facilidad al conservar las carnes y pollos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo un congelador. En el futuro quiere tener un local y que su hijo menor se gradue con existo en la universidad.
texts.en:
Marlene, 54 years old, lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (a place inhabited by informal traders). In a stand outside her home, she sells meat and chicken so she can support her children, since she is a widow. In order to support her family and because of the the lack of opportunities, she had to invest her savings in meat and chicken to sell to her acquaintances, and little by little with some effort, she put up her own stand. Now she works from 8:00 am until 12:30 pm every day. A pound of meat sells for $2.50, and a pound of chicken for $1.40. She works from 8:00 am to 12:30 pm every day. To more easily preserve the meat and poultry, she wants to buy a freezer with the loan. In the future, she wants to have a store and wants her youngest son to graduate successfully from university.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase freezer.

loans.name: Don De Dieu Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie-Josée is the leader of a community bank named “Don de Dieu Plus” which is composed of 19 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Marie-Josée is 55 years old and the mother of eight children between the ages of 11 and 37 years old. Three of them go to school. Marie-Josée sells spices at the central market in Kinshasa. She has been in business since 2006, beginning with capital of $50. After learning through her friend about HOPE’s loan program, she decided to join one of its groups in November, 2008. Marie-Josée has already received five loans from HOPE that she repaid correctly. Currently, her business brings in a benefit of $25 per week. With her next loan, she is planning to purchase more spices to increase the inventory of her business. Marie-Josée’s ambition is to be a provider of those products in her area. She runs her business in the middle area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of spices

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: monsieur M. est un homme marié, il réside avecc sa femme dans le quartier de gbenyédi qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, en  2002,il s'est lancée dans le commerce de détail de produits laitiers appelé "FAN MILK". il exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu'il a appelé " COGECO". il voudrait gonfler son stock de produits laitiers qui est épuisé raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits laitiers auprès de la société FAN MILK
texts.en:
Mr. M. is married and lives with his wife in the Gbenyédi district, an outlying area of the city of Lomé. In 2002, he began retailing dairy products called “FAN MILK.” He operates his business in his own shop which he calls “CONGECO.” He would like to replenish his stock of dairy products which is depleted. This is why he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various dairy products from the FAN MILK company.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of FAN MILK dairy products

loans.name: Verónica Magalis

texts.es:
Verónica es una joven de 26 años, casada, con deseo de superación, trabaja como maestra, y sus ideales es poder seguir estudiando para mejorar su vida profesional, como personal.
 Su esposo trabaja como cajero y ambos están haciendo las mejoras a su casa, pequeña pero propia ya que con ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado repellar su casa, ponerle cerámica, y ahora desea  comenzar a hacer su cocina lo que invertirá en la compra de piedra, un metro de arena, cemento, hiero, zinc, perlines para lograr mejor espacio y higiene en su hogar.
texts.en:
Verónica is a young, 26-year-old woman who is married and who desires to get ahead in life. She works as a teacher and her dream is to continue studying to improve her professional life as well as her personal life. Her husband works as a cashier and they are both doing home improvements. Their house is small but they have made it their own, since they have plastered it and installed ceramic tiles with the help of financing. Now they want to begin to build their kitchen. They will invest in the purchase of stone, cement, beams, iron, zinc and a cubic meter of sand to create more space and to improve hygiene in their home.

Translated from Spanish by David Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy construction materials to build her kitchen in order to have more space and to improve hygiene

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Save The Children Group

texts.en:
Alie B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alie was born in Mambolo village, about 28 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple have one child. For over ten years now, Alie has been selling items such as sprays, creams, ready-to-wear-clothes, etc. This is the first loan that Alie and his group members have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Alie will use his share of the loan (500,000 leones) to expand his business; he will buy sprays, creams, and ready-to-wear-clothes, etc., at wholesale prices to add to his stock. 

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy sprays, creams and ready-to-wear-clothes, etc.

loans.name: Komdin Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Komdin” group. They are businesswomen with small-scale businesses in the small town of Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Neneh F.. Neneh, who was born in Kambia, northern Sierra Leone, is age thirty-two and is married with three children. Now, she lives in Waterloo with her husband and children. Her husband is a businessman and two of her children are attending primary school.

Neneh sells firewood, charcoal and foodstuffs and has been a businesswoman for five years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy more firewood and charcoal wholesale to add to her current stock. 

Attached to the group photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and charcoal wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: home improvements

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 65 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijos. Su oficio es la fabricación de muebles, es entonces que se dedica a lijar y armar los muebles, mientras que su hijo corta la madera de acuerdo a las medidas. Su taller está ubicado en el interior de su casa, es un ambiente bastante reducido, donde laboriosamente fabrican diversos modelos, y que gracias a su empeño ha logrado que sus vecinos reconozcan su trabajo. Antes que falleciera su esposo, trabajaban juntos en la carpintería, ahora tomó la batuta su hijo, y juntos sacan adelante su negocio. Han transcurrido 32 años y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es lijar la madera, sin embargo reconoce que es difícil mantenerse en el mercado. Su mayor anhelo es comprar diversas herramientas sofisticadas, para fabricar sus muebles en menor tiempo. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, y sabe que el crédito  le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar  sus cuotas, en su grupo es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará madera al por mayor, para que pueda agilizar y brindar un buen acabado a su muebles.
texts.en:
Marcela, age 65, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her three children. Her occupation is making furniture. She devotes herself to sanding and assembling the furniture. Her son cuts the wood according to the measurements. Her workshop is inside of her house. They work laboriously in a confined area making different models. Thanks to her determination her neighbors appreciate her work. Before her husband died they worked in the carpenter’s shop together. Now it is her son who has taken the baton. Together they get the business ahead. She has been in the business for 32 years. What she likes the best about her work is sanding the wood. She does realize that it is difficult to stay in the market. Her greatest wish is to buy different sophisticated tools to make their furniture in less time. This is her 11th loan with MFP. She knows that the loan will be very beneficial in order to increase her working capital. She pledges to make her payments. In her group she is a very happy and responsible member. She will use the requested loan to buy wholesale wood. She will do this in order to be able to speed up the process and give good finishings to her furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up and selling corn

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa del señor Raúl T..

El señor Raúl T. M. es un hombre responsable y trabajador, es padre de 2 hijos a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. En este momento el desea arreglar el techo de su casa por que se encuentra muy deteriorado y en temporada de lluvia se traspasa el agua y teme que pueda perjudicar en sus aparatos electrónicos y pueda suceder algún desperfecto. 
Raúl T. trabaja como chofer de trasporte de maquiladoras y su esposa en una maquiladora como costurera es así como ellos se ayudan para cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
The person in the picture is the wife of Raúl T.. Raúl T. M. is a responsible, hardworking man. He is the father of two children, and wants to offer them a better quality of life. At present he would like to fix the roof of his home, because it is in a poor state of repair. During the rainy season it lets the water in and Raúl T. is concerned that this will damage his electrical items and spoil the things in thier home. Because Raúl T. works as a driver for factories in the area, and his wife is a semstress in one of the factories, they will be able to cover the repayments on the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make their home waterproof

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es: Minerva Vázquez G.  cuenta con un negocio de Abarrotes llamado “Yoely” este ya tiene establecido un año en cual ofrece buena calidad y un bajo precio a comparación de otras tiendas. La señora desea comprar mercancía para surtir su tienda y así incrementar sus ventas. El esposo le ayuda económicamente pues el trabaja como albañil  para poder cubrir los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Minerva Vázquez G. has a grocery shop called “Yoely”, which she set up a year ago. She offers good quality and low prices compared to similar stores. She would like to buy more stock for her shop and so increase her sales. Her husband helps with the family's finances by working as a bricklayer.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To put a roof on his workshop

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz  tiene 55 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora y alegre,  vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia y sus 4 hijos. Años atrás vendía salchipapas en la puerta D. su casa y lo tuvo que dejar por motivos D. salud. A partir D. esa fecha, prefirió instalar su bodega en un espacio dentro D. su casa. Sus mayores ventas son las bebidas gasificadas y energizantes, donD. la mayoría D. sus clientes son jóvenes deportistas.  Han transcurrido 2 años y se siente más tranquila por su estabilidad económica, además no perjudica su salud, que es lo más importante para ella. En adelante desea comprarse un andamio en las que pueda exhibir sus productos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir siendo muy puntual, ya que sabe lo beneficioso que será para que aumente su capital D. trabajo. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería y sobre toda más bebidas.
texts.en:
