Luz, age 55, is a very hard-working and happy woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and their four children. Years ago she sold “salchipapas” ((a dish maD. of potatoes and fried sausage) in the doorway of her house. She had to stop for health reasons. After that she preferred to set up her store in a space in her house. The things she sells the most are carbonated drinks and energy drinks. Most of her customers are young athletes. Two years have passed, and she feels more at ease about her finances. Also, it does not jeopardize her health, which is the most important thing to her. Later on she wishes to buy a platform where she can display her products. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She pledges to continue being very punctual. She knows how beneficial it will be to increase her working capital. She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise, especially more drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products and drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hasta el mercado del distrito para adquirirlos. Nieves se encarga de que sus clientes encuentren  los productos que necesitan en su establecimiento, por ello trata de ofrecerles productos de buena calidad, esto y el trato amable con el que los atiende han hecho que actualmente cuente con un grupo de clientes fieles que mantienen una preferencia por su negocio.
Su esposo trabaja como transportista en una mototaxi (motocicleta con una cabina anexada que sirve para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros), con los ingresos que ambos perciben sacan adelante a su hogar.
Nieves desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos para ofrecérselos a sus clientes, por ello ha solcicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su meta.
Nieves es una mujer tranquila y responsable, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Nieves is a 47 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the Chepén district, an agricultural area with a lot of commercial trafic, in the province of the same name. The area is in the La Libertad region, an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She is in business selling groceries and household necessities, from a store in her home. She provides her customers with all sorts of everyday products, which they used to have to go all the way to the district market to buy. Nieves likes to make sure her customers always find the quality goods they want in her shop. Together with her friendly manner, this has meant she now has a group of loyal customers who choose to make their purchases in her shop. Her husband works driving a mototaxi (which is a motorcyle with a cab on the back that is used for transporting goods or passengers). With the two incomes they share in the running of their home. Nieves wants to grow her business by purchasing additional stock to offer her customers, so she has requested a loan of 2000 soles from [field partner] Edpyme Alternativa that will help her realize her aims. Nieves is a calm and responsible woman. In the area where she lives, her neighbours consider her a reliable person. She has already been working with this organisation and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with regard to her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional stock for the store she runs in her home

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Hubert de 30 años y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Los días de Amelia comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, que junto a su esposo recorren una hora de caminata, hasta llegar a sus cultivos, es ahí donde comienzan su labor diaria, trabajando en la tierra, cultivando alverja, papa y zanahoria, siendo productos de buena calidad, motivo por el cual son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, de esa manera han transcurrido 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su grupo comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil doscientos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Amelia is 32 years old and is a simple hard working woman. She lives in her parents’ house, along with her 30 year old husband, Humbert. What she wants most is to excel in life by overcoming its obstacles. Amelia’s days begin early in the morning, when she and her husband walk for an hour to get to where their crops are. This is where they begin their daily chores; working the land, raising peas, potatoes and carrots. Since their crops are of good quality, they are sought after in central market in Tarma. What they enjoy most about their work is caring for their crops. They’ve been doing this for eight years and they consider the most difficult part to be transporting their goods to Tarma, because the sacs they carry are very heavy and it wears them out. In the future they would like to buy some more land so that they can increase their production. This will be their sixth loan through MFP and they expect to be on time with their payments, because they don’t want to cause problems for their communal group. They will use the 1,200 PEN ($450) to buy fertilizer to improve their crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ronald de 31 años y su querida hija Melisa de 8 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Las fértiles tierras del poblado de Huayaunioc, le han brindado a Ana un lugar ideal para cultivar alverja, papa y maíz, productos con los que alimenta a su familia y a la vez gana el dinero necesario para el sustento de su hogar, ya que debido a la buena calidad de su cosecha siempre obtiene muy buenos precios en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, que es el lugar donde vende sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende el progreso de su negocio, lleva 4 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que atacan sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para que pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus compañeras de su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida, por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus chacras e invertirá también en la compra de insumos para evitar que la plaga de insectos dañe sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana, 31 years old, is a very simple and cheerful mother. She lives in a house she owns with her husband, Ronald, who is 31 years old, and their beloved eight year-old daughter, Melisa. They are the principal motive behind all of her efforts. The fertile lands of the village of Huayaunioc have provided Ana with an ideal place to cultivate peas, potatoes, and corn. These crops feed her family, as well as bring in the income needed to sustain their home. Due to the high quality of her crops, she always gets a very good price when she sells them at the principal market in the city of Tarma. Her favorite thing about her job is planting her lands, as she knows that the progress of her business depends on this activity. She has been doing this type of work for four years, and she considers the most difficult part to be protecting her crops from the insects that attack her plantation. With time, she hopes to buy new lands so that she can increase her production. This is her fourth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows that she must make her repayments on time, and she is motivated to do so so that she will not cause problems for the other members of her communal bank. She is very well liked in the group for bringing order to their meetings. With the 3,000 nuevos soles that she is requesting, she will buy more fertilizer for her farm, as well as materials to help avoid insects that damage her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other materials to care for her crops

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Ciudad de Dios, una comunidad pequeña perteneciente al distrito de Guadalupe, provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de comida y refrigerios dentro de dos instituciones educativas de la zona en donde vive, por las mañanas ofrece su mercadería en un colegio primario y en las tardes hace la misma labor en un colegio secundario, generalmente ofrece platos de comida y golosinas durante el recreo de los estudiantes, ella elabora esos platos con mucha responsabilidad, ya que sus principales clientes son menores de edad.

El negocio goza de buena acogida y cada vez está creciendo mas, por ello ha creído conveniente ampliarlo con la compra de mas insumos con los cuales pueda preparar mas platos de comida y ampliar sus ventas, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Juana es una mujer responsable y honesta. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her family in the Ciudad de Dios sector. It is a small community, which belongs to the Guadalupe district, Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region. It is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells food and refreshments in two educational institutions in the area where she lives. In the morning she sells her merchandise in an elementary school. In the afternoons she does the same work at a high school. She generally sells dishes of food and sweets during the students’ recess. She makes these dishes with great care because her main customers are minors. The business is well received, and it is growing. That is why she believes that it is fitting to expand it with the purchase of more supplies. Then she could prepare more dishes and increase her sales in order to achieve her goal. She believes that is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles, which will help her meet her objective. Juan is a responsible and honest woman. She has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase her business of selling food in schools

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - Guadalupe - Pacasmayo - La Libert

loans.name: Loma Bonita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LOMA BONITA, porque asi se le conoce al lugar donde radican desde hace mucho tiempo. Está ubicado en el Estado de México en México.  El grupo está conformado por  13 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 

Carolina Cristina Castañeda García es la tesorera del grupo. Tiene 31, estudió hasta el 2° año de secundaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos 1 mujer y 1 varón.  Ella se dedica a la venta de trastes y cosméticos que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para surtir más mercancía de trastes y cosméticos. Sus clientes comentan que ella comenzó sus ventas ofreciéndolos de casa en casa para darse a conocer y que les gusta comprar con ella ya que es muy cumplida para la entrega de los productos y por la misma confianza que ya le tienen prefieren comprar con ella que  en otros lugares. El negocio lo inicio por que la motivo su suegra a vender, empezó por los cosméticos y de ahí vio la opción de vender los trastes ya que era algo que sus clientas le solicitaban.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente motivada y contenta por que sabe que va a poder superarse.   Quiere este crédito para poder iniciar la construcción de un local en su casa para que sus clientes tengan un lugar en donde poder comprarle sus productos y que así mismo su negocio crezca.   También espera que el crecimiento de sus ventas le permita seguirles dando estudio a sus hijos y apoyar en el crecimiento de su casa.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
YAZMIN H.L.                Venta de Calzado
TOMASA ARACELI A.G.        Venta de Ropa
ROCIO C.R.                 Venta de Frutas y Verduras
JULIA E.R.                 Venta de  Artículos para el Hogar
GRACIELA E.Z. 	           Venta de Calzado
DULCE MARIA G..B.          Venta de Calzado
TERESA G..C.               Venta de Comida
SOCORRO TRINIDAD G.C       Venta de Comida
SUSANA P.P.                Venta de Jarcería
ZITA V.F.                  Venta de Calzado
CONCEPCION Z. A.           Venta de Cosmético
JOSEFINA Z.G.              Venta de Papelería y Mercería
texts.en:
This group is named “Loma Bonita” (Pretty Hill) because that is how the place where they have lived for a long time is known. It is located in the state of Mexico in Mexico. The group is comprised of 13 members. This is the first time they have asked CrediComún for a loan. Carolina Cristina Castañeda García is the treasurer of the group. She is 31 years old, and she attended school until her second year of high school. She is a merchant. She has two children, a son and a daughter. She sells cooking utensils and cosmetics. She started two years ago. She is requesting a loan to stock more cooking utensils and cosmetics. Her customers say that she started her sales by selling door to door to get to know them and what they like to buy from her. She is very reliable about delivering the products. Because of the confidence they have in her they prefer to buy from her instead of other places. She started the business because her mother-in-law suggested that she sell. She started with cosmetics, and from there she saw the option of selling cooking utensils. She saw that her customers were asking her for cooking utensils. At the time of requesting this loan she feels motivated and happy because she knows that she will be able to do well. She wants this loan to be able to start the construction of a place in her house. This is for her customers to have a place where they can buy her products. It is also so that her business will grow. She hopes that the sales increase will allow her to keep providing an education to her children and will help with the expansion of her house. The other members of the group are: YAZMIN H.L. Sells footwear TOMASA ARACELI A.G. Sells clothes ROCIO C.R. Sells fruit and vegetables JULIA E.R. Sells items for the home GRACIELA E.Z. Sells footwear DULCE MARIA G..B. Sells footwear TERESA G..C. Sells food SOCORRO TRINIDAD G.C Sells food SUSANA P.P. Sells cleaning supplies ZITA V.F. Sells footwear CONCEPCION Z. A. Sells cosmetics JOSEFINA Z.G. Sells stationery and sewing supplies

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cooking utensils and cosmetics

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
El señor Cristino Benítez D. de 56 años de edad casado con casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de hogar es propietario de una despensa que cuenta con más de 12  años de antigüedad.
Mediante el buen trato y también porque mantiene bien surtido  su negocio actualmente cuenta con cliente formada.
El ademas se dedia la agricultura, tiene produccion en general para el consumo de la familia.
El solicita el crédito para el pago de mano de obra utilizada para arar el terreno preparado para la siembra.
texts.en:
Mr. Cristino Benítez D. is a 56-year-old married man who owns a home with all the amenities. He owns a general store and has 12 years of experience. Because of his great customer service and well-stocked shop, he currently has a solid client base.

He also works in agriculture. He grows general crops for his family's consumption.

He is requesting this loan in order to pay for the farmhands that he will hire to plow the fields and prepare them for the sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay laborers

loans.name: Jesus Aurelina

texts.es:
Jesús de 48 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella tiene un taller de costura desde que se quedo soltera con cinco hijos. 

Comenzó a coser para poder mantener a sus hijos,  poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar una maquina de coser, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella tiene 8 años con su taller, trabaja en su casa ya que no tiene un local, trabaja de lunes a domingos. 

Para poder seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y una maquina de coser, en el futuro quiere comprar una maquina industrial para repartir en almacenes.
texts.en:
Jesus is 48 years old and lives in el Guasmo de Guayaquil (an area inhabited by informal vendors). She has had her own sewing workshop ever since she got a divorce and had to raise her five children.

She started working in order to support her children. Little by little, after some effort, she was able to purchase a sewing machine. She has now been in business for the last 8 years. She works from home as she has no office space. She works Monday through Sunday.

In order to continue with her business, she wants to purchase fabric and a sewing machine with the loan money. In the future, she would like to purchase an industrial sewing machine so that she can supply garments to warehouses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Marisol De La Cruz

texts.es: La señora Marisol tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de nueve años de edad que está a su cargo. Su esposo labora en el área de jardinería brindando sus servicios para los viveros. Marisol se dedica a una pulpería en su casa de habitación, Allí vende desde granos básicos hasta golosinas para llamar la atención de los clientes que habitan cerca. Ella ya tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó vendiendo solamente golosinas, y con el aporte de su esposo más la reinversión realizada al negocio ha podido ir prosperando para tener un negocio más grande. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos tal como arroz, fríjol, azúcar y aceite principalmente. Su sueño es llegar a ver su negocio con más productos, más surtido con productos que demanda la población, para brindar más facilidades económicas a su hijo y que pueda prepararse en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ms. Marisol is a 30-year-old married mother of a 9-year-old boy who is under her care. Her husband works in gardening, providing nursery services. Marisol runs a general store from her home. She sells anything from staple grains to candy in order to attract customers in the area. She has been in business for 6 years. She started out by selling only candy, and with her husband's contribution plus the reinvestment in the business, it has been able to prosper and expand. This loan will be invested in purchasing mainly staple grains like rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil. Her dream is to be able to see her business have a greater variety of products that are in high demand so that she can offer her son financial stability and prepare him for college.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase basic need items, dairy products, candy, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wholesale rice, beans, cooking oil and plantains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase undergarments, hangers, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wholesale staple grains (rice, cooking oil, beans)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, sodas, "Diana" snacks, diapers and others

loans.name: Felix Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Félix Ramón G. tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres y hermana en su casa propia.
El señor Félix posee una despensa bien surtida junto con su hermana en su domicilio, además el elabora masas, tortas, pan casero y otros.
Mediante esta actividad ellos pueden mantener su hogar, solventar sus gastos y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.
Ellos hoy día está solicitando el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías tales como: panificados, bebidas, artículos no perecederos, pollos y otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Ramón G. is 40 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and sister in their own house. Mr. Felix and his sister have a well-stocked grocery store in their house. He also makes dough, cakes, homemade bread, and other goods. In this manner, they are able to support their household, meet their expenses, and cover whatever unexpected things might come up. Today, they are requesting this loan in order to purchase more merchandise, such as: baked goods, drinks, non-perishable goods, chickens, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baked goods, drinks, non-perishable goods, chickens, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy undergarments for children and adults

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy firewood, beans, and cheese

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with two children. She sells women's clothing at the Ivano-Frankivsk open market. Irina has been in this business for 15 years. She has two business locations and one employee. This business is the only source of income for Irina and her children.

Irina would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase the variety of clothing she stocks. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income. Irina's goal is to save enough money to help her children enroll in college.

loans.use: To increase the variety of clothing stocked

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase childrens' clothing and other childrens' items

loans.name: Fidelfia

texts.es:
La señora Filadelfia T. D. C. tiene 62 años D. edad, está casada desD. hace mucho tiempo con el señor Rodolfo C. y viven en su propia casa. 
La señora Filadelfia es comerciante, posee desD. hace mucho tiempo una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio, ha empezado con kiosko pequeño y luego ha ido creciendo su comercio. 
 Ella tiene su clientela ya formada en la zona, ya que su comercio posee D. todo  y gracias a eso la clientela se acerca constantemente a realizar sus compras. 
 Su esposo el señor Rodolfo le ayuda en el negocio, quien además es mecánico y realiza trabajos desD. su domicilio. 
Gracias a estas actividades ellos han podido sacar adelante su hogar, solventar los gastos y educar a sus hijos. 
La cliente solicita este crédito para la compra D. mas mercaderías para su despensa, tales como: bebidas, carnes, pollos, harinas, fideos, arroz, yerbas, artículos enlatados y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fidelfia T. D. C. is 62 years old and has been married to Mr. Rodolfo C. for a long time now. They live in their own house together. Fidelfia is a merchant with a well-stocked pantry in her home. She began with a small kiosk and has gradually grown her business. She already has a well-established clientele in her region, since her business has a great variety of products. Thanks to this, they come constantly to make purchases. Her husband, Rodolfo, helps her with the business and is also a mechanic who works from home. Due to these activities, they have been able to get ahead, settle their debts, and educate their children. They have requested this loan for the purchase of more merchandise for their pantry, such as drinks, meat, chicken, flour, noodles, rice, spices, canned goods, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks, meat, chicken, flour, noodles, rice, spices, and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy high-quality clothing for men and women and men's dress shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of trays, tables, and handicrafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of vegetables such as tomato and onion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of basic grains such as rice, wheat, soy, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of various products, such as basic grains, sodas, candy, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of mayonnaise, sauces, potatoes, sausage, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy different types of cheese.

loans.name: Oriflame Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oriflame está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras quienes han sido beneficiadas tanto en la oferta de créditos como en el desarrollo empresarial y de autoestima por medio de los programas de  capacitación los cuales son  Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género, Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género, Intercambio Empresarial  y Articulación de Actores. Esto según expresaron les ha permitido administras de manera asertiva su negocio.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Ghisela Miranda Hernández de 28 años mujer trabajadora quien es  asistente dental y comerciante de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 2 ½ años. Hernández es madre de dos pequeños de 10 y 4 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente, ella actualmente invertirá el crédito mercadería en ropa. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Rosa María Baldosa comerciante de productos oriflame y Yecenia Zeledón G. quien tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ella desea seguir trabajando  y progresando.
texts.en:
The Oriflame group is made up of three hardworking, striving and enterprising women. They have benefited both from the offers of loans and the business and self esteem development through the training programs. These programs are: Human Development with Focus on Gender, Business Development with Focus on Gender, Business Exchange and Coordination of Actors. According to what they have said, this has allowed assertive management at their businesses. The group coordinator is Mrs. Ghisela Miranda Hernández, who is 28 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has been a dental assistant and clothing and cosmetics seller for 2 ½ years. Hernández is a mother of two small children of 10 and 4 years old for whom she works very hard. She will invest the loan in clothing merchandise. The other members of the group are Rosa María Baldosa, seller of Oriflame products, and Yecenia Zeledón G., who has a small grocery store. She wants to keep working and getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing merchandise

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
Jose Arturo R. T. tiene 30 años.  Es casado vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 2 hijos, Mila (2) y Diojenes (1). 

Jose es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de ciclo corto maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de maíz y cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para sacar a la familia adelante. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta cocinar, y celebrar las fiestas del Recinto San Jose en el mes de Diciembre.
texts.en:
José Arturo Rodríguez T., 30, is married and lives in Chillanes canton, Recinto San José, Estero Salado parish. He has two children: Mila, 2, and Diógenes, 1. José is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank located fifteen minutes from Estero Salado parish and two hours from the Chillanes agency. It has 19 members who are farmers. José farms short growing cycle corn and cacao. He makes his purchases monthly in Matilde Esther and he makes his sales in Matilde Esther. He is asking for funds to buy corn and cacao to plant in order to increase his business. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have enough money to get his family ahead in life. He says that the greatest challenge he faces is during harvest time because rain has damaged the access roads He enjoys cooking and celebrating the Recinto San José festivals in December.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and cacao plants.

loans.name: Luchando Para Vivir Group

texts.en:
Wanda is the coordinator of her group, Luchando Para Vivir 3 & 4 (Fighting to live). She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are other businesses doing the same activity as hers, and looking for new clients.

Wanda is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying silver jewelry to sell in her neighborhood and by visiting new clients (like secretaries, bank tellers) at their places of work. She will use the profits to build a water cistern in her house and her dream is to finish high school. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying being with her family and operating her business.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, and an area famous for its tobacco and beef production. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry (rings, bracelets, chains, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reyna Elizabeth, tiene 27 años, resiD. en el Municipio D. Jucuapa, departamento D. Usulután,  es casada tiene un hijo D. 6 años y administra su negocio D. venta D. hot dog. 
Inicio el negocio hace 4 años, ella atienD. el negocio en un horario D. 8:00 am- 5:00 pm, con os ingresos del negocio apoya economicamente a la familia. Reyna solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en compra D. materiales como son: panes, jamón, pollo , mayonesa y bebidas, con esta inversión genera crecimiento al negocio, ofrece mas  productos a los clientes. 
Las aspiraciones son crecer como microempresaria, tener un negocio que le permita generar mayores ingresos para mejorar sistema D. vida para ella y la familia.
texts.en:
Reina Elizabeth is 27, lives in the Municipality of Jucapa in the Usulutan department, is married with a 6 year old son and runs her own hot dog sales business. She started the business 4 years ago and keeps a 8:00am to 5:00pm schedule. She uses the income from this business to support her family. Reina is requesting a loan to invest in goods such as: buns, ham, chicken, mayonnaise and beverages in order to grow the business by offering a wider variety of products to her customers. She aspires to continue growing as a micro-business owner, and to have a business that generates more income to improve life for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods such as: buns, ham, chicken, mayonnaise and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new and used magazines, books, almanacs, etc.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 31 años, comparte su vida con sus tres hijos aún pequeños, juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de productos de belleza, pues requería de una actividad que le permitiera dedicarse a sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Han trascurrido 6 años y su estilo de trabajo consiste en comprar cosméticos en oferta, tendiendo en stock la cantidad necesaria para poder venderlo a un precio conveniente, de esa manera logra aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro espera tener un bazar o tienda donde pueda ofrecer los productos de belleza que posee, como el colocar vitrinas para exhibirlo y asegurar la venta rápidamente. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos y así tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Jenny is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her three young children. She sells beauty products, an activity that allows her to stay home and care for her school-age children. Jenny's business model consists of buying products at discounted prices, then selling them for a profit. She has had this business for six years. In the future, Jenny hopes to have her own store and to offer her products in display cases. This is Jenny's first loan with Kiva partner MFP and she promises to be timely with her payments. With the loan, she will buy more beauty products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beauty products

loans.name: Cueto Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Cueto está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Mercedes P. Gonzales de 28 años por el  deseo de autosuperarse y adquirir ingresos extras instalo una pequeña venta desde hace tres años.
Los otros integrantes son Luz Adilia S. propietaria de un pequeño bar que inicio hace 12 años y Francisco Gutiérrez quien tiene un pequeño taller de recarga de baterías. 
Este grupo ha sido participes  tanto en la oferta de créditos como en el desarrollo empresarial y de autoestima por medio de los programas de  capacitación los cuales son  Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género, Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género, Intercambio Empresarial  y Articulación de Actores. Esto según expresaron les ha permitido administras su negocio.
texts.en:
The Cueto group is made up of three hard-working and enterprises people. One of these is 28 year old Mercedes P. Gonzales, who started a small store 3 years ago following her desire to improve herself and her income. The other members are Luz Adilia S. who owns a small bar she founded 12 years ago and Francisco G. who has a small battery recharging shop. This group has taken part in loans as well as courses in business development and self esteem such as: Human Development with Gender Emphasis, Business Exchange and Intercommunication Skills. They say these have allowed them to manage their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic grains, meat, snacks, etc

loans.name: Enrique Walter

texts.es:
Enrique Walter C. M. tiene 62 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. No tiene  hijos.
 
Enrique es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Enrique se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y maracuyá. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao y maracuyá para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para sacar a la familia adelante. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales en el Recinto.
texts.en:
Enrique Walter C. M. is 62 years old. His is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Recinto San Jose, Estero Salado parish. He has no children. Enrique is a member of the communal bank "Fronteras Unidas," which is located 15 minutes from Estero Salado parish and 2 hours from the agency in Chillanes. This communal bank has 19 members who work in agriculture. Enrique is a farmer who cultivates cocoa and passion fruit. He makes his purchases every month in Matilde Esther, and he also makes his sales there as well. He requests a loan to purchase cocoa and passion fruit to plant to expand his business. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have money to improve his family's standard of living. The challenge that he faces in this harvest time is that the access roads get damaged during the rains. He enjoys participating in the patron saint day festivities in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cocoa and passion fruit to plant to increase his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase baked goods and telephone accesories

loans.name: Magali Del Rosario

texts.es: Magali del Rosario tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que están bajo su cargo. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, inicio hace mas de 12 años con muy pocos productos, debido a que no poseía mucho capital de trabajo, por lo que poco a poco es que ha ido mejorando su actividad ya que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar cada día más. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, juegos, pan y galletas. Por lo que sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo pues le gustaría mantener siempre esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
Magali del Rosario, 45, has two children under her care. This isn’t the first time she has sought funding for the good functioning of her business. She has a small grocery store that she started with just a few items 12 years ago because she didn’t have much capital. Gradually she has been improving her store and she is always looking for ways to improve daily. The reason for this financing is to buy stock items for her store like: basic grains, sweets, natural beverages, juices, bread and cookies. Her dream is to increase her working capital because she’d like to keep this economic activity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Walter Ufredo

texts.es:
Walter Ufredo A. T. tiene 37 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. No tiene  hijos. 

Walter es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar un terreno. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta cuidar animales.
texts.en:
Walter Ufredo A. T. is 37 years old. He is single and lives in Chillanes Canton, Recinto San Jose, Estero Salado Parish. He does not have children. Walter is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank. It is located fifteen minutes from Estero Salado Parish and two hours from the agency in Chillanes. This bank has 19 members. The Community works in agriculture. Walter works in agriculture, growing cocoa beans. He makes his purchases every month in Matilde Esther. He also makes his sales in Matilde Esther. Walter is requesting the loan to buy cocoa beans for planting to expand his business. He thinks the loan is a chance to get ahead. His dream is to have money to buy land. The challenge he faces is at harvest time, since the access roads are damaged by the rain. He likes taking care of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cocoa beans to plant

loans.name: Flor Aracely

texts.es:
Flor Aracely M. G. tiene 27 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. No tiene  hijos.
 
Flor  es un socia de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Flor se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en las misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para comprar un pequeño terreno. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales en el mes de Noviembre y realizar juegos deportivos.
texts.en:
Flor Aracely Marín Guamán, 27, is single and lives in Chillanes canton in Recinto San José, Estero Salado parish. She has no children. Flor is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank located fifteen minutes from Estero Salado parish, two hours from the Chillanes agency. It has 19 members who are farmers. Flor farms cacao. She makes her purchases in Matilde Esther monthly and does her sales there too. She is asking for funding to buy cacao to plant and increase her business. She feels that the loan is a good way to get ahead. Her dream is to have money to buy a small plot of land. The challenge she faces is during harvest because the rains damaged the access roads. She enjoys celebrating the patron saint day festivities in November and to play sports.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cacao to plant.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de frutas en el interior del mercado de su localidad, ella ofrece a sus clientes frutas frescas de estación, el negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a que este centro de abastos es el principal de la localidad, Miguelina siempre atiende a sus clientes con un trato amable, por lo que cuenta siempre con un grupo de clientes fidelizados.

Miguelina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su meta.

Miguelina es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa, diariamente se esfuerza al máximo para poder percibir mayores ganancias y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Miguelina, 60, is a mother who lives with her husband and children in the San Pedro de Lloc district which is part of Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the last ten years she has been a fruit vendor inside her town’s market. She stocks seasonal fresh fruit. Her business is well received because this is the area’s main foodstuffs market. Miguelina always tends to her customers with kindness so she has a group of regular customers she can count on. Miguelina would like to expand her stock of merchandise to increase her sales and generate higher profits. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to help her reach this goal. Miguelina is a hard working, dedicated person who puts in the greatest effort daily in order to earn the best profits and help her family succeed. She has collaborated with our institution in the past and has always repaid in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Rufo Alcivar

texts.es:
Rufo Alcivar L. M. tiene 30 años.  Estado civil Unión Libre vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 2 hijos, Paola (9) y Alejandro (6). 

Rufo  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Rufo se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y maracuya. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en las misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao y maracuya para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para tener un negocio propio. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta las festividades de la localidad y los programas en nuestro Recinto.
texts.en:
Rufo Alcivar L. M., 30, is in a common law relationship. He lives in Chillanes canton, Recinto San José, Estero Salado parish. He has two children: Paola, 9 and Alejandro, 6. Rufo is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank fifteen minutes from Estero Salado parish, two hours from the Chillanes agency. It has 19 members who are farmers. Rufo farms cacao and passion fruit. He makes his purchases monthly in Matilde Esther and his sales in the same location. He is asking for funding to buy cacao and passion fruit to plant and increase his business. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have enough money to own his own business. The challenge he faces is during harvest time because rains damaged the access roads. He enjoys the locality’s festivals and the programs in our Recinto.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cacao and passion fruit.

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es:
Carlos Emilio A. T. tiene 28 años.  Estado civil Unión Libre vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 2 hijos. 

Carlos  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y naranja. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en las misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao y naranja para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para mejorar el negocio. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales de cada año.
texts.en:
Carlos Emilio A. T., 28, is in a common law relationship. He lives in Chillanes canton, Recinto San José, Estero Salado parish. He has two children. Carlos is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank located 15 minutes from Estero Salado parish, two hours from the Chillanes offices. It has 19 members who are farmers. Carlos farms cacao and oranges. He makes his purchases monthly in Matilde Esther and his sales are there too. He is asking for funding to buy cacao and orange plants to plant in order to expand his business. He feels that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have money to improve his business. The challenge he faces is during harvest time because rains damaged the access roads. He enjoys celebrating the patron saint festivities every year.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cacao and orange to plant.
